95501.name: Ninja Kids
95501.description:
User Summary

Play one of four cute looking colorful ninja kid characters. Beat up various bad guys through 7 levels in an attempt to defeat the final boss and win the game.

95502.name: Nightmare in the Dark
95502.description:
User Summary

This game is similar to Bubble Bobble but wraps it as an adventure with a horror theme. Use fireballs on ghosts, ghouls and other horror monsters. They then catch on fire and can be tossed at other monsters.

Work through 5 puzzle/platform levels to win the game.

95503.name: Donkey: It's a Kick!
95503.description:
Donkey It's a Kick! has just come out with its beautiful 2nd Edition packaging and high-quality cards to withstand the excitement that this game generates!

1. Place one less puck in the middle of the table than there are players.
2. Dealer reads aloud the instructions on the Kicker Card, which will explain the challenge for this round of play. Dealer then deals the PLAYING CARDS accordingly.
3. While fulfilling the challenge of the Kicker Card, each player races to get the qualifying hand to grab the first puck from the table. If a player grabs a puck, each remaining player must quickly try to grab a puck. One player will come up short. That player scores the letter "D" on their score card.
5. Once a player's score card spells D-O-N-K-E-Y, that player is officially out of the game, but is allowed to remain in play and wreak havoc on the remaining players in an effort to take them down with him.

You won't get bored with this game! Each Kicker Card challenge makes every round unique! In addition, players get to "police" other players and give them an unwanted letter score if they "slip up." Seasoned players of 8 or even 9 at a table will have this game over in 45 minutes or less! Once there's a D-O-N-K-E-Y in the game, the players start dropping like flies. There may only be one champion, but everyone walks away a winner with this game! Absolutely as much fun to lose as it is to win!

95504.description:
Inside this supplement for Flames of War you will find the history of the Allied liberation of Italy from Messina to Rome.

Options to field a rifle company from the 3rd US Infantry Division, the Canadian and American First Special Service Force (the Devil's Brigade).

Options to field three different companies of the Hermann Goring Fallschirmpanzerdivision. Options to field companies from the 362nd and 715th Infantry Divisions resurrected from the ashes of Stalingrad and re-equipped with the newest and best Germany has to offer.

Painting guides and color plates are provided for the forces covered by the rules.

There is also a scenario covering the key battle of Cisterna.
95504.name: Flames of War: Dogs & Devils

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

95505.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 16 - Nov 2007)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

95505.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine, written entirely by Matt Borselli.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction
-Savage (Forgotten) Realms!
-Review: Behind the Spells
-What I'm Reading: Confessions of a part-Time Sorceress

95506.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 17 - Nov 2007)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

95506.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine, written entirely by Matt Borselli.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Nostalgia
-What I'm Reading: Keep on the Borderlands
-d20 stats for Borderlands NPCs
-When I Was a Killer GM

95507.name: Avalanche Fruit Stand
95507.description:
from game website

Are you steady enough to work at this fun fruit stand? Spin the wheel, then use the jumbo tweezers to pick or place fruit. In Avalanche Fruit Stand players are stacking small fruit-figures on a pile with the goal to not be the one who causes it to tumble.

Includes 40 fruit counters (5 different fruits), 2 jumbo tweezers, picture spinner, and adjustable cardboard fruit stand/storage box measuring 6"L x 9.5"W x 13.75"H

95509.name: Prophet Search: Ezra Taft Benson
95509.description:
Objective:
To gain more knowledge of the life and personality of the prophet.

To play each player takes a game card, and as questions about the Prophet Ezra Taft Benson are shared. Players who have the answer on their game card put a marker on that spot. First one to have four markers in a row wins.

95510.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 18 - Dec 2007)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

rpgissuearticle.38380: Gaming Podcast Review: #1 All Games Considered

95510.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine, written entirely by Matt Borselli.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Gamer ADD
-Seven Leagues was All She Wrote
-That Bright spot in the Sky
-Gaming Podcast review #1
-To Donate or Not Donate

95512.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 19 - Dec 2007)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

95512.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine, written entirely by Matt Borselli.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction
-Modern Odd Game Design
-Gaming Podcast Review: Godzilla Gaming Podcast
-What I'm Reading: The Saga of the Bloody Benders
-Review: Knowledge (Current Events) 'zine
-Preview: Mutant Future

95513.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 20 - Jan 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

95513.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

Second year of production!

CONTENTS:
-Introduction
-Podcast review: The Rolemonkeys
-All About Orcs
-My Style: I Commit An Atrocity
-Savage Worlds Changeling! Project

95514.name: Shock: Human Contact
95514.description:
Shock:Human Contact is a stand-alone focus of the rules of Shock: Social Science Fiction designed for the galaxy of the Academy. With powers of reason and democracy forged in the fires of a brutal sectarian past, the Academy has become a peaceful, powerfully inquisitive people.

Their first steps to the civilizations of other solar systems are the Contactors — institution-starcraft sent from Earth and filled with a hundred eager and self-organized individuals. Their long lives devoted to the study of language, religion, archaeology, anthrozoölogy, and a million sub-fields of the sciences of people, they are swarming the galaxy looking for their long lost siblings, cousins, and parents.

Their faith in reason and their own intellectual prowess is challenged at every colony they encounter as they learn about the ethics, histories, and biologies of the rest of homininkind. Where they go to find friends and relatives, they invariably find something much more complex — lovers, challengers, rivals.

Sciences and technologies in Human Contact are based on real-world sciences, from physics to linguistics, zoölogy to archaeology, computer science and nanotechnology. Those sciences, though, are the tools of the players, not the core of the fiction. The core is in the one-to-one relationships — what people want from each other, what they demand from each other. From politics and religion to fist fights and marriages, the crashing together of desires forms the basis of the game.

Decisions about those first interactions are critical. That’s why Contactors often opt to use black ops anthropologists, sent to reduce the impact of their arrival. Given seven years, three lonely Contactor Envoys will subtly alter both their own perceptions and those of the host society until the eventual meeting will be better than catastrophic. They can only hope, though, that the Contactor itself will survive the long trip, their comrades adding years to their expedition inside their craft.

Use the setting material to make civilizations of your own and dive deep into them as they evolve from session to session. Discover what effect the conflicts and synergies of the cultures have. Determine what you can take back to Earth, or what you can keep on Earth, and what will come of the people of Earth.

Because everyone calls their home “Earth”.

(From the publishers website: http://glyphpress.com/talk/shockhuman-contact/)

95515.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 21 - Jan 2008)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

95515.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

Launching the All Nighters, the 1001 + 1 Nights subscriber group.

CONTENTS:
-Introduction
-One-on-one Gaming
-Touch it with a Ten Foot Wiki
-The Changeling Project, Part 2
-Actual Play: Mathemancy Notes 1

95516.name: Cthulhu Dark
95516.description:
From the publisher website:
Cthulhu Dark

Cthulhu Dark is my rules-light Lovecraftian game. (Or try the easily-printable version).

The rules are fun and incredibly minimal: they fit on one sheet of paper. You don’t need a character sheet to play, so you can start playing after two minutes of prep. Despite the simplicity, there are some interesting rules twists: look at the Suppressing Knowledge rule for an example.

For your first game, use the main rules alone. Run a prewritten scenario with a Keeper. Then, if you like, check Dark Experiments to see additional rules I’m working on.

95517.name: Sein Letzter Dollar
95517.description:
Goal: Collect as many chips as possible before 1st player goes bankrupt

1. Each player receives 10 wooden chips
2. Place your 'chip-team' by rolling three dice into your own area
3. Prepare your team to challenge your opponents - roll the dice if you win ==> rolling a '6', you may collect set chips
4. If you own only one last chip (=letzter Dollar) you may play 'all or nothing'

95518.name: Vox Draconis Rules
95518.description:
User Summary
These are the rules for Vox Draconis. In it is information on the background story of the world of Vox Draconis, everything needed for generating characters, a list of equipment, a collection of monsters, and other core material for both players and GMs.

95519.description:
This supplement contains lists for Asian and African armies during the period covered by the Field of Glory Renaissance rules, 1494 - 1698. The following armies are covered:

MING CHINESE
KOREAN
JAPANESE
JAPANESE WARRIOR MONK ALLIES
IKKO IKKI
MONGOL
TIBETAN
MUSLIM INDIAN
HINDU INDIAN
INDONESIAN OR MALACCAN
THAI, BURMESE AND KHMER
VIETNAMESE
DESERT BEDOUIN
SETTLED ARAB STATES
ETHIOPIAN
ZANJ
HORN OF AFRICA
MAORI AND PACIFIC ISLAND CULTURES
HAWAIIAN
COLONIAL PORTUGUESE
MUGHAL
WOKOU PIRATES
JURCHEN, LATER JIN AND QING
COLONIAL DUTCH
MARATHA

The book itself is in the same format as the earlier supplements. It contains 108 pages with historical backgrounds for each list together with photos of miniatures and illustrations from Osprey books
95519.name: Field of Glory Renaissance Companion 4: Colonies and Conquest: Asia 1494–1698

95520.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 16 - Nov 2001)
95520.description:
Contents:

Cover by Jennifer Anderson
Thoughts on the Evolution of PBM by Shannon Muir with John C. Muir
Promises Unbroken by Warpmind de InzanE

Old Gods by Jessie Feff

95521.name: Tower of London
95521.description:
Goal: Be the first to reach your inner circled areas with all of your tokens (alike Pachisi)


You start within your coloured area at the outer range with 4 tokens (each of the tribes are named - from dark to bright: Normans, Anglo-Saxons, Britons and Picts & Scotti).
Roll the three dices and allocate numbers to appropriate tokens - you may add up, too. Rolling doubles enables you to roll the dice again.
Follow up the arrows

95522.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 17 - Feb 2002)

rpgissuearticle.65634: CTF 2187: Black Hearts and Broken Dreams

Cover by Stephanie Lostimolo
