95524.name: Lock On Gold
95524.description:
User Summary:

LockOn Gold contains 2 CD's:

Lock On Modern Air Combat v1.0 and
Flaming Cliffs 1.1

95525.name: Lock On Platinum
95525.description:
User Summary:

Lock On Platinum contains:

Lock On: Modern Air Combat v1.0 and
Flaming Cliffs 2.0, with the 1.2.1 patch built in.

95526.name: Dungeonslayers (Version 3.75)
95526.description:
From back cover of French PDF:

« Alors, après que vous ayez tué et fouillé une douzaine d’orques, vous entrez dans la pièce adjacente. Apparemment, vous avez atteint la destination de votre quête : grâce à la lumière des torches, vous pouvez discerner des symboles impies, qui
profanent les fresques murales autrefois si splendides. Une fontaine à l’eau putride occupe le centre de la pièce, et devant elle se dresse une silhouette revêtue d'une robe noire. Une aura menaçante émane… »
« On s’en fout- à l’attaaaque !!! »

UN PETIT DONJ ‘ CE SOIR ?
Dungeonslayers est un jeu de rôle sur table, où les personnages tuent des monstres et pillent des souterrains comme dans le bon vieux temps. Le système de règles de Dungeonslayers a été conçu pour être à la fois rapide et simple : en moins de 5 minutes, votre personnage est paré pour sa première aventure souterraine.
Ces règles comprennent tout ce dont vous et vos amis avez besoin pour jouer à une partie de Dungeonslayers, en dehors d’un dé à 20 faces.

Un jeu de rôle complet en 24 pages
Des mécanismes rapides pour le combat & la magie
Règles de création de personnages
Une aventure d’introduction




Google Translation
From back cover of French PDF:

"Then, after you have killed and searched a dozen orcs, you enter the next room. Apparently, you've reached the destination of your quest through the light of torches, you can discern symbols ungodly, who
desecrate the murals once so splendid. A putrid water fountain occupies the center of the room, and before her stands a figure clad in a black dress. An aura emanates threatening ... "
"Who cares-the attaaaque! "

A SMALL DONJI this evening?'
Dungeonslayers is a tabletop roleplaying game, where characters kill monsters and loot underground like in the good old days. The rule system Dungeonslayers was designed to be both fast and simple: in less than 5 minutes, your character is ready for its first underground adventure.
These rules include everything you and your friends need to play a part Dungeonslayers, outside a 20-sided die.
* A complete roleplaying game in 24 pages
* Mechanisms quick combat and magic
* Rules for creating characters
* An introductory adventure

95527.description:
Madeira is an island officially discovered early in the 15th century by Portuguese seafarers. Madeira, the Portuguese word for wood, refers to the dense forest that covered its wild, fertile landscape. This, and its strategic position far into the Atlantic Ocean made the island one of the most significant Portuguese discoveries. Madeira served as a “laboratory” for what would become the Portuguese Empire.

Wheat plantations were the first means for survival on the island. After that, when D. Henrique decided to increase the economy of the Empire, sugar became the core business of Madeira. Once sugar started coming from other places in the world, such as Africa and Brazil, profits from sugar were no longer enough, and production of the very famous Madeira wine became the most important economic product of the island.

Players try to adapt themselves to these constraints, working to find better fields for farming the right goods and for obtaining precious wood, essential for erecting new structures in the cities and for building ships. In turn, the ships are crucial for trading in foreign markets, as well as for taking part in new expeditions to discover other countries.
Madeira has been established just as it was in the original administrative division of the island under 3 captaincies (Funchal, Machico, and Porto Santo), where the ultimate goal is to develop the Island, gaining the most prestige under and for the Portuguese Crown.

The Crown of Portugal has a series of requests regarding expeditions, urbanization, opening trade routes, increasing wealth, and controlling the guilds on the islands. Three times during the game, the players gain prestige for fulfilling certain requests by the Crown. At two other times, the Crown requests that the islands change the focus of their agriculture due to the changes in the world.

Players must carefully choose the correct timing to show their achievements. Too early and you don’t gain as much prestige, too late and you risk someone else stealing the best opportunities. Will you have what it takes to excel in all of these endeavors?
Beware, wheat may become scarce, money is never enough, the population is hungry, and the shadow of piracy looms large….
95527.name: Madeira

95528.name: Abduction! World Attack
95528.description:
Your friends have been abducted by aliens! Luckily the alien tractor beam pulled up enough debris to allow you to follow them up into space to rescue your herd.

Use tilt controls to follow the ufo up into space, picking up bonuses and power-ups as you go, but watch you don't fall...

With a whole set of adventure levels, dozens of challenges and 6 difficulties in quick game mode, this game will keep you coming back for more.

Source: The Developer Website.

95529.name: Abduction 2
95529.description:
The cow is back! Get ready to play through over 120 levels across 15 landscapes, in this sequel to one of the most popular games on Android...

Along with favourites like quick game and classic mode, play through 60 hand crafted adventure levels featuring new platforms and bonuses, including spikes, draggable platforms, fans and slow motion.

A whole new game engine supplies graphics even more colourful than before. New weather effects include wind, fog, snow and storms!

Throughout the classic and adventure mode, earn coins to spend in the shop on accessories to customize your characters, or even a whole new minigame!

Source: The Developer Website.

95530.name: Hero of Sparta
95530.description:
You wake up alone on an unknown beach - your boat and entire fleet missing... It's the beginning of an epic odyssey to find out just what game the gods are playing with you, King Argos. Your fate now lies in their hands. Battle like the fierce Spartan warrior you are to avoid a tragic death as you journey from the Oracle's Island, Atlantis and finally to the depths of the Underworld. You will fight the most phenomenal monsters from mythology, defy Cerberus and the Cyclops, and challenge the gods themselves! It's your chance to write your own legend... if you can survive this mythic adventure.

Source: The Developer Website.

95531.name: Places to Go, People to Be (Issue 24 - Mar 2003)

rpgissue.8227: Places to Go, People to Be

95531.description:
In this issue:

From places around the world, as near as live-action New Zealand, and as far as ever prepared France, we bring you great advice to masticate. But be careful to chew well: the final course has been known to disturb some diners!

Contents:

Regulars:

Editorial - Word from on high - Steve Dempsey
Once Upon A Time - Nintendo Generation - Zac Dettwyler
Gaming Links - This and that - Steve Dempsey
Readers' Forum - Letters from afar




Articles:

Failing to prepare is preparing to fail - Plan your improv. - Rappar
How to Organise a Live Role Playing Chronicle - Rock, scissors, paper? - Alex Gill
The Importance of Food - Yum, yum! - Stephen ~runester~ Jarjoura
The Seether: Role-playing, an alternate history - Careful! There be satire in them there hills. - Alex Loke

95532.name: Places to Go, People to Be (Issue 25 - Aug 2004)

rpgissue.8227: Places to Go, People to Be

95532.description:
In this issue:

Welcome to our 'signs of life' issue. Yes, we really are still here! The theme of this issue is community, starting with an academic study of reactions to attacks on gaming. We then turn to the wanted adds: players searching for groups, and groups searching for players. Finally, We finish up with an interview Erick Wujcik.

Contents:

Regulars:

Editorial - Word from on high -Steve Dempsey
Once Upon A Time - Nintendo Generation - Claire Godfrey
Gaming Links - This and that - Steve Dempsey
Readers' Forum - Letters from afar




Articles:

Role-Playing Games and the Christian Right - Our community's response in the face of moral panic. - Dr David Waldron
Finding new Roleplaying Groups. - What do you do when you move? - Belinda Kelly
Finding new Players. - Recruitment drive. - Robert H.D. Ahrens
Job's for the boys. - Roleplaying and computing careers. - Steve Darlington

95533.name: Wonderland No More: Adventures in a Wonderland Gone Wrong
95533.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Wonderland No More?

In 1865, Lewis Carroll introduced the world to the delightful nonsense of Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland, and followed up with Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There in 1871 These tales present us with a world of whimsy and absurdity, and maybe just the tiniest hint of danger and adventure.

But what if there really was an Alice who visited Wonderland and what if it didn’t vanish as soon as she left? What if Wonderland’s childlike charm tarnished just a bit with the years, and it warped under the weight of its own nonsense? Maybe it’s all just a dream - or a nightmare - but it’s all very real for anyone trapped within.

Wonderland No More provides a setting for adventures within a realm of fantasy and the unexpected, a madcap ride that bounces between humor and horror Here, when the Queen of Hearts cries, "Off with their heads!" it usually happens!

Take on the roles of wooden Chessmen, two-dimensional Cards, talking Animals, mobile Plants, Tweedle, or even the occasional Human Knights quest for blessed artifacts of Alice, Little Girls master the deadly Queen’s Croquet, Haberdashers have a few tricks under their caps, and Gourmancers create magical foods and drinks (helpfully labeled "Eat Me" or "Drink Me" for those who can’t figure it out on their own)

Lighthearted or sinister, it’s all what you make of it in Wonderland - because we’re all mad here.

Wonderland No More is a complete setting book by Triple Ace Games for the Savage Worlds RPG.

95534.name: Shadow of the Knife
95534.description:
From the PDF:

An Unofficial RAVENLOFT® Adventure for 4-6 characters of level 6-8

This adventure is set in the Zherisia cluster and details the fourteenth murder spree of the infamous killer, Bloody Jack. It is occurs thirteen years after the Ravenloft adventure Hour of the Knife. Although it is intended as a sequel to that module, Shadow of the Knife is usable by both those who have played Hour of the Knife and those new to the murky city of Paridon.

While both the PCs and the Paridoners have more information than they did last time, they discover new threats to deal with: the marikith of Timor, whose monstrous Hive Queen covets the Fang of the Nosferatu, and the new Bloody Jack, a golem made by Emil Bollenbach from the flesh of doppelgangers. The
adventure is also intended to contain a few scenes reminiscent of Hour of the Knife, but given a few new twists.

95535.name: Quintessence
95535.description:
Publisher Blurb:

...to boldly venture where no gentleman has previously ventured

It’s the talk of the town in the London coffee houses - how everyone’s buying shares in the Company of Gentleman Adventurers Trading into the Moon! In the London docks a ship is being built, designed by Clockwork genius John Wilkins, a ship that can fly. It will be the first vessel ever to leave the shores of Earth and venture to another world - whatever it brings back, the profits are sure to be enormous.

When the Enterprise flaps its mighty wings and ascends into the empyrean, it seems like a perfect example of the superiority of Parliamentarian Clockwork over their Royalist rivals’ Alchemy. Only the Adventurers, their mission aboard the moon-ship a secret at the highest levels, know that they will not be the first to visit the Moon - their nemesis is ahead of them, and up to no good as usual.

As the party face ship-board skullduggery, meet wonders between the worlds and face first contact with an ancient civilisation, the race is on to find the secret of the fifth element - Quintessence.

Quintessence can be played as a stand-alone adventure, but is also the fourth episode in the epic Kingdom & Commonwealth Campaign. Requires the RuneQuest II Core Rulebook from Mongoose Publishing and the Clockwork & Chivalry Core Worldbook from Cubicle 7.

95536.name: Adventure Companion

rpgpodcastepisode.19461: RPG Circus Season 2 Episode 19 - Three Topics, Three Tangents

95536.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Every Hero Needs a Good Companion

Frodo had Sam and Conan had Subotai, but neither of them had this ultimate companion. Whether you’re battling demons in the harsh and savage land of Epoch, exploring the mysterious ruins and rivers of Sunchaser, engaged in high stakes fantasy intrigue and espionage in Cloak & Dagger, or just looking for some new ways to shine in any world you visit, consider this invaluable tome your guide to victory.

Find Your Hero’s Path

-Three fully detailed campaign worlds
-12 Base, Expert, and Master Classes
-Over 150 Specialties, feats, tricks, and Paths
-A universe of gaming possibilities!

The Adventure Companion is an essential addition to every player and GM’s Fantasy Craft library, offering all the tools, tricks, and talent to face down whatever the opposition throws at you - and come out on top.

95538.name: The Ruins of Ramat (Castles & Crusades)
95538.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An Adventure for 4-6 Characters of Levels 1-3

A little girl comes running and crying into the center of the village. When questioned, she sobs that she and her dog were playing just outside of town by that old stone building on Witch's Hill, when a giant, clawed creature came up out of the ground and took her dog. The girl is obviously completely terrified and her dog, which never normally leaves her side, is nowhere to be seen.

You and your companions volunteer to look into the matter. After all, local legends say that vast amounts of treasure lay under the darkness of Witch's Hill. The village elders agree to let you and your party investigate the incident; indeed they almost seem relieved to do so.

This 20 page, digest module includes 5 new monsters (converted from First Edition), 2 maps 6 pieces of art and a quick reference sheet for the monsters.
and 6 pieces of art.

95539.name: Esche und Kork
95539.description:
(from the back of the book)
The game of Imman played with ash bats and corc balls, is very popular in the northern and middle regions of Aventurien for more than a hundred years, although the heyday of the promotion by th nobles like emperor Hal is over.
The inhabitants of the divided and disputed duchy of Albernia like the call of such such a competition: All that, that was not reached in years of struggle, a Imman tournament should now set: a brief period of peace.
But while ordinary people go there to combat boredom, a countess and a queen will use the background for there intrigues. The heroes get into a maelstrom of events in which they do not only have to survive but also are responsible for the fragile peace of an entire region.

95540.name: Casus Belli (Issue 3 - Feb 1981)

rpgissuearticle.139208: Devine Qui Vient Dîner Ce Soir...

95540.description:
User Summary:

third issue, featuring:

- Editorial
- A Jean-Jacques Petit article about SPI's Napoleon's Last Battles
- Review and historical article about SPI's The Great War in the East
- Devine qui vient diner ce soir: new monsters and items for AD&D 1st edition
- Le Guet des Hautes Terres, an AD&D module
- A l'usage du DM débutant, advice for a beginning Dungeon Master
- A l'aube d'une guerre: 1900, article describing the first turns of a Diplomacy game
- A review of Bataille de Fleurus
- Nouvelles du front, game events and new releases

95541.name: Ghana Bwana
95541.description:
From the Game Manual / Box:

Join Professor Chance, better known as Ghana Bwana, on his hazardous quest for the "Great Secret" of legendary Erebus Island. Use your wit and quick reflexes to make your way through the many perils of this hostile and mysterious land. If your luck holds, you may reach the treasure site, the final and ultimate challenge.

95542.name: dabong!
95542.description:
2 - 5 players take turns laying down cards in a central pile. Instead of the basic suits found in a standard deck of cards, dabong! uses Earth, Wind, Water, and Fire.

The most common way a player lays down a card is by matching the suit or number of the card in the pile to a card in the player's hand. However, there are additional options to play the players can play cards of the same suit that add up to the number in the middle. For example, if a 10 of Fire is in the central pile, a player could play a 2, a 3, and a 5 of Water all at the same time.

A player wins when he/she has used all of his/her cards, or through a dabong! A dabong occurs when a players cards add up to the central card, regardless of suit.

95543.name: The Interbank Incident
95543.description:
From the Game Manual / Box:

The situation is grave: the code book controlling a top secret experimental satellite has been stolen. In the wrong hands, this satellite could do almost anything. Can you collect the clues and tips in order to find the crooks and regain control of the satellite?

95544.name: Master Imagem
95544.description:
Translated from the box:
"Master Imagem is a game of question and answers which involves knowledge, luck and perception. There are 1800 questions divided in 6 subjects and your team can chose one of them and answer before the time ended.
Getting a right answer your team opens a door of the chosen theme and see a word or part of the mysterious figure. But if you are wrong, the next team gets a shot.
Collect more tips and risk a guess 'What?', 'Where?' or 'Who' is the mystery picture."

95545.name: Casus Belli (Issue 4 - Jun 1981)
95545.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Editorial
Agonie d'une ville, historical article about the battle of Stalingrad, with two game reviews, Battle for Stalingrad and Streets of Stalingrad
Wargamers confirmés s'abstenir, an article introducing wargames
Rommel - la bataille de Kasserine, review of International Team's Rommel
Diplomacy: quelques pronostics, tips for the first turns of Diplomacy
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, new monsters for AD&D (most of them already published in White Dwarf)
Dormira... Dormira pas... article discussing the effects of the Sleep spell in AD&D
Aux Armes! dans D&D a description of medieval weapons in the context of Dungeons & Dragons
La Gorge de Fafnir, a D&D module for characters level 5-7
Nouvelles du front

95546.name: Places to Go, People to Be (Issue 26 - Mar 2005)

rpgissue.8227: Places to Go, People to Be

95546.description:
In this issue:

We start off with some articles to get you thinking about your gaming style: Are you a modern-day munchkin hiding behind narative? A little too trigger happy? From there we move on to how to write believable science fiction. Finally, we finish up with a bit of humour from everyones' favourite seether.

Contents:

Regulars:

Editorial - Word from on high - Steve Dempsey
Once Upon A Time - There and back again - Andrew Godefroy
Gaming Links - This and that - Steve Dempsey
Readers' Forum - Letters from afar




Articles:

Theory 101: Part 1 - On systems and shared imagined space. - M. Joseph Young
Narrativists: A new breed of Munchkin? - Can narrative be taken too far? - Max Cairnduff
Writing believable Sci Fi. - To infinity and beyond! - Mica Goldstone
The Seether. - A satirical finish. - Alex Loke

95547.name: Im Bann des Eichenkönigs
95547.description:
from the back of the book

There is something rotten in the state Andergast ... at least in a small, remote barony, where a band of robbers hang out, which is making their raids even to the distant capital. So a royal messenger is sent out to investigate the incidents - with your heroes as an escort. After arriving at the edge of civilization, the heroes learn very quickly that things happen that can not be explained with simple, mundane villainy.

95548.name: Pfade des Lichts
95548.description:
User summary

This is an anthology for the Priests and Shamans box.

it contains 5 scenarios:

1) Pfade des Wanderers: Mit fremden Federn
2) Pfade der Stille: Stunden des Schweigens
3) Pfade des as'Salis, des All-Einen: Rastullahs Rache
4) Pfade der Geister: Der Jadeberg
5) Pfade des zwölfgöttlichen Bundes: Das Kloster des wahren Glaubens

95549.name: Places to Go, People to Be (Issue 27 - Jun 2005)

rpgissue.8227: Places to Go, People to Be

95549.description:
In this issue:

In our second edition for 2005 we bring you more theory from M. Joseph Young. Steve Dempsey asks himself what makes a game that you (or at least he) wants to play? Steve Darlington explores the mysteries of Avatars, Audience, and Authors. We close with another does of the inimitable The Seether.

Contents:

Regulars:

Editorial - A personal note - Steve Dempsey
Gaming Links - This and that - Steve Dempsey
Readers' Forum - Letters from afar




Articles:

Theory 101: Part 2 - The impossible thing before breakfast... - M. Joseph Young
What games do I want to play? - Compare and contrast. - Steve Dempsey
The Avatar, the Audience, and the Author - Why we all love roleplaying. - Steve Darlington
The Zen of Jerk - An essential reference. - Alex Loke

95550.name: Casus Belli (Issue 5 - Sep 1981)
95550.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Les minis, short reviews of three SPI games, Bulge, Leningrad and Across Suez
Air assault on Crete, review of Avalon Hill's Air Assault On Crete/Invasion of Malta: 1942
Interview à travers un rideau de fer, Diplomacy strategy tips
New Diplomacy, analysis of the new Diplomacy rules published by Miro
Iéna Austerlitz, reviews of International Team's Jena and Austerlitz
Chevalry & Sorcery, a comparison between Chivalry & Sorcery Chivalry & Sorcery (1st & 2nd Editions) and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition)
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, new monsters for D&D (some of them previously published in White Dwarf)
Feuille de personnage, a character sheet for AD&D
Le temple de Dagon, AD&D module
Nouvelles du Front

95551.name: Die Wandelbare
95551.description:
from the back of the book

A little girl suffering from a mysterious illness. A mysterious stone cube that attracts the interest off the dark powers. A dead Achaz in the heart of Almada. An ancient secret that the members of the Order Draconites are trying to solve for years. All this at the same time in the pearl on river Yaquir, the city of Punin, the city where the heroes are involved in this web of inconsistencies. Chased by an enemy in the dark and with the girl Hyzindaya Darpani on their side, the track leads into the depths of mythology of the lizards - to see that not only the goddess Hesinde can be changed.

95552.name: Der Schwur des letzten Sultans
95552.description:
from the back of the book

Almost two millennia ago Rondra gave the people of Bosparan the legendary trumpet of Perricum, which could collaps city walls of Nebachot. Since then, the the descendant of Nebachot quarrel with their fate, and why Rondra has left them. But now, while the country is threatened from the north, on clues on an ancient artifact are discovered that could unite the warring tribes. Unfortunately, the notes are thin, and it does take some very smart people to discover the eons-old track - and some powerful warriors to battle through the rough wilderness of the Raschtulswall-mounntains.

95553.name: Outlive
95553.description:
Outlive is a real time strategy game that was produced by Continuum Entertainment and published by Take-Two Interactive featuring two unique factions, robotics and humans, each with their own campaign and one combined cooperative campaign.

Source: Wikipedia, "Outlive", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95554.name: Timopoly
95554.description: This Monopoly clone is themed with Canadian-based Tim Horton's "coffee and bake shops". Players buy and sell the restaurant's most popular items. Player tokens include (among others) a coffee cup, a donut, and a "Zamboni" ice resurfacing machine. (Tim Horton was a famous NHL hockey player).

95555.name: Recoil
95555.description:
User Summary

Recoil is a third person/first person arcade shooter developed by Zipper interactive and published by Electronic Arts in 1999. The player plays as a tank driver fighting a guerrilla war against a network corporation that has enslaved humanity.

95556.name: Xargon
95556.description:
Xargon is a side scrolling platformer game created by Epic MegaGames in 1993. The game was split into three volumes the first of which was shareware, the other two had to be purchased.

Source: Wikipedia, "Xargon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95557.name: Casus Belli (Issue 6 - Dec 1981)
95557.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Squad Leader chapitre 1: Curriculum Vitae ?, the first of a series of articles about Avalon Hill's Squad Leader
Diplomatie: des fanzines, a presentation of Diplomacy fanzines
Invasion of Malta (1ère partie), first part of an article discussing the planned invasion of Malta by the Axis forces during WWII and the game Air Assault On Crete/Invasion of Malta: 1942
Okinawa / 43, reviews of International Team's Okinawa and Sicilia '43
The longuest day, review of Avalon Hill's The Longest Day
Après la bataille, Battle for Stalingrad session report
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, new monsters for D&D
Le Samouraï, a rewrite of the samurai D&D character class published in the first issue of Casus Belli (this version is approved by Gary Gygax)
Echelles pour D&D, an article explaining conversions between the metric system and the imperial system used in D&D
Le Roc des Vautours, a module for AD&D
Votre club ?, a guide to creating a gaming association
Nouvelles du Front

95558.name: La Battaglia delle Falkland
95558.description:
A boardgame about the would-be Battle of the Falkland, designed in Spring 1982 while the British fleet was approaching the Argentina-occupied islands and the battle was still to be engaged. Published with some delay (because of a strike at the publishing house) on the Italian news magazine "Il Mondo" of the 4th of May, just while the battle raged.
A simplified aero-naval simulation boardgame, with the classical hex-grid map and square counters.

95559.name: Cryostasis: Sleep of Reason
95559.description:
User Summary:

Cryostasis: Sleep of Reason is a First person survival horror shooter which takes place on an abandoned icebreaker ship in the arctic. Cryostasis was developed by Action forms and published by 1C Company.

95560.name: Supermundial
95560.description:
Soccer simulation published on the 5th of July, 1982 by the Italian weekly newsmagazine Panorama. Counters cover all the teams taking part in the World Cup in these same days.
The game is a classical simulation with hex-grid map, counters with attack and movement scores, charts for the results of confrontations and actions. The attack points have been awarded by a pool of famed Italian sport journalists.

95561.name: They Call Him Guff
95561.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Success breeds contempt, and Guff has recently been cursed with that particular problem. Guff and his band of miscreants enjoy the fruits of their labor and look now for the next big thing.

They Call Him Guff is designed to be played in only an hour or two. It is a short adventure that includes a bandit encounter in a small cottage. Intended for the Castles & Crusades Role Playing Game, it is easy enought to convert to any system. It is designed for 4-6 characters of 4th-6th level. The fewer characters, the higher level.

95562.name: Goldene Ketten
95562.description:
From the back of the book

After a strenuous day's walk on the coastal road from Festum to Neersand the heroes deserve a rest in the Red Ram's Horn Inn. After all, they can visit the famous wizard Thezmar Alatzer in the morning. But the evening isnt as quiet as expected. A precious piece of jewelry has a dark secret, and so the road to adventure begins at the doorstep of the inn.

95564.name: Hardwood Hearts

videogamehonor.32035: 2000 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee

95564.description:
User Summary:

Hardwood Hearts is a very reasonable adaptation of the classic card game onto an online platform. The classic game is included and follows the same rules you would use while playing with real cards. The object is to avoid winning tricks so you end up with the fewest points. The rules also allow you to "Shoot the Moon" and "Shoot the Sun." You can also play "Spot Hearts" where each heart card is worth its face value. Silvercreek has included local single-player and online multiplayer for up to four people. There are some graphical enhancements to the game that let you alter the background of the playing area. You can also "foom" the other players (which is sort of like an animated emoticon) as a means of taunting them.

95565.name: Hardwood Spades

videogamehonor.32097: 2001 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee

95565.description:
User Summary:

Hardwood Spades is a very reasonable adaptation of the classic card game onto an online platform. The classic game is included and follows the same rules you would use while playing with real cards. The object is to bid on winning tricks and to avoid overbidding. Silvercreek has included local single-player and online multiplayer for up to four people. There are some graphical enhancements to the game that let you alter the background of the playing area. You can also "foom" the other players (which is sort of like an animated emoticon) as a means of taunting them.

95566.name: Kar Domadrosch
95566.description:
From the back of the book

Ancient tunnel systems, mechanical marvels and a good dwarven ale wait for heroes that walk in the steps of the small people. As diverse as the people of the Angroschim are the challenges in this volume.
In "Bruderzwist" drinking and dating skills are asked for, "In den Hallen von Artromlosch" strength, courage and a criminalistic sense is needed, only brave warriors can explore "Das Vermächtnis des Drachen" and "Sagenhaftes Lolgrolmosch" calls for true heroism in the fight against unusual opponents.
Kar domadrosch is Rogolan, the language of the Dwarves, and it means "into the adventure!".
Visit the dark tunnels of the dwarfs of Aventuria, discover the ancient secrets of small people, immerse yourself in the life of the Angroschim. Fascinating people are waiting - stubborn, and a little crazy, but also warm, courageous and straightforward. A nation with a long and mysterious history that reveals itselve to people quite rarely.

95567.name: Игросказ
95567.description:
From publisher:

Storyteller is a good workout for beginning storytellers. Making up stories is one of the most exciting activities in the world. It doesn’t matter whether it’s a campfire story or a $200 million blockbuster movie. There is only one winner in Storyteller but every player takes away an amazing prize - a unique story that they all created together.

The game set for Storyteller contains 200 cards which are divided into two different types: plot and ending cards. Plot cards contain elements of the future story: the heroes, places, objects, events and other characteristics. Each ending card has a final sentence for the story written on them. When developing a story, the players illustrate it by taking plot cards from their hands and placing them onto the table. As the game progresses, players take turns telling the story. Each player is trying to steer the tale in a direction that would ultimately fit their ending card. Since the ending cards are all quite different, each player will attempt to tailor the story in a different way, causing the plot to take notorious twists and turns.

95568.description:
Game description from the publisher:

That Which Consumes is the sixth and final exciting Asylum Pack in The Rituals of the Order expansion cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. It introduces three copies each of 20 never-before-seen cards to the vibrant Call of Cthulhu metagame, expanding the deck-building options of all factions, including the new Order of the Silver Twilight faction.

The sudden surprise of the ground giving way is the theme of That Which Consumes, in which a variety of new event and support cards will be introduced into the arsenal of each faction. From Hastur's Final Note which destroys all insane characters, to Yog-Sothoth's A Gift of Knowledge which trades wounds for success tokens, That Which Consumes will keep your opponents guessing what explosive event will come next.

With the element of surprise looming dangerously, no one is safe from That Which Consumes!
95568.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – That Which Consumes Asylum Pack

40270.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgamefamily.10579: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

95569.name: Places to Go, People to Be (Issue 28 - Nov 2006)

rpgissue.8227: Places to Go, People to Be

95569.description:
In this issue:

We start with the conclusion of M. Joseph Young's theory series, move on to a documentary of larpers in their natural state, consider the virtue of stupidty and how to begin a game, and conclude where it all began with D&D.

Contents:

Regulars:

Editorial - A personal note - Steve Dempsey
Readers' Forum - Letters from afar




Articles:

Theory 101: Part 3 - A creative agenda. - M. Joseph Young
Swordplay: An Interview with Eric Power - Just like David Attenborough
Dare to be Stupid! - As Weird Al might say. - Steve Darlington
From Intriguing Beginnings - A dozen ideas for getting an unusual party of PCs together. - Matthew Rees
The new D&D? - Hit me baby, one more time! - Alex Loke

95570.name: Places to Go, People to Be (Issue 29 - Mar 2008)

rpgissue.8227: Places to Go, People to Be

95570.description:
In this issue:

Our tenth anniversary edition! We begin with an interview with some of our editors' favourite indie game designers. We then consider adding some winter realism to our games, and how armour should really work. We then turn to character generation, what questions should you ask? and how might they be answered?. Finally our founder Steve Darlington does his best to sum up what it means to play a character.

Contents:

Editorial - A personal note - Steve Dempsey
Readers' Forum - Letters from afar
Indie–apolis - A great place to meet game designers - Steve Dempsey
Winter Games - More than Snow–men and –angels - Pierre Nuss
The Armour Problem - The chafing is terrible - Steven Satak
A Question of Character and An Exemplary Character - Who is this person? - David Astley
Summing It Up - What makes the man, woman, or thing? - Steve Darlington

95571.name: Replica Island
95571.description:
Guide the Android robot through 40 action-packed platforming levels on a quest to discover a secret power source on a mysterious island. With an retro style and unique, challenging game play, Replica Island is a new take on the classic platformer genre.

Source: The Game Website.

95572.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 19 - Aug 2002)
95572.description:
Contents:

Cover: Homage by Douglas Defa
Betrayal by Warpmind de InzanE
Artifacts for GURPS by Warpmind de InzanE
Cartoons by Werner Wejp-Olsen
CTF 2187: Divided but Not Conquered by Shannon Muir
The Confessor by Christine Morgan
Poetry Corner

Lost Innocence by Warpmind de InzanE
Shadowglen by Dirce
Plus-Four Elven Chain Bikini by Christine Morgan




GURPS Harry Potter, Part 2 by Thomas Barnes

95573.name: Stupid Zombies
95573.description:
Those stupid zombies are back, and you are humanity's last hope to keep them brainless. One man, one shotgun and lots of stupid zombies.

Source: The Developer Website.

95574.name: Isles of Glory
95574.description:
The Story: The year is 1702. As a humble bean farmer, you have grown restless and yearn for adventure. You gather your belongings, sell your farm and purchase a small sloop from the local shipyard. With entrepreneurial vigor, you set sail for the nearest island, hoping to turn a meager profit on your final barrel of beans. The leaders of your nation soon hear of your courage and petition your service. They provide you with a small satchel of gold, a crew, and Letters of Marque. As a newly commissioned privateer, you must navigate the treacherous seas, and bring home great riches and glory to your country of origin.

Gameplay: A player’s turn begins by drawing one adventure card and selecting one action card. Depending on the type of adventure, the card may be resolved immediately (e.g. a group activity), or the card may be placed on the ocean map by the player. The player then sails to an island or ocean space, choosing to either experience an adventure, or trade in the market. The market is the heart of this game. Players aim to buy low, sell high, carefully watching future prices, hoping to turn a profit. The action cards provide one-time bonuses to fight pirates, escape disasters, trade in the market, etc. Gold is used to upgrade ships, explore shipwrecks, gamble, etc. The game ends when a player’s ship is upgraded to level 10, and victory goes to the player with the most gold.

95576.name: The Vietnam Game Rules
95576.description:
User Summary
These are the full rules of The Vietnam Game, Version 0.8.5, by Micael "Epoch" Sullivan. In them are included the sections Basic Mechanics, Character Creation (with lists of attributes and skills), Combat, Combat Complications, and Stressful Situations, all of which are necessary for playing The Vietnam Game.

95577.name: California Countdown
95577.description:
From the Back of the Book:

You are Cal Phoenix, the Freeway Warrior, champion and protector of Dallas Colony One. The final stage of your life-or-death exodus to the California coast is fraught with extraordinary dangers - breakdowns, rockfalls and unexplained deaths. Can you unravel the mystery that surrounds your journey, or will you perish without trace in the wastelands of Arizona?

95578.name: Dark Age 2 Rules
95578.description:
Publisher's Website
Finally, this is the revised rule set for Dark Age. also some revisions in the world background and a whole slew of new material. This will continue to grow in the next few months as the playtest campaign I am running unfolds.

User Summary
Contains Character Generation information, notes on the world of Dark Age, combat and equipment charts, explanations of magic and religion, a list of monsters and enemies, and other core rules for Dark Age.

95584.name: No Quarter (Issue 26 - Sep 2009)
95584.description:
From Publisher Website:

No Quarter Magazine 26 offers a battle report between Khador and the new Retribution forces, showing the might of the Iosans and their powerful myrmidons. Learn the secrets of the Shroud, necromancers eternally searching for the remains of their scion. Secrets of the Front Line looks at making the most of the coin you pay with your Mercenary forces, and Guts & Gears tears apart the tough armor of the Devastator.

Cover Art "Griffon" by Neil Roberts

ISSN: 7558200619

95585.name: Encounters: Bands of Orcs
95585.description:
From the publisher:

Encounters: Bands of Orcs is a highly adaptable list of orc encounters for beleaguered Castle Keepers!

Bands of Orcs is a game supplement that contains six different orc encounters from simple raiding parties to larger war bands. It includes one shaman party encounter. Each encounter is scaled for low, medium or high level adventurers. Each encounter has the number of orcs, equipment, hit points, treasure and adventure hooks that could be used.

A list of common orc names is given at the end of the document to help flesh out the individual encounters!

95586.name: Encounters: Unusual Roadside Encounters
95586.description:
From the publisher:

Often games stall on overland journeys. Day after dreary day passes with little more than empty sky and empty road. More often than not players are drawn into pointless battles with NPCs, such as your local road wardens, while shifting through the overland eat and sleep routine. But TLG delivers the perfect spice to mix it up. Encounters: Unusual Roadside Encounters includes 5 new encounters to spark interest on the road.

In this oh so small release your characters have to contend with cannibals, sleeping beauty, paying tolls, word problems and they even get to mimic the magnificent seven, or seven samurai as you please.

95587.name: No Quarter (Issue 24 - May 2009)
95587.description:
From Publisher Website:

All aboard! It's time to get on board and take a ride, as No Quarter 24 talks about trains and railroads of the Iron Kingdoms. Learn how to build a mechanika bridge for your trains to cross. Witness an epic Battle Report between Cygnar and the Skorne. Heed the word of the Lawbringer as Secrets of the Front focuses on tactics for the Protectorate of Menoth.

Cover Art "Rail to the Front Line" by Muttonhead

ISSN: 7558200617

95588.name: Sword of the Stars Complete Collection
95588.description:
From the Game Box

The year is 2405, and scientists have discovered technology allowing for faster-than-light travel. But at the brink of a new era, tragedy strikes: the first interstellar colony ship is destroyed and Earth is ravaged by an unknown alien race. We are not alone ...

95589.name: Bad Grandmas
95589.description:
There’s a running battle in the Retirement home! The confrontations between the Gang of Kniters and the Gang of the Bakers become a Gangland exe- cution. Don’t be surprised... These Grandmas are the worst villains of this world.

Bad Grandmas is an irreverent trick-taking game for two players. Anticipation and strategy are key to this game, since every trick determines the conditions of the next. Therefore, the players have to think twice about their moves.

Object of the game: Collect the highest number of Cookies by winning as many Duels as possible.

(see below for the download-able PDF)

95590.name: Richelieu's Guide to Fencing Schools
95590.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Two swordsmen lock blades on a slippery roof. One slashes and thrusts wildly, revealing himself a student of the Spanish school. The other parries, refusing to yield an inch of ground, as his masters at L’École de Position de Fer have taught him. A forceful attack meets an immovable defense- but which style will win out? This supplement provides further information on the fencing schools presented in All For One, and gives characters with the Fencing School Resource access to Talents open only to their school.

95591.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 20 - Nov 2002)
95591.description:
Contents:

Cover: Red Griffon by Sarah Skinner
The Birth of the Tuatha De Danaan: An excerpt from the upcoming novel, Tomorrow's Memories by Danielle Ackley-McPhail
Sollarin’s Tentacular Palm: A d20 Spell by Warpmind de InzanE
Trial by Fire and Stone: an excerpt from Knight of the Basilisk, the new ElfLore novel by Christine Morgan
Point of No Return by Jaguiler
20 Questions: Editor Christine interviews author Danielle Ackley-McPhail by Christine Morgan
CTF 2187: Choices, Changes, Challenges by Shannon Muir
GURPS Harry Potter, Part 3 by Thomas Barnes

95592.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 21 - Feb 2003)
95592.description:
Contents:

Cover: Phoenix by Courtney LeBlanc
The Sun Stone by Christine Morgan
Rings by L. D. Korn
GURPS Harry Potter, Part 4 by Thomas Barnes
Love's Cursed by Jason Bolton
CTF2187: Past and Future Intertwined by Shannon Muir
Star-Crossed - Excerpt from Tomorrow's Memories by Danielle Ackley-McPhail
A Love Foredoomed by Kimberly T.
When Today is Not Enough by Zaak Fresh
Hummingbirds by Kara Senecal
Out of Time by Danielle Ackley-McPhail

95593.name: The Simulacrum Roleplaying Game: The Mines of Moria
95593.description:
From Introduction:

It has been Thirty years since the crowning of King Ellesar of Gondor. Thirty years since the destruction of the One Ring and the defeat of Sauron. Thirty years since the death of the Balrog at the hands of Gandalf the Grey.

Now Gimli, son of Gloin and Legolas, son of Thranduil, with the blessing of King Ellesar have returned to Moria. This time, with an army...

The heroes of the War of the Ring seek a stout force to help retake the Dwarven city of Kazad-dum. The call of such renowned men has been heard and answered by the people of Middle Earth. An army marches to Dimrill Dale. The thought of Dwarven treasure beckons to some, the thought of revenge to others. Adventure and glory await. But so does death. Which will be found in these dark caverns?

The army storms the Eastern Gate, meeting heavy resistance from the orcs and goblins inside. As stalwart friends and companions push westward, many fall to orcish scimitars and goblin arrows. How many good Men, Dwarves and Elves will die to retake these dark passageways? How long will hope last?

At last, after many days of battle, the broken Bridge of Khazad-Dum appears. The army must stop and set up camp at the edge of the fathomless Chasm. Here, the Dwarves reveal their secret weapon. It is a steel bridge to span the depths, but it must be assembled piece-by-piece. The Elves and Men are left to stand guard against goblin archers and raiding assaults by orcs.

The darkness and unending tension take their toll. Even the bravest soldier is at risk of going mad from fear. The only distraction, the only tenuous hold on sanity, takes the form of patrolling the black caverns. The orcs must be kept away. The army must be protected.

User summary:

A fantasy RPG created by Tim Morgan and debuted in Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 22 - May 2003).

95595.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 22 - May 2003)
95595.description:
Contents:

Cover: Dragon Walk by Tom Lavelle
GURPS Harry Potter, Part 5 by Thomas Barnes
The Simulacrum Roleplaying Game: The Mines of Moria by Tim Morgan
Good Landing by Royce Day
Windfall by Dara Williamson
CTF2187: Spectres of Darkness by Shannon Muir
Trial by Fire and Stone: an excerpt from Truegold, ElfLore Book III by Christine Morgan
Filks Man Was Not Meant To Know
The Ways of Magic, Part I by Maelan Peredhil
Gene Cops by SC Lofton
Interview with Tee Morris and Lisa Lee, authors of MOREVI; Interview questions by Christine Morgan
The Oleander's Pryde by Jason Bolton

95597.name: BAM! Basic Action Magazine (Issue 1)
95597.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first in a series of completely free Fanzines for Basic Action Games. Basic Action Super Heroes, BASH! Fantasy Edition, and BASH! Sci-Fi edition are all featured within its pages. Inside, you'll find:

A Preview of BASH! Sci-Fi Edition!
Ideas for making Speedsters shine in your Superheroes game.
A Free BASH! Halloween Adventure: All Hallow's Eve
A Free BASH! Fantasy Adventure: The Gloom Caverns
Optional Rules, Ideas, and more!

95598.name: Casus Belli (Issue 7 - Mar 1982)
95598.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Vive l'empereur!, a review of the most-played wargames set in the napoleonic era
Napoleon at War, review of Napoleon at War: Four Battles
Diplomatie, a short history of Diplomacy
5.15.25 mm. Le jeu avec figurines, an introduction to miniatures wargaming
Squad Leader: l'infanterie, second installment of this column, review and explanations of the infantry rules in Squad Leader
Invasion of Malta, second part of this article about the planned invasion of Malta by the wehrmacht
Le Samouraï: des précisions, errata for the AD&D Samurai character class published in the previous issue
The Shattered Alliance: un jeu sur "micro", review of the Shattered Alliance videogame
Le module: Au coeur de la mort, D&D module
Nouvelles du front


This issue doesn't have the usual "Devine qui vient diner ce soir" column. It is also the first issue with an article about a videogame.

95599.name: The Majors Pro Baseball
95599.description:
The Majors Pro Baseball is a baseball video game for Sega Game Gear. It features battery-based save and a Major League Baseball Players Association license. The teams themselves are not licensed and are only listed by city name. The umpire's calls are notable for being uttered with a Japanese accent. This game would have benefitted from stat-tracking for the season mode but at least it provided a season mode. Players cannot choose a pitch but they are delivered clearly and accurately in terms of realism (for the era that the game was released in).

Source: Wikipedia, "The Majors Pro Baseball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95600.name: Die letzte Wacht
95600.description:
from the back of the book

Some time ago, the High King of the Dwarfs, Albrax son of Agam, had a vision of a new heroic age of the Angroschim. But the Arch Dwarves of Xorlosch are skeptical - and as the High King refuses the traditional destruction of a dangerous artifact, there is conflict.
Meanwhile, make a young priest of Angrosch discovered an ancient prophecy and travels to the holy city of the dwarfs. But not all Angroschim want that that surfaces what was hidden for thousands of years - and while the heroes can turn an attack on the priest near Albenhus, they are exposed to mistrust and hostility of the dwarven people in Xorlosch. When rumors are of evil omens are ripe, it is time for action for the heroes

95601.name: World Series Baseball
95601.description:
User Summary

World Series Baseball is licensed MLB baseball video game. It uses licensed MLB teams and players from the 1993 season. It has three game modes: Penant Race, Open Gameplay for quick games, and Vs for Game Gear link.

95602.name: Endless Plans 8 (Forests)
95602.description:
User Summary
Endless Plans 8 is a floor plans set for 15mm or 25mm miniatures for any RPG. The plans are of forests and what can be found in them.

Contents

4 Basic forest floors
2 Straight bridleway
2 Bridlleway corners
2 Large clearings
1 Clearing extension & small clearings
1 Clearing extension & special features
2 Short bridleway & medium clearing
1 Lengths of river
1 Bridleway junctions & river crossings




Endless Plans 8 is compatible with all the other sets in the series.

95603.name: Endless Games Mapping Pads
95603.description:
User Summary

A series of drawing pads with 50 sheet each for designing wilderness and dungeon role-playing adventures. Produced in the mid 1980s.

95605.name: Conducteur
95605.description:
Translation from back of the box:

The board game CONDUCTEUR aims to familiarize the players with the road safety code and the laws that govern it. The situations presented correspond to the reality that drivers and future drivers will face.

The goal of each player is: get the least possible offense due to his negligence or imprudence for they result in the accumulation of demerit points and expensive fines . The player thus becomes well aware of the benefits of driving with vigilance and attention.

Eight (8) players can take part in the game. They receive initially a driver's license with 0 demerit points. The player who accumulates 15 demerit points will have his license revoked and will be removed from the game. Whoever ends the game with the best record will win.

From the outset, all drivers are insured under a policy of "basic liability insurance" covering damage to their vehicle when they are the victims of an accident for which they are not responsible for, covering the damage to others.

95606.name: Casus Belli (Issue 8 - Apr 1982)
95606.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Et la 5bis, review of the 6th edition of the miniature wargame rule La flèche et l'épée
Valmy, review of La Bataille de Valmy
Squad Leader, les armes de soutien, support weapons in Squad Leader
Diplomatie, review of several Diplomacy variants
Lexique wargame, a lexicon of commonly used wargame terms
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, new monsters for AD&D
Jouez au monstre, monster races as playable characters in AD&D
La magie dans C&S, description of the magic rules of Chivalry & Sorcery (1st & 2nd Editions)
Space Opera, review of Space Opera
Computer Ambush, review of Computer Ambush
Le module, an AD&D module for a party of third-level characters titled "La Pyramide Oubliée" (the forgotten pyramid)
Nouvelles du Front

145058.name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Promo Cards

boardgameintegration.3699: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

95607.description:
Find the Magic Carrot and claim ultimate glory in Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot, the follow-up to Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot; Conquest can be played on its own or combined with the Quest blue starter game (and its boosters).

Your goal: Keep your bunnies alive, while eliminating your opponents' bunnies with whimsical and sometimes very deadly weapons! Other players will stop at nothing to keep you from collecting carrots and taking the win, in this game that is full of spoofs, parodies and hysterical references. Conquest will have you plotting your strategy (not to mention your revenge), managing your resources, crossing your fingers, bartering with the enemy, and doing whatever it takes to claim the Magic Carrot and win the game!
95607.name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot

95608.name: Angry Birds Rio

videogamehonor.29419: 2011 Golden Joystick Mobile Game of the Year Winner

95608.description:
In Angry Birds Rio, the original Angry Birds are kidnapped and taken to the magical city of Rio, where they eventually escape their captors and set out to to save their friends, Blu and Jewel - two rare macaws and the stars of the upcoming Fox motion picture, Rio. Angry Birds Rio will pair the physics-based gameplay of the original game with unique twists based on the highly-anticipated film.

Angry Birds Rio will launch with 45 dedicated levels and will regularly add new levels via app updates. The game will be available for download on smart phones and tablets worldwide.

Source: The Developer Website.

95609.name: Nu Monte Carlo Blocks
95609.description:
Is is a set of 58 colored tiles, small discs and cardboard cards (like bingo)that enable players to play a number of different games: Nu Monte Carlo Blocks, Poker, Rhumy (sic) Dominoe (sic), Cassino (sic), checkers, Color Lotto, Hoo Doo and Color Blocks.

Rules for Nu Monte Carlo Blocks: "To start the game a dealer is chosen. The blocks are placed on the table same as dominoes, face down and are shuffled. Each player draws one block starting from the right of the dealer. When a Red block is drawn, the drawer neither puts or takes from the kitty. When Green block is drawn the player places one chip in the kitty. When a Yellow block is drawn the player places two chips in the kitty.

"TO WIN, the player getting the first three in a row of same color receives three chips from the kitty. The player getting first four in a row of the same color receives four from the kitty. The player getting first five in a row of same color receives all the chips in the kitty. At no time is a winner to pay any chips to the kitty."

If that makes sense to you please explain it to me. Rules for other games are included in the images section.

95610.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Eclipse of Hope is the fifth Battle Pack in The Morrslieb Cycle, and it adds a host of new deck-building options to your Warhammer: Invasion experience. This 60 card pack contains 20 never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.

The High Elves' Starwood Staff channels the power of their ancient magic, as the Empire's Glorious Preceptor leads his charge into battle. Meanwhile, Khorne brands a once-great warrior with his corrupting mark, and a massive five-headed Hydra spews toxic fumes upon the battlefield!
95610.name: Warhammer: Invasion –  The Eclipse of Hope

95611.name: Business: Il gioco del potere
95611.description:
First of "Il Bel Paese", a collection of monthly issues appearing in Italian newspaperkiosks from late 1985. Each is a boardgame inspired by news.
"Business - Il gioco del potere" ("Business- The game of Power") depicts on its map a square grid featuring the most important public and private companies. The size in squares is larger for the most influential ones. Players put counters of their colors to control squares and when they circle a whole area, as in a kind of Go, they gain total control of it taking away all the opponents' counters. Event cards influence the deployement. Duels are done with green and red cards in a kind of "prisoner's dilemma".

95612.name: Terminator Salvation
95612.description:
User Summary:

Terminator Salvation is a action shooter game that puts the player in the shoes of the associated movie's main character John Connor, and features other characters from that film as well. The events in the game take place before the story of the Terminator Salvation movie.

The game consists of a campaign/story mode with single player or local co-op play options.

95613.description:
Another day, another mammoth hunt. But the spoils of the hunt remains to be divided, and everyone tries to secure the largest share for themselves in this quick and clever family strategy game. Each round the tiles are shuffled in the bag and dropped onto the table. The face up symbols show the spoils of today's hunt.
The tiles are then divided by a unique mechanic: When it is your turn, you may either A) Take any number of tiles from the pool, or B) Claim that another player has been too greedy, taking all of that player's tiles, but returning at least one tile to the pool (you must of course show yourself to be a little less greedy).

The next player without tiles then follows in turn. This way the size of the pool will gradually increase, and the round is over once the last player without tiles decides to take what's left in the pool. Every player will then have a share of tiles, and a scoring phase follows.

Tactical play will help you get the meat, fur, tusks, animals, and tools you want (each tile has a different way of scoring), but you may also play cards for immediate effects or to secretly influence the scoring.

- Game material is language independent -
95613.name: Mammut

95614.name: Stromschnellen
95614.description:
(from the back of the book)
While the Great River winds gently and calmly through fields, mountains and meadows, on its banks plans are being made, alliances made ​​and fierce fighting in throne rooms, at banquets and on battlefields is carried out. But in the deep woods and in the inaccessible swamps along the river, nobody cares about the politics by the great lords and ladies in their throne rooms - and nobody cares of inhabitants of the legendary fairy lands.
In this accompanying adventurebook for regional module of the Great River heroes and heroines can experience various aspects of the described lands. Sometimes it is necessary to free a boy from the clutches of a dark fairy, sometimes a secret of the Undercity of Havena must be unearthed aired or a rare animal be returned to his homeland. Explore this region in in five adventures and four scenarios provided.

95616.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Allies are desperate; they face catastrophic losses across the coast of Great Britain. With the situation so dire, they have no choice but to split their focus, sending Her Majesty's fleet to face the Axis Kriegsmarine in the Channel, and leaving the naval base at Scapa Flow defenseless...or so it seems.

Operation "SeeLöwe" (Operation Sea Lion!) offers players eight new exciting scenarios that aren't restricted by a fixed number of army points. New tiles introduce buildings into the game, offering players new tactical decisions in an urban environment. New rules and new super strong and inhuman heroes further immerse you into this stimulating expedition. Also included in Operation "SeeLöwe" is the untold history of the Axis and one of the cornerstones of their forces: the Blutkreuz Korps. Uncover truths known only to a select Axis few.

Introducing a new level of strategy to your Dust Tactics gaming experiences, Operation "SeeLöwe" assures that the battlefield will never be the same.
95616.name: Dust Tactics: Operation "SeeLöwe"

95617.name: BAM! Basic Action Magazine (Issue 2)

rpgissuearticle.85766: BASH! Fantasy Adventure: The Caverns of Gloom - The Wizards Basement

95617.description:
From publisher blurb:

Included in this issue of Basic Action Magazine are two adventures. The Fantasy Adventure: The Gloom Caverns part 2 (Wizard's Basement) and the Superheroes Christmas adventure "Ho Ho Ho, Heroes!" Holy Fifty-Foot Nutcrackers! Can the Heroes save Christmas?

Also in this issue:

To the Rescue: Blasters-- Tips and Tricks to make your Blasting Heroes and Villains off the hook!
Optional Point Buy Rules
Too Hip to Use Squares?-- Rules for running the game without using "squares".
Hero Points & Setback Points-- Allowing below and above par Heroes to still have a great time in your campaign!
BASH! Sci-Fi Edition preview of the Space Pulp Genre

95618.name: BAM! Basic Action Magazine (Issue 3)
95618.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

To the Rescue: Bricks-- Tips and Tricks to make your big bruisers into effective team players.
New Powers
Teamwork Rules
Mystery Men: Pulp-Era superheroes for BASH!
Info on the BASH! Sci-Fi Updates
Capital Ship Showdown rules-- for one-on-one fights between large ships, these rules give every character a chance to help.
New Starships for BASH! Sci-Fi Edition

boardgamehonor.13899: 2011 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

95619.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Below the Old World's cities sprawls a vast network of tunnels, caves, and underground roads. Verminous Skaven skulk within this Under Empire, waiting for the perfect opportunity to rise from the warrens and destroy their enemies for the glory of their sinister god, the enigmatic Horned Rat. Even as the Ruinous Powers work to corrupt the Old World, the Skaven are ever scheming to further their own dark agenda.

The Horned Rat expansion for Chaos in the Old World introduces a fifth player to the race toward corruption! Armed with a legion of Skaven followers, the Horned Rat player uses numbers and subterfuge to his advantage, scoring points by spreading the Skaven's teeming masses across the Old World. Players of the existing Ruinous Powers can meet the foul vermin head on with a host of new gameplay options, including alternate upgrade and Chaos cards. Meanwhile, veterans will find engaging challenges with new expert-level Old World cards and gameplay variants. Prepare to join the battle for dominance!
95619.name: Chaos in the Old World: The Horned Rat Expansion

95620.name: BAM! Basic Action Magazine (Issue 4)
95620.description:
From publisher blurb:

Basic Action Magazine #4 explores the genre of Cosmic Superheroes "With Cosmic Power..."

Ben Norman helps players old & new with "BASHing Out an Origin" for your Heroes.

95621.description:
Game description from the publisher:

An Allied general, desiring glory on the battlefield for himself and his nation, must bring the best of the best to the front lines. Dust Tactics: Light Assault Walker expansion – featuring two new walkers: Wildfire and Honey – provides players with a multitude of advantages.

Created by Allied scientists, Wildfire's dreadful weapon system will be a match for any Axis weaponry. The four heavy machine guns that top this light-weight robot fire simultaneously, delivering a deluge of firepower that lights up the darkest battlefield. Axis infantry and light vehicles will fall under the cloud of bullets that Wildfire strikes them with again and again. Eager for a speedy offensive? Use this Light Assault Walker’s high mobility and incredible agility to take a careless enemy by surprise.

There is nothing sweet about Honey except for its name. With a new next-generation phaser weapon system, this anti-tank is ready to erase your enemy from the board. With its superior system that can even engage heavy targets, Honey is an ideal vanguard of any Allied offensive. Want to blast your enemy with synchronized attacks? Honey was made to cooperate with other Allied troops, like Recon Rangers. Unify the strike by using Honey to attack the armored targets, while you have other Allied units fight against the Axis infantry.

With exciting and incredible abilities, these new Walker expansions will blast energy into your Dust Tactics experience. Check back for more information about these exciting new walkers for Dust Tactics, and get ready to take the offensive!
95621.name: Dust Tactics: Light Assault Walker – "Wildfire / Honey"

95622.description:
Game description from the publisher:

With the Allied forces heralding formidable units into the fray, Axis players will want to expand their armies to include a walker with multiple cannons for a broad range attack or a laser cannon to target Allied squads. The forces in the Dust Tactics: Light Panzer Walker expansion can be customized to either Heinrich or Hermann, both offering advantages for any Axis general to bring onto the battlefield.

With one of the most deadly weapon systems seen since the beginning of the war, the Panzer AufkclarerLaufer 1-A, aka "Heinrich" can crush an entire squad, whether or not it’s equipped with heavy armor. Heinrich’s incredible firepower derives from its four powerful FlaKvierling cannons. The Panzer AufkclarerLaufer 1-A is also versatile enough to use against lightly armored targets or engage enemies from a great distance, due to it being a light and agile vehicle.

The Axis’ newest light footed anti-tank robot, Hermann, elicits the same uneasiness in your opponent as Heinrich. With a revolutionary laser cannon Hermann can easily destroy targets much heavier than itself. Entering into a long engagement? Partner Hermann with your other Axis units, like a Recon Grenadiers squad, to both protect it and utilize it for a lengthy battle. If you’re looking to annihilate your opponent early in the game, find Hermann a secure position and use its sustained fire to waste any Allied armored unit.
95622.name: Dust Tactics: Light Panzer Walker – "Heinrich / Hermann"

95623.name: Casus Belli (Issue 9 - Jun 1982)
95623.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Red Star / White Eagle, review of GDW's Red Star/White Eagle: The Russo-Polish War, 1920
Napoleon at War (Wagram), analysis of Napoleon at War: Four Battles's Wagram scenario
Squad Leader: Fortifications, bunkers, entrenchments, foxholes, minefields and other obstacles in Squad Leader
Jeux d'alliances: les autres, overview of several diplomacy boardgames
Les figurines exotiques, unusual armies for the La Flèche et l'Epée médieval wargaming rules
Death maze, review of SPI's DeathMaze
D. and D.: attention à la marche, tips for getting started in D&D
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, roman gladiator NPCs and a monster for AD&D
Module: Les Jeux de l'Arène, a module for AD&D for a party of third level characters
Nouvelles du Front

95624.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Rising up from among the countless inhabitants of the Old World, there are those who are selected by fate to serve as its harbingers. Some are champions, battling against the ever-encroaching influence of Chaos, while others become agents of darkness, reveling in the favor of Ruinous Powers. But for good or ill, the winds of fate grant these influential figures the means to alter the Old World for generations to come, and in doing so, to become legends.

The Legends Expansion is the latest deluxe expansion for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, and it brings the power and influence the Old World's greatest figures to your deck. With 165 cards (3 copies each of 55 cards) consisting of new options for players of all factions, the Legends Expansion delivers compelling new mechanics and deck-building options that will bring your Warhammer: Invasion game to new levels of immersion and strategy.

Chief among the gameplay innovations introduced by the Legends Expansion is the inclusion of a new card type: Legend. A Legend card represents one of a faction's most influential heroes, leaders, and villains; the placement of such of card in your play area affects every zone you control, as it lends its individual strengths to your forces as a whole. For new and casual players, Legend cards present an exciting additional layer of strategy. For veteran players, these powerful cards are the keystones around which entire decks can be built.

Placed in the center of your capital board, Legend cards lend their power to all three of your zones, along with certain other benefits as described by their text. Your kingdom will prosper under the strong guidance of Thorgrim Grudgebearer, Karl Franz, Malekith, and many more. But can you protect these legendary figures from enemy attacks long enough to benefit from their presence?
95624.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Legends

95625.name: Casus Belli (Issue 10 - Sep 1982)
95625.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Freedom in the Galaxy, review of SPI's Freedom in the Galaxy
Central Front, a presentation of SPI's Central Front series of WW3 wargames
Lobositz, review of GDW's The Battle of Lobositz
Azincourt, review of GDW's The Battle of Agincourt
L'Empire au 300ème, napoleonic miniature wargaming at the 1/300 scale
Squad Leader: Camouflage, hidden troops, scouts and snipers in Squad Leader
Space Opera: Bâtir son univers, tips for Space Masters
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, new magical weapons and new monsters for AD&D (from White Dwarf)
L'Auberge du joyeux troll farceur, description of an inn, complete with a map and random event tables
Nouvelles du Front

95626.name: Monk Archetypes
95626.description:
From the back cover:

How strong is your technique?

Not all monks are alike; they vary like the shades of leaves on an autumn tree. Which one will you play? Consider the sutras of the contemplative monk, or the graceful, flowing strikes of the huashan. Can you handle the ascetic kenza, with their elemental focus, or would you prefer the itinerant seng - warriors of last resort who roam the land seeking wisdom? You may be more suited to the serene sadhu or one of the more the martial orders, like the sohei, thaskalos, or yamabushi. How will you choose to walk the path to Enlightenment? No matter what you pick, you'll find these pages not only loaded with more than archetypes, but sixty-one feats and seven new chakras.

Go beyond temples and swords. Strike your opponent with more than a flurry of fists. Pick up Monk Archetypes and show your foes your technique isn't just strong, it's Rite!

95628.name: Casus Belli (Issue 11 - Nov 1982)

rpgissuearticle.139764: Base hard du bis art: Résistance à l'alcool

95628.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Nouvelles du Front
Opération Sescuballi,a program listing for an adventure game written in BASIC, for ZX 81 computers
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, a new monster and rules for alcohol resistance for AD&D
La 7ème Epreuve, AD&D module for character levels 2
Citadel, review of GDW's Citadel: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu
Beda Fomm, review of GDW's Beda Fomm
Squad Leader: les véhicules blindés, armored vehicles in Squad Leader (plus a scenario)


And the included boardgame: Insurrection à Sonienvo

95629.name: Crisloid 5 Game Set
95629.description:
Crisloid Plastics 5 Game Set is a collection of dice and two dice cups for 5 different dice games.

Has a total of 25 d6 dice for the following games:
- 10 Pin Bowling (10 dice with a bowling pin on 1 face, 5 sides blank)
- Poker (5 dice with 10, 10, J, Q, K, Spade)
- Jack-Pot (3 dice with Bell, Lemon, Orange, Bar, Lime, Cherry)
- 5 regularly numbered dice (has rules for Craps)
- Put & Take (2 dice with A, 1, 2, 3, 3, 4 on 1 and T, T, T, P, P, P on the other).

Put and Take is a betting game where each player puts in equal amount into the pot. You then roll the dice and you put or take the number rolled. If you roll a T and an A, you take all from the pot and win.

Jack-Pot has a payout table in the rules that pays for certain rolls. For example 3 bars pays out 20 to 1, while bar-lemon-cherry equals a free roll.

95631.name: Apollo
95631.description:
Simple roll and move game with a space theme. Players race their rocketships, trying to be the first to orbit the moon and safely return to earth.

You roll a single D6 and move that many spaces, certain spaces have bonuses or penalties.

components: game rules, game board, 4 plastic rockets, 1 D6

95632.description:
SHOOT! is a soccer card game for two players. The game is played with 55 cards. The set consists of 30 soccer player cards, 2 keeper cards, 2 placement cards, 20 action cards and 1 game rules card.
Every player has a team. The team consist of 15 soccer players and a keeper.

In the upper right corner of every soccer player card are one to three soccer balls. This is the value of this soccer player for it's placement line. The value of the keeper is per action determined with a die. The higher total value in a line allows more shot (die rolls) at the goal.

The 20 action cards are used by both players.
95632.name: SHOOT!

boardgamecompilation.109361: The New Era: Spiel 2011 Promo Pack

95633.description:
Single Promo Card - free expansion in issue #17 of the quarterly Polish game magazine Świat Gier Planszowych. It is described on page 4.

Wrak Transportera ("Transporter Wreck") is a Location which gives you two universal resources when invaded (red field), one every turn while contracted (blue field). When built it allows you exchange any one resource into any other resource.

The card does not change any rules of the base game.
95633.name: 51st State: Wrak Transportera Promo Card

95634.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 23 - Aug 2003)
95634.description:
Contents:

Cover: Kitara's Revenge by Peta Hewitt
Naughty & Dice: An Adult Gamer's Guide to Sexual Situations - a preview of the exciting new RPG supplement, coming from Sabledrake Enterprises in September 2003 by Christine Morgan & Tim Morgan
The Vision by Madison
Shadow Flight by Danielle Ackley-McPhail
Summer Fading by Baxter Arnett III
Possession: Nine Tenths - (An excerpt from the novel, Tomorrow’s Memories) by Danielle Ackley-McPhail
CTF2187: The Lion's Maw by Shannon Muir
A Candle for Imbolc by Julie Ann Dawson
The Ways of Magic, Part II & III by Maelan Peredhil
Grim Discovery: an excerpt from Black Roses, the debut horror novel by Christine Morgan

95635.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 24 - Nov 2003)

rpg.8229: Bureau 13: Stalking the Night Fantastic, d20 Edition

95635.description:
Contents:

Cover: Wisdom of the Ages by Kythera
A Compelling Darkness by Kim McCallan
Abduction by Christine Morgan
A Tale of a Frozen Place by Myth Spinner
Dyeryan’s Story by Jason Bolton
Cartoons by Terry RW Whisenant
The Ways of Magic, Part IV - VIII by Maelan Peredhil
Bureau 13: Movie Magic by Nick Pollotta
Nine Lives by Harry Henze

95636.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 25 - Feb 2004)
95636.description:
Contents:

Cover: Romantic Forbidding Lovers by Margaret Demona May Stephens
Interview with Shannon Muir, author of CTF2187 fiction by Lesley Muir
Gatherings - Starting a Campaign by Brent Knowles
Tell the People What She Wore by Christine Morgan
The Ways of Magic, Part IX to XIII by Maelan Peredhil
Buttercup by Clint Wilson

95637.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 26 - May 2004)
95637.description:
Contents:

Cover: Planar Travel by R.T. Phillips
Holiday at Hogwarts, a simplified GURPS adventure by Christine Morgan
The Prisoner by Clint Wilson
Combat by Shonney Booth
McElway's Way by Lewis Korn
Wizard’s Apprentice: A prequel to The Ways of Magic by Maelan Peredhil

95638.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 27 - Aug 2004)
95638.description:
Contents:

Cover: Dragonblessed by Tom Lavelle
Marhime by Lawrence Barker
Passing Thoughts by Carl Horne
CTF 2187: Chances by Shannon Muir
Last of the Eagle Riders by Adam Janus
Angel of Death by Clint Wilson
Troika by Stephen Sobotka
A Duality of Dragons: Excerpts from the new books Silver Doorway #4: Dragon on the Loose and Gifted Children, the second Trinity Bay horror novel by Christine Morgan

95639.name: Sabledrake Magazine (Issue 28 - Nov 2004)
95639.description:
Contents:

Cover: Screech by Alex McVey
Dead Wizard by Clint Wilson
Dragon Heart by Jason Bolton
From the Pits of Hell by Adam Janus
Honor by Numbers by Mark Bolin
CTF 2187: End of an Era by Shannon Muir
Unexpected Diversions by Royce Day
Acsension by Stephanie Smith
Ranala's Story by Christine Morgan

95640.name: Auf Elfenpfaden
95640.description:
User Summary:

This is an anthology accompanying the elven sourcebook "Aus Licht und Traum"

It contains 5 adventures:

Saat der Hoffnung
Das Lied der Weide
Falscher Feind
Schwarze Flamme, Schwarzes Licht
Schreckensbilder

95641.name: Ehrenhändel
95641.description:
User Summary:

This is an anthology accompanying the sourcebook of the Middle Empire Herz des Reiches.

It contains 5 adventures:

Firun wählt
Eine almadanische Tragödie
Wohin der Schatten fällt
El Vanidad
Zwischen den Fronten

95642.name: Goldene Flügel
95642.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Marustan, the cursed land, the Tulamids calle the island. For many inhabitants of the Middle Empire Maraskan is the Green Hell, a poisonous island where every animal and plant is more deadly than the one before. Others think of the people of Maraskan as madmen or breeding grounds for demon servants. For the Maraskani themselves their island is one thing: their home. Maraskan is as diverse as creation of Rur itself.

In Goldene Flügel you experience the inhabitants of the island and learn of their particular culture, but also of the dangers and long-forgotten mysteries that lurk hidden in the heart of Maraskan.

95643.name: Märchenwälder, Zauberflüsse
95643.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Märchenwälder, Zauberflüsse is the magic sequel of Verwunschen & Verzaubert - this adventure collection consists of short stories and fairy encounters in the heart of Aventurien: fantasy.

In this volume upright heroes afar from great battles and political upheavals meet creatures, whose fates and hardships are as timeless as heart-rending. Giants and fairies, witches and ghosts, Treekin and elementals, magical mage towers, elves, ancient armorers and people with their little cares and troubles need the help of true heroes - whose fame they will carry from campfire to campfire to carry to build their own fairy tale.

95644.name: Steinzeichen
95644.description:
User Summary:

This is the accompanying anthology to the sourcebook Schild des Reiches.

It contains 4 adventures:

Das Erbe des Aikar
Schatten der Ahnen
Eiseskälte
Die Blutdurstigen

95645.name: Game Geek (Issue 14 - Feb 2011)

rpgissuearticle.77594: Arcana, Realm of the Dead Kings

95645.description:
Contents:

1, Musing of the Avalon Stogie
