95646.name: Strandgut
95646.description:
(user summary)
This is the accompanying anthology to the sea-sourcebook "Efferds Wogen".

It contains 5 adventures:
Perlwasser
Trommeln der See
Chalwens Thron
Der Fluch der Schwarzen Schlange
Winterflut

95647.name: Helden einer Saga
95647.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Hetfrau Marada Gerasdottir, rival of the Supreme Hetfrau Jurga Trondesdottir of Thorwal, invites her friends and followers to spend the winter solstice in Uddahjal on the edge of the Grey Mountains.

The heroes are there to be hosted and involved in events that allow them to dive deep into the mythology and belief of Thorwal. They will fight trolls, witches, a dragon, curses and encounter the trail of the legendary Hetfrau Thorfinna and her heritage.

Thorfinna, who once freed Thorwal from the domination of the Priest Empire, has given a promise that can turn the tides in the fight for powerv in Thorwal. The heroes walk on paths of legend to become heroes of a saga in turn.

95648.name: Die schwarze Eiche
95648.description:
From the Back of the Book:

You wake up in a dark dungeon, and you can not you remember how you got there. You can overcome the prison guards, a dark orc, quickly, and if you want, you can even liberate other prisoners. But then you got to leave the premises, where black orcs and other creatures are brooding.

In the beginning you're just looking for a way to get out. But soon you will realize that it's about something much more fundamental: the very survival!

95649.description:
Liberator: Warszawa 1944, an expansion to Mali Powstańcy, consists of two separate expansions. First: "the Liberator" is about allied air forces dropping weapons and meds for the insurgents. The figurine of a Liberator moves through the board. Players can change its path (using new movement card called: light signals). In most of the game rounds Liberator drops something and randomly picked up tokens appear in location on the map. First player who manage to pick it up will receive some small bonus in form of victory points, additional movement, special actions etc. The drop tokens are kept secret and players can use them in any moment of a game which makes interesting combo-opportunities.

The second expansion is about delivering private mail. There are private letters in different locations from the start of the game. Contrary to the orders each letter may be picked up only by one player and each player can have as much of private mail as he/she wants. Moreover the letters should be delivered before the game ends not only in next few game rounds. The tricky part is that each undelivered letter results in minus points to the player who picked it up.

The last part of Liberator expansion are the new secret mission cards!

Two expansions may be added separately or both at the same time to both versions of the base game: basic and extended.
95649.name: Liberator: Warszawa 1944

95652.description:

95654.description:

Nouvelles du Front
Squad Leader, les armes antichar, infantry antitank weapons (ATR, rocket launchers, magnetic mines...) in Squad Leader, and three scenarios
Panzerblitz, review of Avalon Hill's PanzerBlitz

Module: Convoi Perdu, level 3 AD&D module
Duel sur Zloog, rules for the included boardgame Duel sur Zloog

95655.description:
User Summary:

Nouvelles du Front
Victory in the West, review of SPI's Victory in the West series

War in the Falklands, review of Mayfair games' War in the Falklands
Programme inédit: Dédale, BASIC listing for a maze exploration game (written for ZX 81 machines)

Armées gagnantes, strategy tips for the medieval miniature wargaming rules La Flèche et l'Epée
Ludotique, review of the computer game Pursuit of the Graf Spee
Barbarian King, review of SPI's Barbarian Kings
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, a new creature for AD&D

C.B. Echo, form for reader feedback
Au jour le jour, calendars and the flow of time in homebrew campaign settings
Périple en Alarian, a campaign setting for fantasy RPGs

95657.name: Dispatches from the Bunker #32
95657.description:
A magazine dedicated to Advanced Squad Leader. This issue has an analysis of VOTG 18 ‘In Sight of the Volga’, Tactical Tips and perspectives on four scenarios. Also included are four scenarios:

DB086 Lack of Communication - German infantry assault the US perimeter in an attempt to destroy the Bridge at Remagen during the 1945 push to cross the Rhine.

DB087 Jumonji Pass - A Russian combined arms force assault dug in Japanese infantry in Manchuria 1945.

DB088 No Rest For The Weary - A 1945 attempt to relieve an encircled Silesian village on the Eastern Front by a combined arms German force meets a heavily armed Russian defender.

DB089 Get Tito - This scenario covers the 1944 attempt by German forces to kill or capture Marshall Tito the leader of the Yugoslavian partisans.

95658.name: Sickness in Springdale
95658.description:
From the Introduction:
In this adventure, the PCs attempt to save the town from a deadly illness by finding a source of Lady’s Staff, a plant that cures the affliction. To do so, they need to travel through the Lady’s Woods where they will meet a series of challenges to gain her favor. During the course of their travels, they find that their town is not the only one with the disease, the local goblins and elves are sick as well. If they gain her favor, she provides a ritual that multiplies the plant, providing enough to heal the town as well as the elves and goblins. If they fail, they will find their trip difficult and arduous.

Sickness in Springdale is the 3rd offering in the 6-Pack Adventure series from Postmortem Studios.

95659.name: LaserGrenadiers
95659.description:
subtitled: "wargaming rules for 28mm science fiction miniatures" this is one of several rules-sets introduced by small/independent companies to allow gamers to play miniatures games in a more realistic "science fiction" setting, rather than the "science fantasy" setting that a leading miniatures gaming company adopted.

B&W ringbound rulebook

95660.name: Gravemyst
95660.description:
From the Introduction:

Eight hundred thousand years ago a massive shard of black obsidian ripped through the fabric separating the world of mortals from the Far Realm. It crashed down into the earth, piercing the planet and creating a wound that would never heal.

Eight hundred thousand years later, the winds of time have uncovered the obsidian shard and the mountain that grew around it, now known as the Black Spire. Dark wizards, necromancers, and beasts beyond the world of man sought out its tainted mystery. One of these, a black dragon named Grenthoel, sent the
others from the mountain or to the bottom of the chasms that riddle the caverns of the Black Spire.

There the dragon, armed with the necromancy of the spire’s former inhabitants, transformed himself into a dracolich and became known as Gravemyst.

Centuries later, the small village of Winter’s Dusk prospered nearby using the energy stored in a magical artifact known as the Star of Summer. Their crops flourished, their herds grew, and the villagers found rest and prosperity.

Nine months ago, dark agents of the dracolich calling themselves the Children of the Spire, attacked the town and stole the Star of Summer before returning to their lair in the caverns below the Black Spire. Drought, pox, and famine now cling to the village, leaving its people in despair.

95661.description:
A very light and simple two players card game by Bruno Faidutti, it has been published successively, each time with some additions and developmenst, in the French magazines Sciences & Vie Découverte (1999), then in the Japanese boardgame magazine Gamelink (2011), and last in the French comics magazine Lanfeust, in 2016.

The Battle of Gods is a variation on the good old game of War, which tries to add some subtleties, both with tactics and bluffing.
The first new idea is that cards are played in pairs. First, each player plays a card. Cards are revealed, and then each player plays a second one, and their values are added. This makes for some interesting dilemmas.
The second new idea is that there are 6 sets of 12 cards, for six different mythologies. In each game, each player plays a different mythology. In each set, two or three cards have special effects when played, making for interesting combos and even more bluffing.
It's a two player game, but the six available mythologies make for 15 different possible duels.
95661.name: Battle of the Gods

95662.name: A Fistful of TOWs 3
95662.description:
A Fistful of TOWs 3 is a fast-playing battalion- to brigade/regiment-level game using miniatures. Game covers mid-1930s to 2015, and army lists from WW2 and post-war eras. Each stand represents a platoon. Can be played with miniatures from 2mm up to 15mm with no modifications; for larger miniatures authors suggest possibly changing ground scale. Design ground scale is 1"=100m, can be played using 1cm=100m without altering any numbers. Nominal turn length is 12 minutes, but for infantry heavy games 20 or 30 minutes per turn is probably more accurate.
Game features:
- Troop quality is very important
- Simple command rules
- Includes a full battle-generator campaign system.
- WW2 comprehensive data and army lists for Germany, USA, UK, France, and Poland. Authors will be releasing Italian data and army lists as a free expansion.
- Modern data on over 1000 post-war armored vehicles, artillery, helicopters, etc.
- Modern army lists for US Army 1950-2015, Russian Army 1970-2015, most of the NATO allies in the 1980s-1990s, Arab-Israeli wars in 1967 and 1973, Australia 1966-2015, and North Vietnam/Vietcong 1964-1973.
- Includes rules for airstrikes, airborne and amphibious assaults, helicopters, chemical weapons, tactical nukes.
- Formatted for easy reading.
- 458 pages including: 104 pages of core rules, 26 pages of supplemental rules, 96 pages of army lists, 128 pages of vehicle/gun/infantry/aircraft data, 18 pages of scenario/campaign design and system, quick reference charts, introduction, detailed table of contents, index, etc.

95665.name: Dungeon Raid

videogamehonor.21142: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Computer Wargame Nominee

95665.description:
User Summary

A tile matching game that has you gathering gold, upgrading your weapons, and defeating monsters on your quest to, well, get to the top of the leaderboards! Familiar gameplay, but with enough twists and options to keep the game fresh for a long time.

95670.description:
The expansion was published in Spielbox magazine (issue 2011/01) with the approval of 2F-Spiele, but is considered non-official.

Spielbox description (see file English Spielbox page with rules entry) is signed by Markus Treis (DasBaerchen) and Charly_Petri. Graphic design of the power plant is attributed to Christof Tisch under close observation by Maura Kalusky.

Note that the expansion appeared in "Besser Spielen" section rather than as "Edition Spielbox". So the magazine does not contain any components. There are only rules and a picture of a card - see Files section for those.
95670.name: Funkenschlag: Speicherkraftwerk

95671.name: Siege: Dogs of War
95671.description:
User Summary:

Siege: Dogs of war is a add-on/Expansion released by Mindcraft games for their earlier game Siege. Siege: dogs of war added new troops, Scenarios, and castles to the original as well as local Modem to Modem play.

95672.name: Jikandia: The Timeless Land
95672.description:
For thousands of years, the people of Jikandia were happy and peaceful, utterly ignorant of the concept of time. Then one…day, uncountable hordes of dangerous creatures appeared, bringing chaos to Jikandia and setting the wheels of time turning once again. Plunged suddenly into this newly-temporal reality, the people of Jikandia fell into confusion, terror, and anarchy.

In the midst of the mayhem gripping the land, an ancient spirit known as Temtem, hoping to restore peace and harmony to the troubled land, somehow gained mastery over time and space. With this new-found power, Temtem attempted to summon the nine heroes of legend. Nine kids on their way to school found themselves summoned through time and space to become the champions of Jikandia. However, only Al, who was separated from his friends while traveling through the void, appeared before Temtem. Neither of them knew what had happened to Al’s friends, but it soon become clear that Al had to find them, and right Jikandia’s wrongs, if he was ever to return home.

In Jikandia, you must travel through dungeons in search of your friends. You can set the time limit for each dungeon yourself! Dungeons are altered in several ways according to the time limit you set, so no adventure is the same twice! The longer you spend in one, the more likely you’ll come across rare items and treasure chests…but you’ll also face more monsters and difficult traps. Also, by meeting certain requirements, you can unlock specific events and cause legendary items to appear. Activating the “Awakening” mode will make you stronger, faster, and more powerful! Obtain magic orbs to customize your hero’s skills as you wish. Up to four PSP systems can be linked to play in the Jikandia Coliseum timed stages where you can battle against your friends and dodge traps to win with the highest score!

Source: The Publisher Website.

95673.name: Vorbeugen und Helfen
95673.description:
Vorbeugen und Helfen (English: Prevention and Help) is a learning game for children to gain strength in dangerous situations.

Idea and aim of "Prevention and Help" is to caution children to crimes. Children should know what danger lays in several situations. They should

gain knowledge about these possible dangerous situations
experience solidarity and helpfulness
learn self-confidence
learn power of sustenance
learn to communicate




The possible dangerous situations may be:

DANGER AT THE DOOR
ENCOUNTER ON THE ROAD
A CHILD GETS LOST
AWAKING OF JEALOUSY AND TEMPTATION
BURGLARY AT THE SWIMMINGPOOL
BICYCLE BURGLARY
THE ORPHANT APARTMENT
PARKING VACATION CAR
INCITEMENT OF ROBBERY
BLACKMAIL
DANGEROUS MOTORBYC DRIVING
PLAYING WITH FIRE




How to play:
A tile is chosen and placed face-down in the middle of the table. Adjacent to it the pile of shuffled Prevent- and Helpcards. Every player takes 3 Prevent-/Helpcards (placing them face-up in front of each player), 2 prevent thaler and 2 help thaler.
When the tile is turned face-up the communication process starts.

The game components include:
12 game tiles about dangerous situations
72 Prevention and Helpcards
20 Prevention Thaler "Smiling Policeman"
20 Help Thaler "Serious Policeman"
Appraisal Chits

95674.name: Crysis 2

videogamefranchise.28570: EA Value Games (Best Selling Electronic Arts Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.31893: 2010 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee

95674.description:
It’s 2023, terrifying alien invaders stalk the New York City streets. Only you can prevail, wielding the supersoldier enhancements of Nanosuit 2.

BE STRONG – Take on multiple enemies with Armor mode, mince them with heavy weapons or squash them by kicking cars.

BE FAST – Get to the action quickly, then powerjump, ledgegrab and slide round the environment with amazing agility.

BE INVISIBLE – Use Stealth mode to set traps or hit and run your enemies, or snipe from a concealed position.

BE THE WEAPON – With the Nanosuit, you choose how you want to play.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Microbadges:

Crysis Series fan

95675.name: Casus Belli (Issue 14 - Apr 1983)
95675.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:


Nouvelles du Front
Pacifique 42, historical article about the Pacific theater in 1942, with reviews of Midway and Flat Top
1941, review of GDW's 1941 (the game was republished later in Casus Belli issue #54)
White death,review of GDW's White Death
Squad Leader, tanks versus infantry in Squad Leader, and a scenario
Hordes fantastiques, introduction to miniature fantasy wargaming
Ludotique, reviews of the videogames Guadalcanal Campaign and Adventure to Atlantis
Killer, advice for setting up a Killer game
La Septième Victime, the Robert Sheckley short story that inspired Killer
Space Opera, advice for beginning space masters
Devine qui vient diner ce soir, a new monster for AD&D and Space Opera
Rat noir, scenario for AD&D
En chasse, Mister Zap!, rules for the included boardgame En chasse, Mister Zap

95676.name: Kingdoms of the Sword & Stars: Dunkargans & Karnuans
95676.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Western Loerem was once a mighty empire, but following the Fall of Old Vinnengael, it was divided into two separate kingdoms - Dunkarga, Kingdom of the Stars, and Karnu, Kingdom of the Sword.

The Guilds of Dunkarga vie with the throne for power in an ancient kingdom whose grandeur faded, while the militant Karnuans slowly strike outwards from their kingdom, claiming both land in Vinnengael and the Isle of Mount Sa'Gra, teh sacred island of the orks.

In this sourcebook you will find details tracing the history of both kingdoms, information about key individuals, the Guilds and the Armies, along with prestige classes such as the Esteemed Courtesan and the militant Shieldbearers, new feats and weapons, strange new monsters, and plenty more information to help flesh out the lands and people of Dunkarga & Karnu.

95677.name: Sudongeon Rules
95677.description:
Designer's Description:

The Rules for Sudongeon, the free, DM-less, Sudoku-based dungeon-crawl for your coffee-break.

95678.name: Reiner Knizia's Roto
95678.description:
From the developer:

Roto is a challenging and addictive game developed by international best seller Dr. Reiner Knizia.

The rules are simple so anyone can play:
You rotate 6-colored wheels to match segments with the same color in adjacent wheels, without losing points on needless rotations.

Mastering all the challenges and planning ahead to use the best possible combinations is harder than it may seem.

There are 3 different gameplay, all with different constraints:
- Puzzle
- Arcade
- Action

95679.description:
The card game Oz, based on the L. Frank Baum novel The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, contains two decks of cards: one a character deck with nine copies each of Dorothy, Toto the dog, the Scarecrow, the Lion, the Tin Man, the Good Witch, the Wicked Witch and the Wizard of Oz, and the other a story deck, with each story card explaining how to score points at the end of the game, e.g., each pairing of Dorothy and the Lion scores two points, while having the majority of Witch cards is worth eight points.

The game lasts 8—9 rounds, and at the start of each round, the players draw cards from the decks to create n+1 columns (where n is the number of players), with each column having two character cards and one story card. Each player chooses one column, placing the story card on the table and the character cards in his hand. From the fifth round on, a player can have only four story cards in front of him, so each time he chooses a column, he must discard a story card from his collection. After the final round, players reveal their character cards and tally their points to see who wins.
95679.name: Oz

95680.description:
From the back:
"Finally, Regent Stephan Lukather broke the silence. 'For twenty years TOG has forced us back across Shannendam County. We must stop them here.'
'We shall scatter them like sand before us!' Count Horace declared, slapping his clenched fist into his open palm.
Massus' expression became graver as he stared out at the vast ocean of space. Behind him, General Biders turned to Commander Kry'll.
'Proceed with the plan, Anrathe.'
She bowed with a satisfied smile and retired with a whisper of silk. Barely aware of the backgroud conversation, The Grand Duke continued to gaze at the planet and starfield before him. Recalling his son's bravado, he hoped they would not end up shoveling sand against the TOG tide.
Thus began OPERATION...

Gathering Storm

A new scenario book for use with the RENEGADE LEGION series of games. Includes scenarios for INTERCEPTOR, CENTURION, LEVIATHAN, and LEGIONNAIRE. Use requires ownership of one of those games.
95680.name: Renegade Legion: Gathering Storm

95681.name: RTL Racing Team Manager
95681.description:
User Summary:

"RTL Racing Team Manager" is a manager game, based in the fast paced world of Formula 1. The player takes control of a racing team and tries to get the best effort out of his team. Earning moneym win racing weekends and finaly beeing world racing champion is the goal of the game.

95682.name: Crazy Machines 2: Back to the Shop Add-on
95682.description:
User Summary:

This expansion for "Crazy Machines 2" brings 60 new puzzles and 12 new items to the puzzle game.

boardgameimplementation.22172: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion

95683.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Explore ancient mysteries with The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh (Revised Edition)! This updated and revised version of the 2006 Arkham Horror expansion adds a terrible threat to your game in the form of the Dark Pharaoh and his mysterious artifacts.

With new Exhibit Item and Exhibit Encounter cards, players can uncover the artifacts that have gone missing from the museum's current "Legacy of the Pharaohs" exhibit. But beware! The Dark Pharaoh will not let his treasures go so easily. The Avatar of Nyarlathotep himself joins the fray with the Dark Pharaoh Herald sheet, spreading his curse throughout the game.

Finally, The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh (Revised Edition) also adds Patrolled Neighborhoods, Benefits and Detriments, and Ancient Whispers, all creating additional layers to your games of Arkham Horror.
95683.name: Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)

95684.name: Champions Villains Volume Two: Villain Teams
95684.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Champions Villains - a trilogy of Champions supplements - describes the bad guys of the Champions Universe in thorough detail. It doesn’t describe every single villain, of course (three books, even big ones, aren’t enough for that), but within these three volumes you’ll find over 300 villains - the most important, intriguing, dangerous, and defining supercriminals in the setting. This book, Volume 2, covers villain teams: groups of villains (usually of roughly equal power) who form a group so they can commit more profitable crimes, protect one another, and perhaps even take over the world.

95685.name: E-Z Future Deluxe
95685.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to the future... Fat Dragon style! E-Z FUTURE: Deluxe Edition provides everything necessary for exciting sci-fi gaming, from roving security bots to a fully detailed shuttlecraft. Our exclusive DRAGON LAYERS options allows you to customize each piece before printing, making them as dirty, chipped, and blaster damaged as you like. Walls and floors include layered access panels that can be removed to reveal interior workings, and archways include sliding doors. Our exclusive E-Z LOCK system allows you to disassemble your layout and store virtually flat, utilizing simple bobby-pins (hidden within the wall) to connect all structures together!

This set includes:

- 3D walls, each with DRAGON LAYER graphic options, in 2″, 3″, 4″ & 6″ lengths
- Angled Wall
- ‘X’ Intersection
- ‘T’ Intersection
- ‘L’ Intersection
- Doorways with sliding doors
- Security bots
- Ramp with exclusive ‘no-slip’ design for minis
- Shuttlecraft (2 colors options)
- Our exclusive E-Z LOCK pillars
- Full color instructions

95686.name: Castle Winterhawk
95686.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Castle Winterhawk base set has everything you need to make massive castles or keeps. This set includes our innovative DRAGON LAYERS options which allows you to customize your models before printing. Add snow, icicles, vines, bushes, stains and more (even yellow puddles in the snow, if you know what we mean), all with a few easy clicks. Best of all the entire set is E-Z LOCK compatible, making building and take down a snap using common bobby-pins for all connections, and everything comes apart for easy storage.

This set includes:

- Gridless and 1″ grid tile options
- Castle Walls in 1″, 2″, 4″ and 6″ wide versions
- Castle towers, complete with upper level interiors
- 3D Spiral stairs for towers
- Beautiful 3D and ‘fast build’ 2D crenelation options
- E-Z LOCK pieces for all structures
- Gatehouse with portcullis that can be positioned raised or lowered
- Opening gatehouse doors
- Interior buildings with removable roofs and floor levels for interior play
- Customizable ground tiles with grass, grass/dirt, partially snow covered, full snow, wood, and stone options.
- All new E-Z LOCK designs for buildings, including the ability to stack multiple levels securely
- E-Z LOCK slanted roofs!
- Wooden hoardings that can be swapped out in seconds
- Optional wooden tower roofs
- Full color instructions
- Our exclusive Beginners Guide

95687.name: Hippimill
95687.description:
Goal: Be the first moving all of your 4 (large) meeples into
the target area

1. Roll three dice - allocate the numbers to appropriate meeples you may - if useful - allocate all numbers to one meeple
2. Try to hit opposing meeples - you may decide, of you want to use your movement points either forward or backwards
3. Rolling a 'triple' you have another turn

95688.name: BattleBox 4th Edition: Heroic 2
95688.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tabletop tokens to challenge Heroic Tier characters

Nine pages of heavy cardstock-mounted, die-cut full-color counters just punch and play! Every Heroic level monster from the second core Monster Book. Flip the counters over to reveal a "bloodied" side with the monster name.

95689.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 171 - Jan 2011)
95689.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #171
January 2011

Better Gate Than Lever

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

95690.description:
Battles by Gaslight is based on the popular Gaslight Victorian science fiction rules, but is designed to allow players to fight larger battles with several players each controlling four or more units. Game mechanics have been streamlined to allow players to control more units; however, the flavor of Gaslight has been retained. 48 pages.

Units in Gaslight generally consist of ten figures led by one or more Main Characters, in Battles by Gaslight this is expanded so that a player will control three or four entire units each led by a (Main Character) Commander which are in turn led by an overall Army Commander. A player may also control vehicles and their crews. The games are a combination of unit actions and individual heroism in the tradition of adventure novels and swashbuckling films.

Command and control is accomplished now through a combination die roll and card-draw turn system. Movement is based on moving entire units as they activate, keeping them within distance of their Commander. Firing is done by units as a whole now instead of individual figures like in Gaslight (although Main Character Commanders may fire separately) and the firing procedure is still very streamlined. Morale is handled in a similar fashion to Gaslight with minor adjustments.

The authors made the specific design choice not to build their own world for these rules. Instead the rules allow for the use of any vehicles, weapons, and creatures that players desire for their personal perception of Victorian science fiction.
95690.name: Battles by Gaslight

95692.name: Mutant Storm Reloaded
95692.description:
User Summary:

Mutant Storm is a top-down, dual-stick shmup, similar in some ways to the classic Asteroids game. You pilot a tiny ship that careens around single room, vertical plane stages and you must blast all the encroaching mutants while dodging their incoming fire. You can pick up power-ups to boost your abilities. You can play offline with either one or two players. There is no online multiplayer. Adventure Mode is the campaign in which you advance through the levels. Tally Mode is a quickplay mode that requires you to try and rack up the largest number of points on a given stage. You can add personal music tracks to the gameplay.

95694.name: Game Geek (Issue 15 - Mar 2011)
95694.description:
Contents:

2, Musing of the Avalon Stogie
3, Behind the Game, S&G
6, Junkyard Wars, Strip #15
7, Coral Thrown, Chapter IX
13, Artist Spotlight - John Dotegowski
18, Mark's Musings - Mark L. Chance
21, Geek Profile
23, Maps by Claudio
24, Multi-Verse, Panda
25, Avalon Pathfinder: New Magic items
27, Battle Axe, New Spell Cards
28, Leviathans: Expert Upgrades
30, Reviews - Megan Robertson
32, What's New
34, Cool Stuff
36, Arcana, Shithmoora Heraldry

95695.description:
A continuation of the Polish bestselling series "Wiochmen Rejser" and "Wiochmen 2". Available in Polish only.

Wiochmen Wesele (Countryfellow Wedding) is an adventure card game in which you will take the roles of guests of a not-really-typical countryside wedding reception. They take court in the company of other guests, make new friends, dance, drink, eat and generally have fun, at the same time creating groups of followers who will help them in case of any trouble. All this takes place in a stylish fire station, temporarily changed into a party room.

The objective of the game is to gain as many Fun Points as possible before the end of the game and make life tougher for your opponents. The time passing is measured with successive wedding events. The points are obtained mostly by Winning Over new guests and challenging other players to Duels (you do this by rolling a die and testing one of your attributes - Chat or Muscle - against the corresponding attribute of the opponent/guest).
95695.name: Wiochmen Wesele

95696.name: Neuromachia
95696.description:
From the back of the cover:

Neuroshima zawsze miała szczęście do fanów i do ich twórczości. Powstawały i cały
czas powstają świetne materiały, w tym całe dodatki w postaci pliku .pdf. W wydaw-
nictwie czytamy je i kręcimy głowami z podziwem. Aż wreszcie pojawiła się myśl -
dlaczego by nie wydać takiego dodatku drukiem? Przecież często jest on tak świetny,
że warto uwiecznić go na papierze!
Od idei do czynów: oto przed Wami tom z Kolekcji Dodatków Fanowskich.

and translation:

Neuroshima always had luck with it's fans and their creation. They create great materials for the game including the whole expansions in PDF files. We, in the publisher office, read these materials and we shake our heads. At last we came up with an ide - why shouldn't we print such expansion? After all, they are commonly so great that they deserve to be printed.
From idea to creation: here before You is the first tome of Collection of Fans' Expansions.

95697.name: Astropop
95697.description:
User Summary:

This action puzzler (similar to Tetris) puts you in control of a rocket ship as it attempts to clear descending colored bricks. You can hold up to six colored bricks at a time and then release them back up towards similar colored bricks. The object is to create combos of four or more similar colored bricks. This causes them to disappear. Certain blocks are also imbued with powers that effect the gameplay (explosions, rockets, etc.) The player can select from four different characters that each have a different super ability that can be deployed during a level. The two game modes are: Classic and Survival. Checkpoints are also included to offer save points during Classic Mode.

95699.description:
The cooperative game Ghost Stories often has players on the edge of their seats with uncertainty over whether their monks will be able to protect a village against the many aspects of Wu-Feng that threaten it. With Ghost Stories: Black Secret, the players will face an even more powerful dilemma: Wu-Feng himself.

Yes, the player count for Black Secret is 2-5 (instead of 1-4) as one player will take on the role of Wu-Feng and harass the monks in a more direct manner than they've experienced previously. Wu-Feng now chooses where the incoming ghosts will be placed on the individual monk boards. Instead of placing the ghost on the board, Wu-Feng can use that ghost to power colored spells matching the color of the ghost (while casting the spells bring Wu-Feng access to stronger spells) or to bring new demon miniatures in play that scour the catacombs underneath the village; these figures are searching for the remains of Wu-Feng by digging in the dirt located there, and should they find the three icons required, the shadow of Wu-Feng descends on the village to fight directly with the monks.

To aid the monks in their fight against this more devious incarnation of Wu-Feng, they have access to blood mantras, special abilities that come in different levels to adjust for the difficulty of play. When a monk loses a life, the Qi token is placed on the mantra. When two tokens are on one of the level-2-mantras, one monk of the players' choice gains a Qi. When 4 Qi are collected on one of the level-4-mantras, all village tiles are dehaunted.
95699.name: Ghost Stories: Black Secret

95701.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 3 - May 2010)

rpgissuearticle.114764: Aelous Raven and the Wrath of the Sea-Witch

95701.description:
Contents:

FEATURES
6, Interview: The Pen is Mightier than the Sword - Martin McKenna
16, Mini-Adventure: Prey of the Hunter - Kieran Coghlan
52, The Fact of Fiction: Book 35: Daggers of Darkness - Warren McGuire & Andrew Wright
70, Fighting Fantasy in France - Julien Meneldur

OTHERS
60, Turn to Paragraph 400 - The Survey!
74, Aelous Raven and the Wrath of the Sea Witch Prologue - Ian Brocklehurst
78, Everything I Really Need to Know I Learnt from Reading Fighting Fantasy Gamebooks Part 3 - Ed Jolley

REGULARS
4, Omens & Augeries
64, Out of the Void - Alexander Ballingall, Marcus Bone, Andrew Wright
68, Chronicle of Heroes - Adrian Young
80, Fighting Fantasy Collector - Jamie Fry
82, Fighting Dantasy - Dan Satherley

95702.name: Meganoid
95702.description:
The planet is under attack by aliens, who might not be aliens but mutated humans, who are possibly mutated by real aliens actually from another planet, most likely hired by a big human corporation with very likely some connections with another species controlled by evil aliens from yet another planet.

And now: only a hero can save the planet..atleast that’s what everyone was hoping for, but since all heroes have now come and gone, you are the last option!

Go be the last hero!

Source: The Developer Website.

95703.name: Air Combat Aces
95703.description:
User Summary

Compilation box with 3 flight sims:

Falcon
Gunship
Strike Aces

95704.name: The Journal of Tekumel Affairs (Vol III, Issue 1 - Summer 1982)
95704.description:
user summary:

Articles about life, history, and culture on Tekumel, suitable for any game system on that world.

format comment
the pages are stapled along the left side with two staples

95705.description:
The tactical game set shortly after the big bang...

The Big Bang: emerging from nothing, matter explodes into being and over time unites into celestial bodies composed of different elements – with everybody trying to secure as much of those elements as possible.

In this tactical game, players send their astronauts from one celestial body to another to collect elements located there in various sizes and combinations. The value of these elements, however, won't be fixed until the end of the game, and the players can use the effects of gravity to combine or separate heavenly bodies, thereby increasing or reducing the value of their elements for opponents.

Urknall received a special prize in a game author's competition sponsored by Spielmaterial.de. The task was to create a new game with given materials, and the author received this prize because he used nothing more than the materials given instead of adding additional components.
95705.name: Urknall: The Big Bang

95706.name: No Quarter (Issue 28 - Jan 2010)

rpgissuearticle.39309: Battle Report - Battle at Low Tide

95706.description:
From Publisher Website:

WARMACHINE: Prime Mk II has arrived! Get into the action in No Quarter Magazine 28, with the first Mk II battle report. Walk the mean streets of Blackwater and then learn how to put together your own Cryxian town. Get ready for two-fisted fury with the Order of Keeping and the Order of Fist in Sign & Sigil. In Guts & Gears we'll crack open the Templar, one of the new warjacks from Prime MKII.

Cover Art "Assault Kommando Flame Thrower" by Imaginary Friends Studio

ISSN: 7558200681

95707.name: Super Drill  Panic
95707.description:
User Summary

Grab the artifact and RUN!

As a daring adventurer, make your way to the bottom of each region while attempting to keep from being crushed by the falling boulder.

95708.name: Citadel of Skulls
95708.description:
Publisher Blurb:

On the hunt to discover the cause of vanishing settlements and increased xenos sightings, you and your fellow Explorers are thrust on a perilous journey. A great beast has awakened from beyond the edges of the Koronus Expanse, hungering to fulfill its dark purpose. Before you and your fellow Explorers can attempt to seek it out and ultimately destroy it, you must uncover what and where it is. Finding the answer is a nearly impossible undertaking, pitting you against an infamous pirate lord blessed by Chaos.

Citadel of Skulls, the second adventure in The Warpstorm Triology for Rogue Trader, can be played as a standalone adventure or connected to the events introduced in The Frozen Reaches. Prepare to attempt the ultimate heist: stealing a priceless artefact from the vault of Karrad Vall. No sane person has ever risked entering the Faceless Lord’s inner sanctum, let alone stealing from him...until you.

Plot your course through Vall’s dark cathedral, past quivering slaves and brutal enemies, bloody chambers, and the ossuaries full of bones that give the Citadel its name. And once you reach the Casket of Secrets you’ll meet “the Archivist.”

An epic adventure of exploration, combat, and acquisition of wealth, Citadel of Skulls will be a suspenseful and thrilling journey. Will you be able to withstand the voyage?

95709.name: Drill Panic!
95709.description:
Escape the drill by tilting your Android phone left or right. Collect diamonds on the way down, and avoid obstacles

A simple, fun, and hectic game! Try to stay ahead of the drill, and collect as many diamonds as you can on your way down the tunnels. Beat the highscores!

Source: The Developer Website.

95710.name: Bop It!
95710.description:
From Parker Brothers:

Get ready to react fast! Turn on the BOP IT game unit and get ready to Bop, Pull, and Twist your way to victory. For even more of a challenge, activate the microphone and Shout It, too! Choose to play alone or invite your friends for a game of Party Bop - you’ll all have to use your knees, elbows, and hips to win! The better you get, the more skill levels you unlock, so think fast and be the BOP IT master!

BOP IT calls out commands and you reactfast!

Includes Bop It game unit and instructions.

3 AAA batteries included.

For 1 or more players.

95711.name: The Journal of Tekumel Affairs (Vol III, Issue 5 - Winter 1983)
95711.description:
user summary:

Articles about life, history, and culture on Tekumel, suitable for any game system on that world.

format comment
the pages are stapled along the left side with two staples

95712.name: No Quarter (Issue 29 - Mar 2010)
95712.description:
From Publisher Website:

No Quarter 29 goes underground with all things Rhulic! Get inside the decidedly insane mind of Durgen Madhammer in the Gavyn Kyle Files. Take a tour of Horgenhold and learn how to build trenches, bunkers, and all things dirt-related. PLUS: an Iron Kingdoms RPG mini-adventure leading your players into the chaos and ruin of Sul!

Cover Art "Ghordson Avalancher" by Luke Mancini

ISSN: 7558200682

95713.name: Critical Hit! Tanks Special Edition
95713.description:
This is the Tanks! Special Edition of Critical Hit magazine.

Included are the following articles:

Desert Tactics by Robert Modarelli
Soldiers of Lagus by Tommi Syrjanen
Jatkosota: Design Notes by Ray Tapio
Tigers in Tunisia by Rory Millard

Included are the following scenarios:

CH63 March of the Mastodons - German infantry heavily reinforced by assault guns and tank destroyers must stop General Patton’s attempt to relieve Bastogne during the Battle of the Bulge (1944).

CH64 Race for the Bridges - A German infantry company defends a key village with armored support as the Americans attempt to seize a bridge over the Rhine (1945).

CH65 The Seton Block - Battalion strength Japanese infantry attempt to bypass a Chinese roadblock during their retreat from northern Burma (1944).

CH66 One for the Trophy Case - With the drive on Tunis (1943) stopped German armor tests the resolve of the British by unleashing the Tiger tank.

CH 67 New Kid on the Block - The British armored spearhead driving toward Tunis (1942) runs into a new German weapon, the Tiger tank.

CH68 Special Messenger - German armored forces must clear a desert track of American infantry that have hastily occupied this position during the German counterattack from Tunis (1943).

CH69 Baptism of Fire - American infantry with British armor support assault dug in Germans on the Siegfried line (1944).

CH70 Surprise at Honkaniemi - A Finnish armored counterattack catches Russian tankers taking a break in this late Winter War (1940) action.

CH71 Bottom of the Barrel - Russian infantry and armor assault dug in Germans during the final hours of the Third Reich (1945).

CH72 Across the Wurm - American infantry supported by British armor attempt to crack the Siegfried line (1944) against dug in German infantry with Panther support.

Jatkosota 2 (ver 2) At the Gates of Viipuri - A Soviet infantry company reinforced by heavy tanks attempts to crack Finnish defenses during the Soviet attempt to knock Finland out of the war (1944).

ABS1 Ivan’s Roadblock - German infantry and armor must eliminate a Russian roadblock during the early blitzkrieg into Russia (1941).

ABS2 The Chantilly Prelude - A German infantry platoon faces a weakened American infantry platoon for control of a village during the assault on the Siegfried Line (1944), but reinforcements are on the way.

95714.name: No Quarter (Issue 30 - May 2010)

rpgissuearticle.39502: Battle Report - Blood in the Sand

95714.description:
From Publisher Website:

No Quarter hits a milestone with its 30th issue! Get a first look at the new Mk II HORDES: Primal. Learn how to build your own working 'jack scrap yard in Terrain Building. Prepare to feel the pain, as the Satyxis flaunt their stuff in Guts and Gears. Plus, Grind players rejoice in information about the latest league.

Cover Art "Lord Tyrant Hexeris" by Andrea Uderzo

ISSN: 7558200683

95717.name: Die Geheimnisse von Grangor
95717.description:
(user summary)
This book is a reissue of
B23 Die Bettler von Grangor
and
B4 Die Kanäle von Grangor.

Moreover, ot contains 6 scenario ideas in Grangor

95718.name: Drachenodem
95718.description:
(from the back of the book)
This collection of adventures is dedicated to the ancient and mysterious creatures of Aventuria: the dragons. From the seemingly harmless Grumpdragon to the majestic Emperor Dragon and the cruel Giant Wyvern the heroes will have varying experiences - because dragons are more than just sword fodder on your usual routes.

95719.name: Stock Market Board Game
95719.description:
Play the Stock Market and you could earn your fortune!
With each throw of the dice you can buy and sell shares, collect dividends and attend stockholder meetings with stock splits. The winner is the first person to reach the “Winning Net Worth”. Several game rules are customizable allowing you to adjust the behaviour of the game and extend or shorten the length of a game.

The stock prices go up or down with each move depending on the square you land on. Remember to buy low, sell high and attend as many stockholder meetings as possible and you could earn your fortune playing the market.

Play against three difficulty levels of AI, other (local) humans or any combination of the two.

Custom board layouts can be added via iTunes.

Source: The Game Website.

95720.name: Drei Millionen Dukaten
95720.description:
from the back of the book

Stover Stoerrebrandt, the richest man of Aventuria is planning a massive wagon trail, to move his trading empire surrounded by enemies from the Festum to Gareth into the heart of the continent. On the arduous journey there are dlots of perils: brocken axles, hungry beasts, wild bands of Goblins and greedy robber barons. Old Stover can't even rely on his family: It is focusing too much on the heritage.
Stoerrebrandt will lead the trading company into a new era with the help of the heroes, but can they resist the glow of three million ducats?

95721.name: Emerald Empire (4th Edition)

rpg.4996: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)

95721.description:
publisher blurb

Emerald Empire: Fourth Edition is a comprehensive guide to Rokugan that will bring the world of Legend of the Five Rings alive like no other book. Emerald Empire mixes detailed written descriptions of various aspects of Rokugani life, from politics and war to commerce and the basic rhythms and rituals of daily existence. The book also has handy reference material for those who wish to know everything from who answers to whom in the bureaucracy of the Imperial Court to strange and exotic visitors from foreign lands.

- Dozens of tables and hooks designed to provide quick reference for GMs who want to incorporate details of how daily life is lived in Rokugan, as well as anyone who is simply interested in the intricate life of the samurai.
- Clear and systematic descriptions of Rokugan’s social and political hierarchy, so that you never have to worry about who
answers to whom in the Great Clans, the Minor Clans, and the Imperial Court.

- A comprehensive look at law and order in the Empire, as well as the role of religion in the lives of those at all strata of the Celestial Order.

-All new information, including new schools and returning favorites such as the Shinjo Bushi and the Ikoma Lion’s Shadow.

Emerald Empire is a must-have for Legend of the Five Rings Roleplaying Game players who wish to bring their campaigns alive with a wealth of details about the workings of Rokugani life, as well as plot hooks and adventure ideas.

Emerald Empire also updates the previous edition of this book with nearly a quarter new content which has never been available before.

95722.name: Keg Bearer
95722.description:
Keg Bearer is a silly tactical board game for 1-4 players. Ideal for families and/or kids.

FREE NOW! To CELEBRATE the new iPhone support for MUSKET SMOKE!!

• 2-4 player battle royals.
• 2 on 2 team play.
• Co-op vs AI play.
• 1 on 1 play.
• Various maps and terrain features.
• 3 different modes of play.
• Select unit custom deployments.
• Simple map editing and unit re-positioning.

The interesting thing about this game is that you can shoot or set defensive states when it's not your turn. So everyone always has something to do with this 'huddle' style game.

UI INTERACTIVE
Drag and drop, tap units to change state, double tap kegs to heal, pull back to aim and shoot (if loaded and in shoot mode).

STRATEGY
The strategy is not just about movement and positioning – it also involves line of sight crossbow shooting, shot blocking, axe melee & mass beserking. Injured units don’t just bleed and lose hit points – they do less damage and can’t move as far.  And the one unit you have to protect also happens to be a healer.

GOAL
The great Keg Bearer (considered to be the king) has a healing 'Keg of ALE' that he sprays upon adjacent units. If you kill this unit then you win as no dwarf wants to fight without his ALE!!

Source: App store https://itunes.apple.com/ca/app/keg-bearer/id425068574?uo=4&....

95723.name: Skaldensänge
95723.description:
user summary

This is an anthology accompanying the sourcebook "Unter dem Westwind".
It contains 5 scenarios:
Das Sturmkind
Der Fluch des Blutes
Blutiger Schnee
Die Versunkenen
Stille Wasser

and 3 scenario ideas:

Der Puppenspieler
Söhne und Töchter
Auge um Auge

95724.name: Bastards
95724.description:
Battle it out in the Wild West as you follow "Boot McKane", an infamous outlaw who swore to take down the "Bastards" gang.

SINGLE PLAYER
3 Massive Episodes guaranteed to satisfy your thirst for western shootouts.

MULTIPLAYER
Team up with your friends and play more challenging campaigns as you take on the "Bastards" on an epic Cooperative game. Or play a classic western shootout in a very balanced Deathmatch game.

This game is based on the Doom engine.

Source: The Developer Website.

95725.name: Flüstern der Wälder
95725.description:
from the back of the book

Schlachtfest: The winter is coming, and it is time to slaughter the cattle. But the party does not proceed as planned - and there have been increasing indications that an ancient evil will awake. A few daredevils to pursue the matter are needed.
Die Expedition des Doctor Rhayader: Lured by the letter of a colleague, the learned Doctor Rhayader ventures in the depths of the woods to investigate strange magical phenomena. Of course, he needs the help of heroes to not become lost ore eaten by wild animals.
Die Geister, die ich rief: A Goblin leader has stolen a valuable gem, and a high reward is waiting for the one to retrieve it. But soon it turns out that the goblins in this story represents the lesser problem.

95726.name: Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP

videogamehonor.30663: 2011 IndieCade Best Visual Design of the Year Winner

95726.description:
S:S&S EP is a 21st century interpretation of the archetypical old school videogame adventure, designed exclusively for Apple's touchtronic machinery.

It's a mix of laid-back exploration, careful investigation & mysterious musical problem-solving occasionally punctuated by hard-hitting combat encounters. S:S&S EP is an unusual genre-bending effort with an emphasis on sound, music & audiovisual style that has been positioned as 'a brave experiment in Input Output Cinema'.

S:S&S EP has been recently described as "... an unlikely mix of Zelda and art house cinema. The game is equal parts Robert E. Howard, Shigeru Miyamoto, Tim Schaefer, with some David Lynch thrown in for good measure — but there is more to S&S than these inspirations." (link)

S:S&S EP won the IGF Mobile 'Achievement in Art' award in March 2010 and has been eagerly anticipated in some quarters ever since.

S:S&S EP is an unusual collaborative project made in the experimental independent videogame hotspot of Toronto, Canada. It has been built around the songs & sounds of composer/rockstar Jim Guthrie, whose discography includes solo efforts Morning, Noon, Night, Now More Than Ever, as well as the Juno award-winning Alone At The Microphone by Royal City. S:S&S EP features the internationally recognized art & design style of Superbrothers, whose illustrations & short films have appeared in a variety of exhibitions & publications. S:S&S EP is entirely made possible by the award-winning independent videogame studio Capy, creators of the critically acclaimed Critter Crunch & Might & Magic: Clash of Heroes, with Capy creative director Kris Piotrowski overseeing the project's strange evolution.

Source: The Game Website.

95727.name: Mr. Ninja
95727.description:
Following smash hits of "Mr." series in US,New "Mr." appears! Nobody gets left behind to enjoy this hilarious NINJA and KATANA action game! The name is..."Mr.Ninja"!
Slash the aliens in the invaded KARAKURI castle!

FEATURES

Extremely simple to play.




Step1...Tap the screen to jump.
Step2...Slash the aliens.
Step3...And slash the aliens. all of them!

That's all!

Game Center enabled!





This couldn't be better!


-One-touch control.
-Cool design with characteristic color scheme.
-Hilarious NINJA and KATANA action game.
-3 Game Modes are available.

Source: The Game Website.

95728.name: Halcyon

videogamehonor.32222: 2011 IGF Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

95728.description:
A Unique Action Puzzle Game

Halcyon is named for the mythological bird of ancient Greece, said to charm the winds and seas into a calm during the Winter Solstice.

Gameplay is one part spacial action puzzler and one part interactive stringed instrument combined in an experience designed specifically for the iPad.

Colored currents travel inexorably toward each other. Strum the strings to match the currents, creating both phonic and visual harmony.

Take on the role of the Halcyon, conducting nature, untangling currents, and bringing calm to the wind, sea, land, and stars.

A Generative Musical Instrument

Halcyon features a complete generative soundtrack that becomes an instrument when you play the game. Since its designed to accompany you while you play, you'll create tranquil sonic landscapes as you travel along.

Tons of Gameplay

36 Levels through Four Environments
Two Endless Modes that dynamically adjust difficulty based on how you are doing
A Twelve Song Generative Soundtrack
OpenFeint + Game Center




Source: The Game Website.

95729.name: Burn the Rope
95729.description:
In Burn the Rope users have the freedom to set fire without any fire hazard or need for a fire extinguisher. The game involves a mix of strategic planning, thinking ahead, coordination and the ability to stay in deep focus. Users have to feed the fire and burn as much rope as they can in each level to progress. The challenge is that fire only burns upwards, leaving players to tilt and turn their iPhones to keep the flame alive.

The game features 116 devilishly tricky levels with polished graphics and mesmerizing fire effects. Bugs that crawl along the rope spice things up demonstrating different reactions to the flame from level to level. Ants change the color of the flame so that users could burn different colored ropes, and the spider shoots out a web bridge providing access to the parts of the level that were beyond players’ reach before.

Source: The Game Website.

95730.name: Bardensang und Gaukelspiel
95730.description:
user summary

This is an anthology revolving around travelling people such as bards or jugglers.
it contains 5 scenarios:
Betancurs Gruselschau
Das Lächeln des Raben
Schattenspiel
Sänger, Ruhm und Papprapiere

95731.name: Forget-Me-Not
95731.description:
Forget-Me-Not is largely inspired by a C64 game called Crossroads. It's also obviously a bit inspired by Pac-Man, as well as this neat little iOS game called DungeonMoto.

So.. it's a game for one or two players. There's a maze. The openings at the edges of the screen wrap around. The maze is full of tiny little creatures, including the players. You run around shooting stuff, collecting flowers and trying not to be killed. The walls of the maze can be blown up. That's about it. It's good fun with two players on the same iPad.

One of the things I loved about Crossroads was, if you fired down a screen-wide corridor, your bullets would end up just screen wrapping forever or until something got in the way.. it gets a bit chaotic. So that happens in this :D

The levels are procedurally generated in a pretty simple way, at different sizes, with a few different possible symmetries. There are only three types of enemy so far, making some more now. Then it's on to making sfx and adding some polish, and it's about done...

Source: The Developer Website.

95732.name: Wahl der Waffen
95732.description:
(user summary)
This is an anthology accompanying the skill and weapon sourcebook "Wege des Schwerts".
It contains 4 scenarios:
Süße Träume
Der Preis des Korns
Auf Messers Schneide
Der Pfad des Visar

95733.name: Robot Wants Kitty
95733.description:
A robot's life is cold, mechanical and unfeeling. So what is a poor robot to do?

Robot needs life, companionship, and something to warm Robot's lonely steel heart. And Robot is willing to use lasers to get it!

Robot wants Kitty!

In Robot Wants Kitty, your goal is simply... get the kitty!

You'll have to use powerups to help you jump over, fire at, rocket across, and smash your way through obstacles and aliens! Kitty might be nearby, but you'll need to outfit your robot with the latest apps in order to get there!

If you enjoy Nintendo games or "Metroidvania" type adventures, Robot Wants Kitty is for you!

Source: The Game Website.

95734.name: Marooned
95734.description:
Marooned is designed to be played by 2-4 players on various different boards each with different set ups.

The aim of the game is to get as many of your peices from your 'IN' block to your 'OUT' block. This is done by moving the movement blocks around the board and fashioning a 'stepping stone' path across the various hazards whilst also attempting to scupper your opponants chances.

Squares on the board include the 'Sudden Death' square, the 'Quicksand' Square and the 'Conveyor Belt' Square.

95735.name: Wetterleuchten
95735.description:
(from the back of the book)
Twelve cities want to be the starting point for the legendary Donnersturm races, including Donnerbach, Brig-Lo, Neetha and Winhall. Some of these cities are involved in events of that may be presumed that the Goddess Rondra wants to test her followers. In four adventures, the heroes witness the way to teh Donnersturm and immerse themselves in a world permeated by the spirit of Rondra. In the north of the Middle Empire an ancient evil has to be defeatedin, in Chababia the theft of a temple treasure must be investigated, in Almada cultists create strange phenomena, and in Albernia it is necessary to assist an aging Rondra devotee.

95736.name: Donner und Sturm
95736.description:
(from the back of the book, slightly abbreviated)
Almost two thousand years ago Leomar of Baburin won the Donnersturm chariot personally from the goddess of war Rondra. The Donnersturm was forged from Eternium in Alveran, and almost just as long, the tradition of the Donnersturm race exists, in which every 25 years the right to summon the chariot is transferred to the respective winners.
Now it is the time again: From all over the world chariot drivers have gathered in Baburin to participate in this race of Rondrian faith - and your heroes are among them!

95737.name: Von Orks und Menschen
95737.description:
(from the back of the book)
With 'Blut auf uralten Steinenblood', 'Der Pfad des Häuptlings' and 'Zahltag' the three winners of adventure competition "Goldener Becher 2008" are found in here. All revolve around the difficult relationship between the black furry invaders of the Svellt valley and the subjugated humans who live in constant care.

95738.name: No Quarter (Issue 32 - Sep 2010)
95738.description:
User Summary:

Learn more about HORDES forces in the second part of a preview. Discover power progression for your Protectorate army. See what happens when Cygnar troops encounter the Blindwater Congregation...and more!

Cover Art "Pureblood Warpwolf" by Carlos Cabrera

ISSN: 7558200685

95739.name: Unter Barbaren
95739.description:
(user summary)
This is an anthology revolving around barbarians from all over Aventuria, the steeming jungles to the icy wilderness.
It contains 4 adventures:
Hauer und Horn
Feuer und Eis
Marbos Rabe
Das Blut der Götter

95740.name: Ritterburgen und Spelunken
95740.description:
User summary

This is a sourcebook containing numerous infos about different kinds of buildings in Avneturia, be it castles, inns, temples and the like.

95741.name: No Quarter (Issue 33 - Nov 2010)
95741.description:
User Summary:

Learn what Privateer Press was up to at Gen Con 2010. The Gavyn Kyle files let you in on the secrets of Lord Carver. Witness the insanity that comes when the Blindwater Congregation fights the Thornfall Alliance in the Battle Report...and more!

Cover Art "Calaban the Gravewalker" by Carlos Cabrera

ISSN: 7558200686

95742.name: BattleTechnology (Issue 8 - Sep 3029)
95742.description:
Cover headline: Kurita Slays Steiner

Cover art: Nelson Snook and Michael Haggerty

Contents

McKlostey's Valley
Fighting Spirit
Blood on the Snow

DEPARTMENTS
BattleTechnology News Service
News from the Front
- Kurita Slays Steiner
- Guerillas on Glenmorra
In Memoriam
Mech(Warrior)Tac
- BatthePreparedness
BattleMechanics
- Technical Readout (x2)
- BattleTechnology BluePrint # 1
ComStar Census

BATTLETECH SIMULATOR
The Price of Cannon Fodder
Tales Your Mother Never Told You
Death of a Regiment
The Snows of Battle

More Than Warriors
Mary Had A Stinger LAM
Nature's Woe
__________________________
>

95743.name: Tactical Assault: Fantasy Cards
95743.description:
The Tactical Assault: Fantasy Cards™ is an elegant card-driven rule set for bringing exciting clashes of sword & sorcery - including command & control and the fog of war - to the tabletop battlefield in a very playable fashion. The rules are even able to incorporate the some of the more obscure aspects of pre-gunpowder warfare such as war machines, artillery, obstacles, sappers and so forth into the same fast-play, narrative based system.

Despite being deceptively simple in appearance, the Fantasy Cards provide a very challenging game full of hard choices and long range planning. The fact that every card can offer multiple options, that there is no way of knowing exactly when certain cards will appear in a player's hand, and that not every unit will be available at all times (e.g. due to combat effects, confusion, etc.) forces players to carefully weigh the benefits and risks of almost every tactical decision within the framework of their overall strategic plan.

In addition, with the incorporation of expansion decks, even more challenge and detail can be easily added to the base game. This allows players to customize the rules to the level of complexity they most enjoy.

And if folks prefer their battles more in the form of a traditional board game, the Fantasy Cards can be combined with the new Tactical Assault: Legendary Battles™ print-n-play packs. These sets give Fantasy Card players everything they need to play exciting battles in a hex and counter style format - including unique scenarios, beautiful full color maps and more than enough counters to allow players to develop their own scenarios. The only thing the players need to provide is their own Fantasy Card decks!

All of this is offered in an easy to download print-n-play format available at the Tactical Assault Games website - along with articles on tactics, tips & tricks, designer's notes and more!

95744.name: No Quarter (Issue 34 - Jan 2011)
95744.description:
User Summary:

Witness the glory of the first previews from WARMACHINE: Wrath! See the inner workings of the Dawnguard. Discover what new theme forces are coming soon. Learn the best ways to organize your HORDES: Minions...and more!

Cover Art "Lord Arcanist Ossyan" by Andrea Uderzo

ISSN: 7558200687

95745.description:
"PETRÓLEO S.A." is about companies that produce and sell oil in the international markets.

Every company will first have to prospect and find oil. They also will have to build prospection towers, pipelines and deposits to store it. Only then are they prepared to produce oil.

But all this only matters if you're able to rent an oil tanker to transport your oil to the international markets, where you can sell it. And when you do, do not forget to check the oil price in the market. Maybe it's not the best timing for you.

Game ends as soon as any player reaches 2.000 zilions. All players are allowed to play that round, in the end the player with the more money wins the game.
95745.name: Petróleo S.A.

95746.name: Spellbound Kingdoms Revised
95746.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the revised core rulebook for the Spellbound Kingdoms RPG. 300 pages of zeppelins, courtesans, feral children, alchemy, sorcery, engineering, politics, dragons, and slavering undead.

Bound by magic, haunted by fear, and clinging to love, the people of the Kingdoms live in a world on the brink of a new age. Whether that is an age of Enlightenment or a new dark age is up to you.

Spellbound Kingdoms is a traditional RPG with innovative rules for:

Tactical combat where your fighting style matters.
Storytelling support.
Mass combat as an integral part of the game.
Dramatic and tactical dialogue. Fashion as a weapon. Improv-style drama scenes!
Emotional depth.
Players can play nobles, peasants, soldiers, generals, or anyone in between.
A fast pace. Blazing pace, really.
A world and an economy that are consistent with the rules.
Combat that is easy to learn, difficult to master, fast, fun, and not a pain in the GM's butt.
Cooperative worldbuilding.
NPC relationships that matter.




Spellbound Kingdoms offers dark Renaissance fantasy gameplay with rules that support swashbuckling action, courtly intrigue, and insidious magic.

New for the revision are over 70 spells, dozens of monsters, a new Talent system, rules for multiple PCs in the same thieves guild or other organization, new combat styles including Mounted and Black Powder & Crimson Blade, many new monster combat styles, advice for creating your own combat styles and spell schools, new alchemical and engineering items, a printer-friendly version of the pdf, and a lot more.

Welcome to the Kingdoms.

Here, love and fear are the most powerful forces in the world. You only have to ask yourself one question: is that a good thing?

95748.name: Cell & Love: The Fun of Fusion
95748.description:
Let your brain evolve with Cell & Love. Have you ever asked yourself how cells merge between them? It's simple, by following some rules of color and size. In Cell & Love you have to help a little monster to raise his ultimate evolution stage solving 100 levels of puzzle, by merging cells with your fingers. More than eight hours of thinking entertainment. Cool and creative graphics. A new kind of puzzle that you need to play. If you like puzzles and cells and love this is your game!

Source: The Developer Website.

95749.name: Farts vs Zombies
95749.description:
Do you get sick of zombie games and fart apps flooding the App Store?

Colonel John Farter is an American officer who spent seven years in a North Vietnamese POW camp, then escaped. He just recently came back, and discover his town full of zombies and his only weapon is his ass. He mets up with his old friend Banana Max and together, they will launch a mission to free the town from The Evil Unicorn and his army of zombies.

In Farts VS Zombies you have to kill zombies with farts, you draw with the finger the path of the farts and direct them to their faces. The game goal is to protect the japanese schoolgirls from the attack of the zombies as much time as possible. In fact, zombies hate farts, it’s the only thing that can kill them, well - not the only one really. But the game is more than that, you can do Fart Combos, use funny Special Attacks and items and compete in online rankings with your friends to see who is the best farter!

Source: The Developer Website.

95750.name: The Wizard of Oz: The Game
95750.description:
The Wizard of Oz : The Game (Kids version) is an entry-level game with the objective of collecting three token cards while travelling down the path of the Yellow Brick Road and arriving first at the Emerald City. The game is played on a colorful board with beautifully reproduced scenes from the movie. This is a roll-the-die-and-move game with different spaces on the Yellow Brick Road where you collect your tokens and perhaps encounter the Wicked Witch (who causes you to lose your turn) or Winged Monkeys (who you must battle using competitive die rolls - win and you gain a Token card, lose and you miss your next turn). There are also spaces for drawing Toto cards which provide players with special abilities. Landing on an Emerald City space allows you to draw an Emerald City card and a corresponding Token card. Corner spaces are considered "enchanted". The Glinda corner space lets you move ahead 6 spaces. The Ruby Slipper space allows you to double your movement that turn. The final corner space is the Wizard of Oz and allows you take a Token card. For kids 6 years and older.

From the Rules:

Relive the most beloved motion picture of all time as you follow the Yellow Brick Road through the Land of Oz to reach the Emerald City. As Dorothy, Cowardly Lion, Tin Man or Scarecrow, you will defeat the Wicked Witch of the West, battle winged monkeys and collect your corresponding tokens. Help Dorothy keep her Ruby Slippers, Tin Man find a Heart, Scarecrow a Diploma and Cowardly Lion his Medal of Courage. Then, continue on to the Emerald City to meet the Wizard of Oz.

This is a different game from The Wizard of Oz: The Game. Notably, that game is a family game, whereas this is children's game.

95751.name: Só Aventuras (Issue 1)
95751.description:
Table of Contents

5 - Solo Adventure Demoniac Game
14 - Hunting Three new quests for HeroQuest
18 - Lizardmen for D&D
20 - Vampire Warrior adventure for D&D
26 - Filling your fingers lots of magic rings for D&D
28 - Street Fighter for GURPS
38 - Tree Golems Artificial monsters for AD&D
42 - Books Interview with a Vampire
42 - Fiction Tekoa

95752.name: Só Aventuras (Issue 3)
95752.description:
Table of Contents

5 - Solo Adventure Metal Courage
14 - Insects' Rebelion an adventure for D&D
26 - Psic Powers for AD&D
30 - Mortal Intrigue espionage of 007 for GURPS
34 - Storyteller Brazil Vampires, werewolves more brazilians for your chronicles
40 - Comics Happy Hour
44 - Fiction The Paladin and the Thief

95753.description:
Tic! Clic! Tic! Tic! The sound of your little paw's claws resonates through the sewer pipes in this mad race to find the cheese. Faced with an impasse, call the plumber to give you a good tip. And when your precious cheese is buried under a pile of garbage, flush the toilet to find them. But wait! Do you feel it? Cheese, very close! Where should I go? Left! No, backwards! Right! There it is! Quick, quick! Hiiiiiii! Hiiiiiiiii!

Each player must build a sewer system that will allow his rat to reach his home while earning as much cheese as possible. Do you have enough and bold strategy to get there? Yes, so on your marks, get set, GO!

Tic! Clic! Tic! Tic! Le bruit de vos petites pattes griffées résonne à travers les tuyaux d’égout dans cette course folle pour dénicher des fromages. Devant une impasse, faites appel au plombier pour vous donner un bon tuyau. Et quand vos précieux fromages seront ensevelis sous un amas de déchets, «flusher» donc la toilette pour les retrouver. Mais attendez! Le sentez-vous? Un fromage, tout près! Où faut-il aller? À gauche! Non, reculons! À droite! Il est là! Vite, vite! Hiiiiiii! Hiiiiiiiii!

Chaque joueur doit construire un réseau d’égout qui permettra à son rat de rejoindre sa demeure tout en accumulant le plus de fromages possibles. Avez-vous suffisamment de stratégie et d’audace pour y arriver? Oui, alors, à vos marques, prêts, PARTEZ!
95753.name: La Chasse aux fromages

95754.name: Só Aventuras (Issue 4)
95754.description:
Table of Contents

4 - Solo Adventure Ridiculous Liers
10 - Centurions for GURPS
18 - Extraplanars for D&D and AD&D
24 - Shadows of the Past
28 - You have something to lose? an adventure
32 - Goblins for Shadowrun
34 - Dragons for GURPS and Storyteller
42 - Comics Fair trake
42 - Fiction Masquerade

95755.name: Só Aventuras (Issue 7)
95755.description:
Table of Contents

5 - Solo Adventure Unexpected
10 - Creatures as Allies for GURPS
18 - Thri-Kreen for D&D and AD&D
22 - The Mountains of Lost
26 - World of Light GURPS and Storyteller
32 - Anarchy!
38 - Comics Brief about Art
42 - Fiction The Red Planet

95756.description: Pick'N'Choose is the game that adapts to your personality! To make your team guess a word, you pick and choose between nine different activities such as drawing, miming, humming, sculpting modeling clay or wires, making clownish facial expressions and sound effects, using word associations, or asking trivia questions. Harder activities will earn you more points, but will also take up more of your precious time. Try to get the most points out of 5 cards before your time runs out!
95756.name: Pick 'N' Choose

95757.description:
Monkey Queen is a two player game, played on a 12x12 checkboard. The board is initially set up with two queens - one stack of 20 for each player, set on the 'F' and 'G' files on opposite sides of the board.

A monkey queen captures exactly like a Chess queen. Slide in any direction along a straight line of unoccupied squares ending with the capture of an enemy piece.

When not capturing, a queen moves any distance in any direction, again like a Chess queen, except it leaves its bottom checker behind on the originating square, reducing its stack height by one. The queen monkey has thus given birth to a baby monkey.

A monkey baby, like a monkey queen, captures exactly like a Chess queen.

Babies also have a non-capture move

You win is you capture the enemy queen, or deprive your opponent of moves.

.
95757.name: Monkey Queen

95758.description:
It is the age of iron. Metal behemoths tame the wild frontier, leaving settled communities in their wake. You are a captain of industry, seeking to expand your burgeoning railroad empire. Your tools are the railroad cars produced by you and your fellow magnates. Draw cards and place them wisely to earn big points. Vie for control of public railroads and stock to earn extra bonuses.

In Iron Horses, players compete to build the most lucrative railroad trains using a special deck of cards. Each player starts with one train, consisting of a locomotive engine and a tender full of coal. Players will add cars to these trains. The cars themselves are produced by four manufacturing companies, each owned by a player. Some types of cars (a passenger coach, a cattle card) are more valuable than others (like simple boxcars). And adding cars to your train in the proper color order earns bonus points. Don't forget about the public lines, though, which earn points for the players who have contributed most to their construction. Finally, in multiplayer games you may purchase stock in other players’ train lines, thus capitalizing on their successes.

This game was developed for the Quick Print and Play Design Challenge:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/625604/quick-print-and-p...

The work-in-progress thread may be found here:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/6398031
95758.name: Iron Horses

95759.name: Flight of the Huguenots
95759.description:
From the introduction

In August 1572, Paris was a powder keg; tax rises and a poor harvest exacerbated the bitterness of sectarian hatred. Despite the antagonism, many Huguenot leaders came to Paris for the wedding of Margaret to Henry III, thereby inciting the St. Bartholomew’s Day Massacre.

It started with a wave of assassinations against the Huguenot leadership, followed by mob butchery that escalated beyond control. Tens of thousands of Huguenots were killed across France.

Flight of the Huguenots is a short, historical Frame for Hell for Leather, including all the characters and story details to get you started. This Frame is designed for four players.

95760.description:
Chimera Isle: Territorial Expansion adds new chimeras and habitats to the base game. In addition, support for 5-6 players is included. Chimera Isle just got bigger!

Includes:
* Tails Deck (2 cards)
* Bodies Deck (2 cards)
* Heads Deck (2 cards)
* Voting Deck (20 cards)
* Habitats Deck (6 cards)
* CI: TE Rules Addendum Document
* 24 Poker Chips (7/8” | 22mm) - Black
* 12 Poker Chips (7/8” | 22mm) - White
* 10 Token Chip (1-1/4”) - Black
95760.name: Chimera Isle: Territorial Expansion

95761.name: Gradius IV Fukkatsu
95761.description:
Gradius IV Fukkatsu (グラディウスIV～復活～, lit. "Gradius IV: Revival") is the fourth arcade installment in a series of scrolling shooter video games developed by Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo. It was preceded by Gradius III, released in 1989, although other non-numbered spinoffs had been released such as Gradius Gaiden. This title brings a considerable graphical upgrade, particularly with the use of colored lighting. In addition, there have been several additions and removals to the vaulted weapons system; specifically, the edit mode has been removed and an online ranking system was added.

The core gameplay of Gradius IV remains relatively unchanged. However, several changes were made on the weapons system in the transition from Gradius III. First of all, the edit mode has been completely eliminated, as are the "Snake Option" (s.option), the "Reduce" shield type, and the seventh powerup category. The seventh powerup category was the one that was labeled "!" and would produce detrimental results, such as reducing the speed or eliminating the weapons of the ship.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gradius IV Fukkatsu", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95762.name: Bouncer Boot Out
95762.description:
You are the Bouncer! You have the power!

The club queues need someone to manage them. Are you jerk enough to accept the challenge?

Source: The Developer Website.

95763.name: Hogtide
95763.description:
Drink moonshine! Rescue babes! Ride a PIG! Outrun the law for as long as possible and try to keep far ahead of the pursuing HogTide!

Source: The Developer Website.

95764.name: Ten Sided Solutions
95764.description:
From the box:
"Ten Sided Solutions. The dice game made of strategy and fun. A game of chance, skill and strategy, where thinking things through is more important than luck."

In this Yahtzee-like game, you roll ten d10 dice up to five times, trying to maximize your score by completing one of the 34 slots on your score sheet each turn. The player who has the highest points from filling the categories wins.

95765.name: Joe Name It
95765.description:
Can you name a movie with two sequels? How about a music group with three members? Those are the types of challenges you'll face in Joe Name It.

On a turn, you draw a category card, then roll the number die. If the category is labeled "Any Joe", the first player to shout an answer (or answers) to the category wins the card; if the category is "Just Joe", then the active player is the only one who can answer. If no answer or not enough answers fit the category, be the first to yell "No Joe" to claim the card. The first player to collect ten cards wins.

95766.description:
Since the Nightfall, the vampires, werewolves, and humans have mostly had to only contend with one another, the mindless undead being little more than an occasional nuisance. But much like an itch that won't go away, the ghouls continue to appear, and in greater numbers. The problem is only multiplied by some vampires who have shown an ability to raise up more ghouls as servants.

Zombie Horde not only brings new color chaining combinations to Nightfall; it introduces a minion with incredible potential to wreak havoc on your opponents. With Strength limited only by what you can keep in play, the Zombie Horde could be a deadly challenge for opponents.

The pack comes pre-wrapped with:
• 1 Zombie Horde draft card
• 7 Zombie Horde cards

The card divider for this card comes with the Nightfall box.
95766.name: Nightfall: Zombie Horde Promo

95767.name: Chessyball
95767.description:
While called Chessyball, the game really has little to do with chess, it is more a soccer game. The game plays on an 11 x 18 board, and each team has 10 players and one goaltender.

Pieces move as Queens in chess, i.e., moving as far as they want in a straight line, or until reaching the outer edge, or another piece.
