-Introduction
-Gen Con Indy Preview
-Black and White Clip Art
-The Harkwood Sessions
-My Style: Don't Be an Asshat

95860.name: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night (Vol. 1, Issue 24 - June 2007)

rpgissue.3590: One Thousand and One Nights and One Night

95860.description:
A role-playing game campaign design 'zine.

Time Travel edition - Listed as June 1 2007, probably March 2008!

CONTENTS:
-Introduction: Time Travel
-Pulp - a Time Traveler!
-Time Travel Games and Ideas
-Time Travel Game Setting Design

95861.name: Thomas and Friends Birthday Surprise Game
95861.description:
Join Thomas the Train in your own adventures with this Birthday Surprise Game. This colofrul game helps little engineers build memory and matching skills and no reading is required. Perfect for game night or parties with friends!

Preschoolers travel around Sodor by train trying to match party favors found along the route. Race to see who can make the most matches!

95862.name: Hunters: Episode One
95862.description:
Space Hulk type of game, turn based strategy where a team of hunters takes on varied missions. Hunters gain experience, skills, equipment over missions.

Note: As at January 1, 2017 the iPad and iPhone versions are not listed on iTunes, and installed copies do not work anymore.

95863.name: 20 20 Dice Cricket
95863.description:
From the back of the box:

PLAYING INSTRUCTIONS:

Agree before starting to play either 12 or 20 overs. Toss a coin to see who goes first. Bowling team must use 4 overs of 'Fast Bowling', then 4 overs of ‘Medium Pacers’ and then 4 overs of ‘Spinners’. For a 20 over game, overs 13-18 follow the same order in lots of 2 overs. The final 2 overs are the bowlers choice. Use your favourite players to compete against other favourites!

Even include yourself in the team!

HOW TO PLAY:

Bowler throws 2 dice and the batsman follows the directions on the card. The batting team then throws 2 dice and looks at the appropriate card for the result.

Example: 5th over (medium pace) bowler throws the dice and gets a 4 (inswinger). Batsman looks up Inswinger card and throws the dice. A6 is shown on the dice = 4 runs.

The only time the batter doesn’t throw the dice is on the number 8 Spinners card, which is an automatic 1 run wide.

For this game it is recommended that no extra balls be bowled for extras such as No Balls and Wides.

Commentate the game it is played and add your own comments if you wish

95864.name: Sulahai
95864.description:
4 different Games:

1st Sulahai:
4 participants - 30 - 60 min everyone gets 4 small seashells and 12 tiny bamboo sticks; goal: collect as many sticks as possible within a given time.
A Each player selects 4 different winning numbers (out from 16), two players with odd and two with even numbers
B Who comes first proposes a number (='open' seashells) and uses all 16 seashells as dice; if predicted number is achieved you collect bamboo sticks from all the opponents, with a flop you have to pay sticks to everyone; the one whose number was proposed collects or pays the double amount;
C If prediction fails the one whose number was proposed is next in line

2nd Dittar-Pradesh:
Goal: get as many sticks as possible
unlimited participants - all the bamboo sticks, 16 seashells
A each player adds an mutually agreed number of sticks into the jackpot;
B try to estimate the accurate number of roll witht 16 seashells;
C if you win you get the pot, if several persons win pot is splitted; if everybody looses jackpot will increase.

3rd Bamboo and Cowrie:
2,4 or 6 participants (form two parties), 48 sticks, 6 seashells
Goal: Get all of the sticks
Use six seashells as a die: depending on the result you or your party may get or pay sticks

4th Pancha Kelya
see BBG 'Pancha Keliya'

95865.name: Advanced Class: Hooded Terror
95865.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class: Hooded Terror details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

The Hooded Terror is representative of the masked and often disfigured psychopathic maniacs who haunted the pulp era with a vengeance. They are the dark unknown that lurks just beyond the light, the inhuman fiend that might lurk deep inside any man. The methods and accoutrements of the Hooded Terror were both theatrical and ghastly, the better to horrify and frighten their victims.

95866.name: Advanced Class: Cowboy Hero
95866.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class: Cowboy Hero details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

Although the Western gunfighter was gone by the turn of the 20th Century, in his place during the pulp era stood the Cowboy Hero, mixing the archetype with the modern trappings of the period.

95867.name: Advanced Class: Mobster
95867.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class: Mobster details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

It is almost impossible to think about the Pulp Era without thinking about the Mobster. Whether they are used as little more than muscle or gangland intrigue, the Mobster is a critical element in many Pulps. They are the quintessential ?bad guys.

95868.name: Advanced Class: Gun Moll
95868.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class: Gun Moll details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

Historically, Gun Molls were a varied lot. Some were simply paramours of Mobsters, while others took more active roles in the criminal life. In the Pulps, Gun Molls had more thrilling and glamorous lifestyles. It is this literary model on which the Advanced Class is based. While the Mobster represents the tough, thuggish soldier of the underworld, the Gun Moll works behind the scenes, acting as a spy and providing logistical support.

95869.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 11: Planned Pursuit / Chapter 12: Death of the Moon Man

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95869.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Eleven: Planned Pursuit

and

Chapter Twelve: Death of the Moon Man

The final two chapters of our first serial!

Included in this product:

Two video files - Chapter Eleven: Planned Pursuit and Chapter Twelve: Death of the Moon Man, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing Retik's Rocket, Motorcycle Cops, and "Calling All Cars" - a new rule governing police response in pulp-genre games.

95870.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 2: Molten Terror

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95870.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Two: Molten Terror

Commando Cody faces the machinations of the evil Retik, leader of the Radar Men!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Two: Molten Terror, in mp4 format.
A 6 page PDF detailing equipment and NPCs seen in this chapter, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.
A special bonus: A copy of Advanced Class: Mastermind, a class appropriate to this serial!

95871.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 3: Bridge of Death

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95871.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Three: Bridge of Death

Commando Cody escapes from the Moon, only to be ambushed by Graber and Daly, the criminal henchmen of the Radar Men!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Three: Bridge of Death, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing NPCs seen in this chapter, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95872.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 10: Mass Execution

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95872.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Ten: Mass Execution

Cody and his crew escape from the Moon with their stolen Lunarium!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Nine: Battle In The Stratosphere, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing Hank, the pilot of Cody's Rocket Ship, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95873.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 6: Hills of Death

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95873.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Six: Hills of Death

The Radar Men continue their attack on Earth's defenses!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Six: Hills of Death, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing the deadly Lunarium Atomic Bomb, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95874.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 7: Camouflaged Destruction

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95874.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Seven: Camouflaged Destruction

The Radar Men continue their attack on Earth's defenses!

Included in this product:
he Ray Gun attacks continue! Can Cody stop them?

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Seven: Camouflaged Destruction, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing Cody's airplane, the 1939 Stinson 105, as well as the hand-held bombs he wields against the Radar Men's thugs, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95875.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 1: Moon Rocket

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95875.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter One: Moon Rocket

Rocket Ranger Commando Cody begins his struggle against invasion from the Moon!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter One: Moon Rocket, in mp4 format.
A 6 page PDF detailing equipment and weapons seen in this chapter, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.
A special bonus: A copy of Advanced Class: Rocket Ranger, a class appropriate to this serial!

95876.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 9: Battle in the Stratosphere

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95876.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Nine: Battle in the Stratosphere

Rocket Ranger Commando Cody begins his struggle against invasion from the Moon!

Included in this product:
Cody and his crew escape from the Moon with their stolen Lunarium!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Nine: Battle In The Stratosphere, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing Hank, the pilot of Cody's Rocket Ship, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95877.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 4: Flight to Destruction

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95877.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Four: Flight To Destruction

Krog, the Radar Men's agent on Earth, orders his henchmen on a crime spree, which includes orders to kidnap Commando Cody for ransom!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Four: Flight To Destruction, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing NPCs seen in this chapter, usable in any d20 pulp campaign.
A special bonus: A copy of Advanced Class: Mad Scientist, which was used to create the character of Krog.

95878.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 5: Murder Car

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95878.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Five: Murder Car

The crime spree to fund the Radar Men's plans for sabotage continues!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Five: Murder Car, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing an NPC seen in this chapter, and a new d20 Modern rule governing Heroic Escapes - usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95879.name: Radar Men from the Moon: Chapter 8: The Enemy Planet

rpgseries.9511: Thrilling Tales Theatre: Radar Men From The Moon

95879.description:
Publisher's blurb

This Week:

Radar Men From The Moon

Chapter Eight: The Enemy Planet

Cody and his crew return to the Moon on a daring mission!

Included in this product:

A video file of Chapter Eight: The Enemy Planet, in mp4 format.
A PDF detailing the dangers of the Lunar atmosphere (trust us on this, apparently there is one), usable in any d20 pulp campaign.

95880.name: Advanced Class: Gumshoe
95880.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Gumshoe details a D20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

The Gumshoe... the P.I... the Detective: the pulp archetypes of the tough-as-nails, rough-around-the-edges, hard-boiled investigator. A file cabinet filled with cases, a beat-up desk, a name on the door and a reputation for getting his man. Many times, this is all a Gumshoe has to call his own, but while his life is often unglamorous, it is hardly ever boring.

95881.name: Advanced Class: Ace Reporter
95881.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Ace Reporter details a D20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

An Ace Reporter is smart, charismatic, and-- most of all-- lucky. It's a tough world out there, and someone has to get the facts! The public has a right to know, and if it takes a little breaking-and entering, stowing away, or sabotage, then that's what you'll do. Ready to solve the world's mysteries, armed only with a pen, a pistol, and the power of the press? Ace Reporter, get that story!

95882.name: Advanced Class: Rocket Ranger
95882.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Rocket Ranger details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

Up and Away! With his trusty rocket pack strapped to his back, the Rocket Ranger is an ace who needs no plane! This is the archetype embodied by classic heroes like King of the Rocket Men and Buck Rogers, and recent pulp-genre heroes like Dave Stevens' The Rocketeer.

95883.name: Advanced Class: Boxer
95883.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Boxer details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

From matches in the squared circle to bare-hand brawls in the back-alleys of Sumatra, the Boxer is a two-fisted master of the puglistic arts! Boxing pulps were very popular in the 1930s (Robert E. Howard wrote many, and was a boxer himself), and this Advanced Class represents the archetype of such heroes as Dennis Dorgan or Mike Brennan. Additionally, the class may be used to represent status as an amateur boxer, when added to an NPC like a cab driver or bartender.

95884.name: Advanced Class: Fortune Hunter
95884.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Fortune Hunter details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

Equally at home in the library or an ancient tomb, the Fortune Hunter is part researcher, part archaeologist, and part explorer, dedicated to seeking out lost treasures, hidden secrets and more!

95885.name: Advanced Class: Femme Fatale
95885.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Femme Fatale details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

Strong-willed, independent and deadly, the Femme Fatale is an archetype of the pulps: women who pursue nefarious goals while stealing the hearts of stalwart heroes.

95886.name: Advanced Class: Big Game Hunter
95886.description:
Publisher's blurb

Advanced Class - Big Game Hunter details a d20 Modern Advanced Class for your pulp-genre campaigns.

The Big Game Hunter travels the untamed forests and jungles of the world, searching for exotic trophies. He can be a guide for your heroes...but can also be the villain, disregarding local laws and traditions in order to poach his prey and pillage the land.

95887.name: Thugee
95887.description:
Publisher's blurb

They strangle unsuspecting travelers on dark country roads. They glide though New York's glittering streets clinging to shadows, carrying fear and death in their yellow scarves. They are brutal thugs masking their villainy behind a fa?ade of ancient mysticism.

They are the Thugee, a cult of murders whose history and myth stretch back thousands of years. By the end of the 19th century the terrible cult had vanished from India. In the fictional world of the pulps, though, the cult persisted into the modern world.

Pulp Villains: Thugee details the cult for use in Modern D20 games. This 51-page PDF, written by Shannon Kalvar, features details on the historical Thugee, as well as three pulp-era versions of the cult, depending on the focus of your particular campaign. New feats and F/X powers for the Thugee are also included, as well as sample NPCs, ready for use.

Pulp Villains: Thugee has more than just the Indian stranglers, however. The PDF serves as a tool for Gamemasters who wish to include any sort of cult in their Modern D20 campaigns. The full Open Content rules for creating Organizations in Modern D20 are included in this PDF, expanded with a new rules system of Descriptors which allow Game Masters to customize cults using the adjectives used to describe them!

Do you dare oppose the Thugee? Or will you too fall to a cunning smile and a swiftly applied yellow strangling cord?

95889.name: Perils of the Orient
95889.description:
Publisher's blurb

From the exotic, mysterious East they come to menace western civilization, to challenge all that decent, God-fearing men hold virtuous. With hatchet and knife, pistol and poison, they strike from the shadows. These are the Perils of the Orient, the sinister villains who swarmed across the pages of pulp magazines from the very beginning in the late 1800s to the very end in the 1950s.

Written by novelist C.L. Werner (Witch Hunter, et. al.), Pulp Villains: PERILS OF THE ORIENT is your complete guide for including these villains in your d20-based pulp campaigns. In these pages are presented some of the most common themes that were evoked in the pulps -- from Mongol warriors dreaming of a new empire to sinister Tibetan monks with terrible powers of mysticism and mesmerism; from the Tongs of Chinatown to the nefarious machinations of the sinister Oriental Mastermind.

This supplement contains details of the most common archetypes of the genre, with fully-statted generic NPC examples of each, ready to use. An armory of exotic oriental weapons is included, for use against (or indeed, by) your pulp heroes. Horrific creatures appear as well....including the dreaded Mongolian Death Worm!

At their worst, pulp tales of oriental peril preyed upon and exploited the fears and ignorance of its audience, playing upon racial stereotypes of the time as a way of enhancing the tale's own impact. Other tales, however treated their subjects with a great deal more care and dignity, although today these stories are almost universally lumped together with their cruder imitators.

Pulp Villains: PERILS OF THE ORIENT attempts to present the genre in all of its excess, but at the same time with the knowledge that the characters presented here are not representative of their entire culture, any more than a murderous Thugee is indicative of India's vast population or a jack-booted Nazi represents the entire German ethnic group. A game centered around the themes of heroics and adventure will, by definition, focus upon the unusual and the extraordinary - and you will find Pulp Villains: PERILS OF THE ORIENT to be both.

95890.name: DestiNation USA
95890.description:
In DestiNation USA, players will be traveling across the U.S., trying to hit as many states and as many special destinations as possible.

To set up the game, place a state token in each of the continental U.S. states, each player places his car token in a randomly drawn state (claiming the token located there), a special destination is revealed (replacing it if a player is already in that state), and each player receives six driving cards from a deck of 62 (48 of those being states and 14 being special action cards).

On a turn, a player either moves to an adjacent state – by playing that state's card or any two cards the same color as that state – or plays a special action card. The player can play as many cards as he can, then refills his hand at the end of his turn. If a player enters a state that no one else has visited, he claims the state token; if he enters the state shown on the special destination card, he claims that card and a new card is revealed.

The game ends when either all 48 state tokens or five destination cards have been claimed. Each state token is worth one point, while destination cards are worth three points. The player with the most points wins.

95891.name: Advanced Class: Scientific Detective
95891.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Scientific Detective is the embodiment of rational thought in the Imperial Age. Unlike previous investigators that relied on testimony, superstition, the seriousness of the charge, and quick, convenient conclusions, the Scientific Detective relies on cold, hard facts and observation. What matters most to the Scientific Detective is the truth, no matter how improbable or inconvenient it may seem.

Famous literary Scientific Detectives of the Imperial Age include Sergeant Cribb, Lord Darcy, William Monk, Thomas and Charlotte Pitt, and, of course, Sherlock Holmes.

95892.name: Die Goblinhöhlen
95892.description:
User summary

Die Goblinhöhlen (The Goblin Caves) is a one-page dungeon for 2nd-level Labyrinth Lord characters. It was available from Moritz Mehlem's blog as a 2010 Advent Calendar item.

The dungeon is inhabited by goblins and some vermin and contains 13 different areas.

95893.name: The Impossible Machine
95893.description:
Game description from the publisher:

It all starts with a simple push...

The Impossible Machine is the game where players build ridiculously complicated contraptions to do simple things. Why turn on the TV, when you can have the bowling ball hit a pin, to pull a string, to let the marble loose!? Players earn points by getting their parts, with the right type of momentum, into the machine as they work together to build ever bigger and better machines.

95894.name: Advanced Class: Monster Hunter
95894.description:
Publisher's blurb

Monster Hunters are dedicated to ridding the world of unnatural menaces. While universal in mission, they are diverse in their approaches. Some Monster Hunters are educated scholars who execute careful plans. Others walk in where angels fear to tread once they learn of a monster's presence. Some Monster Hunters specialize in ridding the world of one type of monster, while others have a more general mission. Some Monster Hunters will work for an organization, while others prefer to work alone. The quintessential Monster Hunter is Abraham Van Helsing, Dracula's nemesis.

95896.name: Advanced Class: Alienist
95896.description:
Publisher's blurb

The Alienist is an advanced class that introduces psychical abilities into an Victorian-era campaign. While the Alienist publicly claims to be a simple psychiatrist, in truth he has formidable mental powers. Unlike the hermetic disciple and the medium, the Alienist's powers do not come from ancient rituals or consultations with spirits. Instead, the Alienist has learned to unlock the powers within his own mind.

This supplement also deals with the psychical abilities of the Disturbed, untrained individuals that have managed to manifest psychic abilities. Part of the mission of the Alienist is to track these disturbed individuals down and help integrate them into society... or, failing that, removing the threat they pose.

95897.name: Só Aventuras (Issue 8)
95897.description:
This magazine is two in one. One from the Front side and another from the Back side. This happens because the Solo adventure you can choose between two characters.

Table of Contents - for Paladin

3 - Solo Adventure Hunt the Necromancer
10 - Gladiators for D&D and AD&D
14 - Beasts for Tagmar
16 - Holy City for Storyteller
22 - Fiction How SOMETIMES things happens




Table of Contents - for Katabrok

3 - Solo Adventure Hunt the Necromancer
10 - Ninja Turtles for GURPS, D&D and AD&D
16 - School of Magic Weapons for GURPS
18 - Snakemen for Storyteller
22 - Comics N.W.O.

95898.name: Só Aventuras (Issue 9)
95898.description:
First number of New Só Aventuras! Now the magazine presents a complete setting to play: characters, rules, scenario and one adventure.
In the future (this magazine is from the 90's) this new system will become Sistema Daemon.

Table of Contents

4 - What is RPG?
5 - The Characters
6 - The Dungeon Master
8 - The Rules
14 - The Adventure Alert

95899.name: Euro 2008 Giga Quiz Fussball
95899.description:
A small trivia game with 36 trivia cards á 7 questions. Question 1 is supposed to be 'easy' while 7 is 'very hard'. The questions all center around soccer, some are specific about the Euro 2008 in Austria/Switzerland.

The player on turn selects a difficulty level (1 to 7) and a card is drawn. If he answers the chosen question correctly, that's his score and the next player takes his turn. After the draw pile is exhausted, the scores are added and the winner is the player with the highest score.

95900.name: Diner Dash 2: Restaurant Rescue

videogamehonor.29873: 2008 D.I.C.E. Best Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

95900.description:
Join Flo as she returns from Nirvana to help four fellow restaurant owners defeat the greedy tycoon, Mr. Big. Seat customers, take orders, serve drinks, deliver food, and collect tips - expert scores earn you more decor upgrades! Play Diner Dash 2: Restaurant Rescue, the sequel to the hit time management game!

Source: The Developer Website.

95901.name: Bank or Bust
95901.description:
Card game where players bank, steal and guard cash. In order to achieve the biggest stash of cash.
Players take it in turns to play turning over the bank or bust cards, revealing their value as they go. Players can turn over as many cards as they like , but if they reveal an alarm card they lose everything that they have uncovered during their turn.
The players can also choose to bank at any time during their turn this end's of their go.
Once a player has built a stash, they must cover it with the offshore account card, which protects the stash from attacks by other players.
Players can use a player raid card. This allows the player to steal a stash of their choice from the challenging player. The targeted player can defend against this.
When all of the bankcards have been played the game ends. The champion is the player who has accumulated the biggest overall stash

95902.name: Photo Flight
95902.description: Player are press photographers who charter aircraft to fly across the British isles taking exclusive pictures.

95903.name: The Last Priest of Sebek
95903.description:
Front cover:
A Swords & Wizardry Core Rules Adventure for Character Level 7-10

Back cover:
The first module in the Sorcery on the Sands series (Last Priest of Sebek, The Nameless City).

The great river of Kemet ran dry decades ago, leaving the land a barren desert, helpless prey to Hittite invaders. Rumors in the oasis camps tell of a strange marshland in the middle of the desert, a fearful place somehow linked to the death of the river. A brave party of adventurers prepares to mount an expedition to this legendary place, seeking treasure and perhaps to discover the truth of the rumors.

95905.name: The Ward of Wereskalot
95905.description:
Website blurb:
Designed for BX rules for characters levels 3-7. The ruins of Wereskalot stand harboring a mystery in need of solving.

from the Introduction:
This adventure is the conclusion to that introduced in the Expert Adventure Supplement XS1: Luln. As such it is intended for higher level characters in the range of 3rd to 7th, inclusive. It is important that the party include at least one cleric (possibly more) and a halfling. It is designed for use with the 1981 Basic & Expert Rules edition; with minor modifications it can be run with the Holmes Blue book rules, and even Original or Advanced D&D.

95906.name: Luln
95906.description:
Website blurb:
This adventure-supplement is designed for BX characters of levels 2nd to 5th. It includes maps of the town of Luln and surrounding wilderness, and a key matrix for notable NPCs the party might encounter. There is a minimal wilderness adventure that concludes the supplement.

95907.name: Magic: the Gathering
95907.description:
User Summary

Magic: the Gathering is the Dreamcast version of the hit card game of the same name. The Dreamcast version includes cards from the Sixth Edition of the card game and ten cards exclusive to this game. The player will create a deck and battle through a story mode fighting bosses for 5 gems in an effort to reach the Balance Tower.

95908.description:
Based on GMT's "The Battle for Normandy", the system moves to the 1943 invasion of Sicily by Allied forces.

The game uses the base system from GMT's "The Battle for Normandy" with, of course, modification. The Axis player will have more possibilities with air power, and the Allied player has the opportunity to use surgical "end-run" invasions behind enemy lines.

With the standard campaign game will be a 3-player "Monty vs. Patton vs. Axis" scenario, where the US & UK players will be competing for total victory, while still trying to maintain victory conditions over the Axis player.

MADE THE CUT just waiting for final production work on it then a slot in GMT print line.

The game will include:

4 Maps
6 countersheets
Rulebook
Scenario book
2 Laminated Air Allocation charts
2 8-1/2" x 11" charts & tables
2 Game Tracks; 1 German, 1 Allied
1 8-1/2 x 11" Time Record Track
2 d6
2 d10
Soap-box sized game box.
95908.name: The Battle for Sicily

95909.name: Basic Roleplaying: The Chaosium System – Players Book
95909.description:
From Wikipedia's Article on Basic Role-Playing

In 2004, Chaosium published the Basic Roleplaying monographs (the hyphen was dropped in the later products). Books with a quick and inexpensive printed format of tape binding and printed cardstock covers, the four monographs (Players Book, Magic Book, Creatures Book, and Gamemaster Book) were printed in order to assert Chaosium's copyrights in the run-up to the publishing and distribution of Deluxe Basic Roleplaying, a game system that is essentially RuneQuest 3rd Edition but with additions to allow play in other genres.

Chaosium released a new version of BRP on June 24th, 2008 as single comprehensive book. Currently they are selling both a printed and pdf version of the game.

Source: Wikipedia Basic Role-Playing
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

Basic Roleplaying Quick-Start Edition replaced this monograph.

These monographs were to ensure Chaosium maintained the Basic Roleplaying trademark while the company worked on the subsequent 400 page softcover. They were essentially the books of third edition RuneQuest with the serial numbers filed off. In other words, all mention of RuneQuest as well as all of the artwork have been removed.

The artwork for the front cover is from Chaosium's abandoned Straits of Chaos project for Elric! and Stormbringer (5th Edition).

95911.name: Basic Roleplaying: The Chaosium System – Magic Book
95911.description:
From Wikipedia's Article on Basic Role Playing

In 2004, Chaosium published the Basic Roleplaying monographs (the hyphen was dropped in the later products). Books with a quick and inexpensive printed format of tape binding and printed cardstock covers, the four monographs (Players Book, Magic Book, Creatures Book, and Gamemaster Book) were printed in order to assert Chaosium's copyrights in the run-up to the publishing and distribution of Deluxe Basic Roleplaying, a game system that is essentially RuneQuest 3rd Edition but with additions to allow play in other genres.

Chaosium released a new version of BRP on June 24th, 2008 as single comprehensive book. Currently they are selling both a printed and pdf version of the game.

Source: Wikipedia Basic Role-Playing
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

Basic Magic replaced this monograph.

These monographs were to ensure Chaosium maintained the Basic Roleplaying trademark while the company worked on the subsequent 400 page softcover. They were essentially the books of third edition RuneQuest with the serial numbers filed off. In other words, all mention of Runequest as well as all of the artwork have been removed.

The artwork for the front cover is from Chaosium's abandoned Straits of Chaos project for Elric! and Stormbringer (5th Edition).

95912.name: Basic Roleplaying: The Chaosium System – Creatures Book
95912.description:
From Wikipedia's Article on Basic Role Playing

Books with a quick and inexpensive printed format of tape binding and printed cardstock covers, the four monographs (Players Book, Magic Book, Creatures Book, and Gamemaster Book) were printed in order to assert Chaosium's copyrights in the run-up to the publishing and distribution of Deluxe Basic Roleplaying, a game system that is essentially RuneQuest 3rd Edition but with additions to allow play in other genres.

Chaosium released a new version of BRP on June 24th, 2008 as single comprehensive book. Currently they are selling both a printed and pdf version of the game.

The artwork for the front cover is from Chaosium's abandoned Straits of Chaos project for Elric! and Stormbringer (5th Edition).

95913.description:
From Wikipedia's Article on Basic Role Playing

In 2004, Chaosium published the Basic Roleplaying monographs (the hyphen was dropped in the later products). Books with a quick and inexpensive printed format of tape binding and printed cardstock covers, the four monographs (Players Book, Magic Book, Creatures Book, and Gamemaster Book) were printed in order to assert Chaosium's copyrights in the run-up to the publishing and distribution of Deluxe Basic Roleplaying, a game system that is essentially RuneQuest 3rd Edition but with additions to allow play in other genres.

User Summary

They were essentially the books of third edition RuneQuest with the serial numbers filed off. In other words, all mention of Runequest as well as all of the artwork have been removed.

The artwork for the front cover is from Chaosium's abandoned Straits of Chaos project for Elric! and Stormbringer (5th Edition).

95914.name: The Dead: Single Payer

rpghonor.13923: 2007 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up

95914.description:
Website blurb:
The Dead Role-playing game is a pen and paper game where players take on the roles of survivors in a fictitious pandemic that causes the dead to rise.

User comment;
This is the electronic (PDF) publication without illustrations.
This version is free to download from the publisher's website.

95915.name: Raindropchess
95915.description:
Raindropchess is a chess variant, which starts with an empty board. Card draws determine which pieces may be placed, the players decide where to play their pieces. Once your king is on the board, you can also move your pieces. Movement of pieces, capturing and game end are the same as in regular chess.

Official website: http://raindropchess.com (English)

videogame.73375: Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings

95916.name: Age of Empires II (Gold Edition)

videogamecompilation.73375: Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings

95916.description:
User Summary

This package includes both Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings and its expansion: Age of Empires II: The Conquerors Expansion as well as a set of new maps.

95917.name: The Nameless City (Core/Complete Rules)
95917.description:
Website blurb:
In the world there are ancient, degenerated remnants still living, survivals from unimaginable antiquity. What happens when the adventurers stumble across one of these deadly places? There must be treasure untold for those willing to brave the long-forgotten perils of ... The Nameless City. This module by Alphonso Warden is loosely based upon the eponymous short story by HP Lovecraft, and is designed for characters level 7-10.

The module is available for both Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox and Swords & Wizardry Complete Rules and Freestyle (Core) Rules. If you're going to use it with another old-school system, it's obviously going to be compatible, but use the Complete/Freestyle version for this: the hit dice and other information will be closer to other systems than WhiteBox.

95918.name: Legends of Elendria: The Frozen Maiden
95918.description:
A new tower defence game with roleplay elements from Kyy Games!

You are Commander Jalene, a shieldmaiden and the fearless and skilled leader of King Argos' army. The kingdom of Elendria is in peril because of mysterious attacks. Can you find out the cause of the distress and bring peace to the land once more?

Features include:
-4 different towers with unique upgrades
-14 different enemy types
-Customizable skill tree to boost towers and unlock new spells
-Vast world map with locations ranging from King Argos' castle to the icy caves of the Dark Elves
-Thrilling story to complete the role-playing experience

Source: The Publisher Website.

95919.name: You Don't Know Jack (2011)

videogamehonor.31316: 2012 Spike Best Social Game of the Year Winner

95919.description:
From the back of the case to the US Xbox 360 edition

"Where pop culture & high-culture collide!

There's a party in your brain and your pants are invited.

Twisted Trivia
Classic question types + all-new curveballs

Screw Your Neighbor
It's pleasurable AND profitable!

Humiliated Your Friends
Head-to-Head online play"

95920.name: A Collection of Activision Classic Games for the Atari 2600
95920.description:
From the back of the jewel case:

Relive video game history.

At less than a buck a game, this baby's fully loaded with 30 of your all-time favorites! In the first and largest arcade collection of its kind, Activision classics gives you all the gameplay of the original Atari 2600 games - now for your playstation game console. Activision Classics: It's serious old-school fun.

95921.name: Mountain Bike Adrenaline
95921.description:
From the Back of the CD Case:

Live the Ultimate Freeride Experience!

Straddle your mountain bike and ride the adrenaline as you hurdle down the world's most spectacular slopes. Speed, dexterity and daring are the three ingredients that will turn you int an exceptional rider. Are you ready to ride out of your skin?

95922.name: EA Sports MVP 06 NCAA Baseball
95922.description:
From the back of the box:

A whole new ballgame!

EA Sports Load and fire Batting System - Load your swing and Fire Away!
The Road to Omaha
ESPN Runs Live
Build a College Dynasty
CReation Zone for new players
Precision throw control
Create a Ballpark

95923.name: Sea Monsters: A Prehistoric Adventure
95923.description:
From the Back of the Box:

In the oceans of earth millions of years ago, danger was never far away and monsters lurked in every shadow. Experience this astounding world by playing as six different prehistoric marine reptiles, each with special skills - from extreme speed to thick armor and powerful crunching jaws. Start your adventure in area of inland sea that will only get more dangerous as time passes. Take on foes, hunt for prey and unlock hidden challenges. Your goal is to find a way to truly escape these waters. How to accomplish your escape is something you'll have to figure out on your journey. Now take control of your first sea monster and begin your journey!

95924.name: Winter Sports 2008: The Ultimate Challenge
95924.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Go for the gold in Winter Sports 2008 - The Ultimate Challenge!

Break world records in diverse single player modes and challenge your friends and family to taxing multiplayer matches. Captivating sports such as figure skating or skeleton demand high skills and fast reactions.

Experience the fascination of winter sports with stunning graphics and an exciting soundtrack.

95925.name: Bust-a-Move
95925.description:
User Summary

Bust-a-Move (known as Puzzle Bobble in Japan) is a puzzle-style arcade game that features the dinosaurs Bub and Bob from Bubble Bobble. Each stage is comprised of a number of different coloured bubbles hanging from the ceiling. Players control a pointer that is mounted at the bottom of the screen and can aim and shoot bubbles at the ceiling.

The shot bubbles will bounce off of the stage walls, but when they contact another bubble or the ceiling, they will stop in place. If a set of 3 or more bubbles is completed, that set will disappear, dropping any bubbles that were suspended from the ceiling by them as well. After a series of shots, the ceiling will drop down, bringing the remaining bubbles closer to the pointer. The goal is to clear the screen of bubbles before they reach the bottom line of the stage.

Players can tackle a single player mode or compete against friends in a 2-player vs. mode. Each competitor is in control of their own screen and pointer, and every time either player removes a large group of bubbles, some of the removed bubbles are transferred to the other player’s screen.

95926.name: Atari Anthology
95926.description:
From the Back of the Box:
85 Games that Started a Revolution!

Step back in time to the days of the video arcades and original in-home entertainment with this all-time greatest collection of authentic Atari titles. Each game is totally addictive, with all of the same fast action, sights and sounds you remember.

This collection contains the games:


Atari arcade games*****






Asteroids
Asteroids Deluxe
Battlezone
Black Widow
Centipede
Crystal Castles
Gravitar

Major Havoc
Millipede

Atari 2600 games*****






3-D Tic-Tac-Toe
A Game of Concentration (Windows only)
Adventure
Air-Sea Battle
Asteroids
Atari Video Cube (PS2 and Xbox only)
Backgammon (PS2 and Xbox only)
BASIC Programming (Windows only)
Battlezone
Blackjack
Bowling
Breakout
Canyon Bomber
Casino
Centipede
Circus Atari

Combat
Crystal Castles
Demons to Diamonds
Desert Falcon
Dodge 'Em
Double Dunk
Flag Capture
Football
Fun With Numbers
Golf
Gravitar
Hangman (PS2 and Xbox only)
Haunted House
Home Run
Human Cannonball
Math Grand Prix
Maze Craze
Millipede

Missile Command
Night Driver
Off the Wall
