RealSports Baseball
Realsports Football
RealSports Tennis
RealSports Volleyball
Sky Diver
Slot Machine
Slot Racers
Space War
Sprintmaster
Star Raiders
Star Ship
Steeplechase
Stellar Track
Street Racer
Submarine Commander
Super Baseball
Super Breakout
Super Football
Surround
Swordquest: Earthworld
Swordquest: Fireworld
Swordquest: Waterworld
Video Checkers
Video Chess
Video Olympics
Video Pinball
Yars' Revenge

95927.name: Bust-a-Move 2
95927.description:
User Summary

Bust-a-Move 2 is the first sequel to the bubble bursting game Bust-a-Move. The game builds on the basic gameplay of the first title, including a deeper single player mode and a more elaborate multiplayer.

The player’s goal is to clear the screen by eliminating all the bubbles off the ceiling. They do so by shooting multicoloured bubbles from their pointer at the bottom of the play area, aiming to create sets of like-coloured bubbles. When a set of 3 or more identically coloured bubbles is created, that set disappears and drops any bubbles they were supporting. The new single player mode let’s players choose their next 5 stages from 2 sets of maps, leading to more varied gameplay and different endings. The multiplayer mode has been expanded to a tournament format that includes games against the computer.

The home ports of the game included additional features including a time trial mode that challenges the player to complete stages as quickly as possible and a set of alternate levels

95928.name: Bust-a-Move 3
95928.description:
User Summary

Bust-a-Move 3 is the third game in the Bust-a-Move series of matching bubbles. The goal of the game is to clear the playscreen by matching sets of three or more bubbles using the pointer launcher.

Instead of having the ceiling lower the bubbles as the game progresses, Bust-a-Move 3 employs a series of nodes that have bubbles suspended from them. When a node is completely cleared of bubbles, it disappears. The stage is cleared when all of the nodes have been eliminated. New stage designs have also been introduced to vary gameplay, including an endurance playfield that is several lengths of the screen in height. Rainbow bubbles have also been introduced, which will change colours when a nearby bubble is burst.

A two player versus mode is included that allows players to face off against each other to determine who can clear their screen faster.

95929.name: Spirax
95929.description:
Spirax is played on a board of concentric circles. The circles have paths connecting them which spiral inwards towards the central vortex.

Each player has four pieces which start along one spiral. Each turn the pieces can be moved by allocating movement points, with movement becoming more expensive the closer a piece is to the vortex. In addition, on some turns every piece on the board will move one space closer to the vortex.

Pieces can attack others by moving over them. The result of a successful attack is to send the defending piece in towards the vortex. Pieces which enter the vortex re-appear along the edge. The object of the game is to make a certain number of successful attacks.

95930.name: Of Course You Realise This Means War
95930.description:
In this game, two players are theoretically nations competing in seven named areas. However, the game is highly abstracted, with each area represented by a track. Each player has seven cards which are secretly allocated to the areas each turn. The player allocating the higher card to an area (with the values wrapping around) moves a marker one space closer to their end of the track.

The object is to win four of the seven areas by getting their markers to your end of their tracks. Markers on shaded spaces move double, and markers reaching an end don't move again. Cards are also removed when this happens.

95931.name: Bust-a-Move Pocket

videogameversion.92773: English/European Neo Geo Pocket Color edition

95931.description:
User Summary

Bust-a-Move Pocket is a Neo Geo Pocket Color release in the Puzzle Bobble series. The game plays similarly to Bust-a-Move 2, but features its own unique stages. There are a few different game modes, including Puzzle Mode, Survivor Mode, and VS. Mode. Puzzle mode is the main single player story, and has the player progress through a number of different stages. The game includes a record system where the players with the fastest clear times for each stage are noted.

95932.name: Bust-a-Move Millennium
95932.description:
User Summary

Bust-a-Move Millennium is a portable entry in the Puzzle Bobble series. Players need to clear the screen of bubbles before they reach the bottom of the play area. There are five game modes available for play, including the classic Puzzle mode, a story mode, challenges and a multiplayer mode that allows players to compete against each other using a Link Cable.

The game uses similar mechanics to those in Bust-a-Move 4, including the pulley and chain reaction elements. Puzzle mode features all new stages to the series. The story mode has the player match up against a series of opponents as they battle through the ranks.

95933.name: Non-Trivial Quest
95933.description:
From the game publisher:

Non-Trivial Quest is "the IMPORTANT Game of Life" because it is an educational game that allows us to learn and discuss all the things that will help us to lead successful, happy, and healthy lives. The goal of the game is to make it interesting and fun to think, to remember, and to learn.

The game is played by each player selecting one of the 6 categories of trivia questions based on the dice results of 2 six-sided dice. If the player provides the correct answer, their pawn pieces moves towards the finish line.

A few variations of the game allow for more complex scoring to either increase or decrease the game speed.

95934.description:
In Bibi & Tina: Das große Springreiten players want to be the first to get their horse and its rider to the end of the track.

On your turn, roll the die, then either move forward that many spaces (stopping if you reach a barrier) or make that many attempts to leap over the barrier standing in front of your horse. To make your horse jump, lure it with the magnetic hay so that it hops the barrier. If you have a good "trigger" finger, you'll shoot to the finish line first...
95934.name: Bibi & Tina: Das große Springreiten

95935.description:
In Schmidts Katze you want to be the cat who tracks down five mice before any of the other felines in the household.

To set up the game, place seven of the mice tokens – each of which is different – in seven of the eight slots around the game board; place the eighth mouse on the edge of the box, which holds the game board inside it. Give each player a set of eight mouse tokens, then place the six cat paws around the box.

On a turn, roll the die. If you roll a number, move the cat figure around the box, then take whichever action is on the cat paw where you stop moving: Swap two mice, make a mouse go into (or come out of) hiding, or peek at a hidden mouse. If you roll the cat, spin the cat spinner on the game board, then try to be the first to lay out the proper mouse token from the eight in your hand. Whoever is first with the correct answer keeps thattoken cat side up; the first player with five such tokens wins.
95935.name: Schmidts Katze

95936.name: Providence: The Ecology
95936.description:
from the back of the book

The Ecology provides a detailed and exciting account of land, air and sea creatures. For adventurers who explore the fantastic realm of Providence, the Ecology includes the characteristics of over 50 wondrous beasts. Finally, this source book includes the new Tracker occupation, as well as rules for poisons and swarm attacks.

95937.name: Other Hands (Issue 9 - Apr 1995)
95937.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 9
April, 1995

Cover art by Sophia Caramagno and Patrick Wynne

Next Issue

95939.name: A Weak Pleasure
95939.description:
This is a short scenario for 4-6 characters of approximately 3rd or 4th rank, set in the western lands of the fief of Baron Aldred in the kingdom of Albion.

The adventure can be used in one of two ways. It was originally written for convention play, to demonstrate the Dragon Warriors game to people who hadn't played it before. If used this way, should be playable to conclusion in 2-4 hours, depending on the gamesmaster's pace and the players’ familiarity with the basics of roleplaying. A selection of pregenerated characters is provided at the end of the text.
Alternatively, you should be able to slot A Weak Pleasure into any other existing campaign, including published ones like Sleeping Gods. It can be transplanted to any location in Ellesland or the northern part of the world without too much difficulty.

95940.description:
In Katani pankur (Banker of Catan) is exclusive expansion for Catan, which was shared to participants of first Catan Championship in Estonia.

The Banker moves on different hexes allowing save the players's resources or collecting some profit from saved resources.

Components:

1 wooden Banker piece
4 plastic credit cards in 4 color
95940.name: Katani  pankur

95941.name: Olelo
95941.description:
Olelo is a Hawaiian word that means talking and telling, and that is just what the board game Olelo is all about getting to know better the people you are playing with!

A fun, easy, and engaging game, players move around the board by rolling the die, moving to a colored square, and answering questions, the first player to answer all his question cards wins!

Questions are all about Home and Family Life, School and Life Lessons, Jobs, Travel, Achievements and What Do You Think. And the Purple Silly Cards keep everyone laughing. A Children's Deck of Question Cards is included in every game.

Components:

1 Family Game Board,
5 Decks of Children's Cards,
5 Decks of Adult Cards,
1 Deck of Silly Cards,
6 Playing Pieces

95942.name: Forfeit
95942.description:
A family game of fun, knowledge, strategy and hilarious embarrassment!

The game of FORFEIT is to move around the board, answering questions correctly as you go to win 'letter tokens' to spell the word F O R F E I T and win the game.

The winner then decides on who will do the ultimate FORFEIT.

95943.description:
The object of the game is to roll winning combinations and cover the four slot circles at the bottom of the slot machine card.

The game can be won three different ways: Be the first player to cover the slot card circles; Be the last player with slot coins left to make bets or Roll six WIN's.
95943.name: Slotsadee

95944.name: Tailgate Touchdown: The Helmet Racing Game
95944.description:
Tailgate Touchdown is the ultimate party football game. The portable convenience of Tailgate Touchdown makes it a favorite for all sporting venues. At a tailgate or in your home, Tailgate Touchdown is easy to play, and designed to provide hours of fun for everyone involved. Get ready to step up to the field, and roll yourself into the end zone.

The object of Tailgate Touchdown is to acquire the most Touchdown Chips. Touchdown Chips are acquired by being the first player to "roll" into the end zone (score a touchdown) for each game.

Contents:

Game Board,
6 Assorted Helmets,
8 Dice,
Dice Rolling Cup,
Touchdown Chips.

95945.name: The Collector Game
95945.description:
If you are a collector of whatever or you are a lover of board games then you will love this game. It is a simple fast paced fun new board game. Go around the board and collect cash and collector items like Art, Antiques, Cars, Coins, Stamps, and Sports Items. Collect all six collector items to finish the game. Whoever finishes the game first doesn't mean they are the winner. The player that has the most value of collector cards and cash combined wins the game.

Contents:

1 Game Board
10 Antique Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Art Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Car Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Coin Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Sports Item Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Stamp Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
20 Option cards
Play Money Denominations $100, $500, $1000
6 Pawn Pieces
1 Die

95946.description:
The object of the game is to get to the "Fine" from the "D.C." first by answering as many theory questions as possible.

Roll the dice and move that many spaces and follow the instructions on the board.
95946.name: Music Frenzy: The Music Game

95947.name: Book of the Magnakai
95947.description:
Publisher blurb:

The secrets of the Magnakai will open before you once you read this book. Providing all the rules you will need for high level 'epic' play for the Lone Wolf Multiplayer Gamebook, the Book of the Magnakai details all new disciplines not just for accomplished Kai Lords, but for every new class introduced in Heroes of Magnamund as well.

Using the rules provided in this book, your characters will be able to face the greatest of the Darklords with a chance of survival, halt the progress of entire wars and have a powerful effect upon Magnamund.

95948.name: Littlest Pet Shop
95948.description:
From the back of the case:

Your Littlest Pet Shop comes to life!

Collect 32 of your favourite Littlest Pets; explore four unique worlds with your pets - a winter wonderland, a lush jungle, a pretty garden and Pet Plaza. Earn Kibble coins as you go on adventures, play the mini-games, and build your own Littlest Pet Shop.


In Fall 2008, the Littlest Pet Shop was released for Wii, Microsoft Windows, and Nintendo DS. For Nintendo DS, the game was initially released in three versions: Jungle, Garden and Winter, each with different pets. A fourth DS version, Spring, was released in March 2009. The Wii version has all the pets from the DS versions (excluding Spring edition). The PC version is the same as the Wii. The DS versions contained 20 pets and featured over 150 accessories for them.

Source: Wikipedia, "Littlest Pet Shop (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95950.name: OD&DITIES (Issue 13 - Feb 2010)
95950.description:
Table of Contents:

3, Editorial

3, My usual rant, making a return after a seven-year absence.

4, Building the Keep on the Borderlands
For when PCs decide that the time has finally come to settle down and raise an army.

7, Table: Twenty Reasons That Guard is on Patrol
No longer will lone guards be wandering aimlessly and lost. Unless you roll a 4.

8, Designing the Keep on the Borderlands
A guide to the design of a safe place for the PCs to hide...

10, Table: Twenty Things Found in a Kobold's Pocket
Let's face it, you've always wondered..

11, 'A Touch of Class': The Illusionist's
Now you see it, now you don't. This may be on page 11, but that could be a trick.

15, Introducing New Classes to the Campaign
For when the PC decides that their 5th-level Fighter just hasn't got 'it' any more.

16, 'Man's Best Friend'
Now an adventuring party can be accompanied by a pack of loyal companions.

20, 'Surviving the DM's Wrath': Party Formation
The best time to plan is before entering the dungeon..

23, Magical Miscellany
Three magical rings, belonging to a long-dead Illusionist.

24, Mr. B's Last Word
Who is he? No-one's telling. All I know is that he is paid in Scotch.

95951.name: Bankers Revenge
95951.description:
Build your score by playing all the colored money cards from your hand into your bank before your opponents do. Players who reach one million dollars in their score, receive a millionaire token! The player to get 3 millionaire tokens first wins the game!

2 decks of cards (Action & Money Decks) and special Bankers Revenge dice keep this edge-of-your-seat game play rolling at a fast pace! The Action deck of cards is packed with countless challenges, including a wide variety of scenarios such as lotteries, playing stock markets, robbing banks and much, much more!

95952.name: OD&DITIES (Issue 14 - Mar 2010)
95952.description:
Table of Contents:

3,Editorial
Another one of my little rants..

4, The Many-Tentacled Beast
The Beast That Will Not Die – The Thieves' Guild

8, Magical Miscellany: The Keys of Dolfa
A very special set of keys, if one can unlock their powers...

9, The Trial of Skill
Making sure the Thief gets a chance to try out those special skills of his.

13, Expended Grimoire
The first of a new series, this issue taking a look at the humble 'magic missile'.

15, Playing the Godfather
So, you want to start your own guild, do you?

19, Unusual Enemies
Confound your players with some of the less-used monsters in the book.

20, A Touch of Class: The Puppeteer
An examination of a potentially deadly.(buzz)..the best class in the world!

24, Mr. B's Last Word
Yes, he's back again. I made the mistake of leaving a bottle fo Scotch on my window ledge, and this article was there in its stead..

95953.name: OD&DITIES (Issue 15 - Apr 2010)
95953.description:
Table of Contents:

3, Editorial, R. E. B. Tongue
OK, feel free to skip it. Your loss.

4, A Touch of Class: The Elementalist, R. E. B. Tongue
Harnessing the primal forces of nature itself to do your bidding.

12, Walking the Dusty Trail, R. E. B. Tongue
What will your players find on the highways and byways of your world?

14, Resurrection: To Die or Not to Die, Dale Cameron
When you aren't quite ready for the last, great adventure...

18, Alternate Alignments, R. E. B. Tongue
Another option for the Alignment Wars

19, Elemental Beasts, R. E. B. Tongue
A collection of mysterious elemental, and quasi-elemental beasts...

23, 'X' Marks the Spot, R. E. B. Tongue
What to do when you need a Treasure Map on the fly.

25, Mr. B's Last Word, Mr. B
He's back again. I'm running out of Scotch, though...

95955.name: Oubliette (Issue 1 - Apr 2010)

rpgissuearticle.94932: Alternative Subdual Rules for Labyrinth Lord

95955.description:
Table of Contents:

3, Editorial

3, Monster Club #1

4, Halfling Proof Fence
A Labyrinth Lord adventure for 26 nasty characters.

14, Inheritance
Parts 1 & 2, A fantasy campaign setting.

17, Developing House Rules for Labyrinth Lord

18, Sample House Rules for Labyrinth Lord

19, Alternative Subdual Rules for Labyrinth Lord
Don't just kill things: knock them out, torture them, then kill them.

20, Improvised Traps
Fun trap ideas for characters to try at home.

23, Monster Club #2

24, Good Shop / Bad Shop
Meet The Rentalist, mysterious purveyor of powerful artefacts.

26, What's in the Oubliette?
Reviews of: The Turntracker, Dead Tower Island and Caprica.

27, Mouse Watch

28, The Song of Sithakk
Our Epic Dwarven Serial. Part I: The Warrior.

32, PDF Heroes
Printable cardboard figures for use with this month's adventure.

95956.name: Artè
95956.description:
In Arté, the players represent important tycoons of the 19th century, who love medieval art and architechture.

To follow their passion, they find in Alfredo d’Andrade the perfect collaborator to restore old buildings or edify new ones, respecting the style of former centuries.

During the game, you will challenge your friends in a hard competition to find money, materials and workers to realize the artworks you desire, by asking new projects to d’Andrade, and cooperating with architechts, artists or builders.

Use at best the available actions to realize the best artworks and gain more victory points than your opponents.

The Play of the Game

Arté is played over a series of rounds. During each round, every player will take turns assigning his or her Tycoon (and possibly Foreman) to a circle on the Activity Board. Rounds continue in this way until a player completes his or her last Project and there are no more Project Tiles left in the stack.

Starting in the Second Round, on your turn you must move your Tycoon Pawn to a different empty circle on the left side of the Activity Board. You cannot leave your Tycoon on the same
circle, or on another circle in the same row!

If you have activated your Foreman, you must place it on an empty circle on the right side of the Activity Board - or move it to a different circle if it is already on the board - on your turn.

You may use your Tycoon and your Foreman in any order you choose each turn.
When you place your Tycoon Pawn or Foreman Pawn on a circle, you immediately follow the instructions on the space to the right of your chosen circle.

After you complete any Tycoon or Foreman actions on your turn, you may spend Resources to complete any Projects you are working on. Once all players have had a turn, the round
ends and a new round can begin.

The End of the game

If you have no incomplete (face up) Project Tiles in front of you at any point during your turn, and there are no more Project Tiles left in the stack for you to draw, the game will come to an end. Finish playing your turn as normal.

This is your final turn for the game. Each of the other players then takes one final turn. After all players have completed their final turns, the game is over and it’s time to add up your score!

95957.name: Scrabble Interactive 2007
95957.description:
From the 2007 edition game box:

Beginner or Expert - Sharpen your Scrabble skills and become the best!

The Scrabble 2007 Edition uses the Collins Official Scrabble Dictionary, so you can easliy check your words and play just like the original Scrabble!

95958.name: Ridge Racer 3D
95958.description:
Ridge Racer 3D (リッジレーサー3D, Rijji Rēsā 3D) is a racing video game for the Nintendo 3DS which is developed by Namco Bandai Games. First images of the game were leaked in early November 2010, and Namco confirmed that the video game was going to be released later on in 2011. However, it was later revealed to be a launch title, and was released in Japan on February 26, 2011 and in North America on March 22, 2011, five days prior to the launch of the Nintendo 3DS itself in that region. Ridge Racer 3D is also set to be released in Europe on March 25.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ridge Racer 3D", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95959.name: Infinity Lounge
95959.description:
from the introduction:
The Infinity Lounge is a science fiction themed mini-
adventure for low to moderate level Villains and Vigilantes characters. It is a one-off affair, potentially usable in any campaign. The characters will find themselves in a fix –- imprisoned in an artificial habitat and treated as lab animals -- that should be familiar to readers of science fiction.

comment
this is a free PDF

95960.name: The Fallout (updated)
95960.description:
release blurb:

Nathan Russell’s playset The Fallout transports the crazed Fiasco action to a familiar, radiation-soaked future. Mutants, motorcycle gangs and Rami’s Rat Kabobs are the sauce, but the meat is still the same – sex, greed, and deep stupidity.

95961.name: Beyond the Mountains of Magnatz
95961.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Follow in the Footsteps of Fools, with this picaresque series of adventures for the Dying Earth, featuring the exploits of Cugel-level characters.

Part Four: Beyond The Mountains of Magnatz

You may have thought your adventurous rogues were trapped in the barren north until the sun went dark. But no, the former Lords of Cil are on the move again. Initially reprising their roles as the heralded Lords, the adventurers must:


Wriggle out of a tight spot as sacrifices to the demon Magnatz
Progress through a series of greater and lesser challenges, both natural & magical, as they struggle across the savage mountains
Explore strange hospitality in the valley of the mighty Pharesm
And survive lands populated by an army of basilisks, before at last winning free to the civilized lands of the east


The next (and final) publication in this series ("And Thence to Almery") wraps it all up. It will carry the PCs from the Northern Scamander, through Erze Damath, and via Old Romarth back to Azenomei and an epic confrontation with Iucounu the Laughing Magician. The previous adventures in the series are All's Fair at Azenomei, Strangers in Saskervoy and Lords of Cil.

95962.name: Nashka's Lair
95962.description:
Front cover blurb:
Another day, another adventure, another swarm of orcs breaking off to start a rival tribe. Nashka’s swarm, though admittedly small, has found an abandoned dwarven redoubt to hole up in while they prepare to recruit—and a useful source of slave labour. Now he’s been raiding other dungeons and preparing to make inroads against the local thorps . . .

95963.name: Magister (Issue 36 - Sep 1992)
95963.description:
Magister
Nummer 36 - september 1992
Issue 36 - September 1992

Cover art by Arno Vriends

95964.name: Maxim 'Up!
95964.description:
(from the box)
Maxim 'Up! could be the new favourite game in house, due to the colourfull blocks, the easy scoring and the exciting and impredictable gameplay!

Make chains with the blocks to form words. Change words by stacking blocks. You steal a word when you place the top-most block. But the stacks grow, so the winning hand changes continuously. You know the most words when the last blocks are played? then you win!

In your turn, either, take a few letters from your personal supply, and form a word with it. Then add it to the growing game board. Like this, some sort of cross-word-board will grow.

You can also play your letters on top of other players' words, to form new words. This way, you can steal their words, and steal their points.
At the end of the game, you see for each word on the board who has played the highest letter of that word, and score a point for each word you own. The person with the highest number of words wins the game!

95965.name: Retro Role-Playing Realms
95965.description:
Author's Introduction:

I’m a huge fan of the Tunnels & Trolls role-playing game, particularly the 4th edition of the rules; I like to think of it as the pre-inflation period of Tunnels and Trolls. Weapons have less dice to juggle and armour has more manageable ratings. Generally speaking, the smaller numbers lead to a less stressful GM experience (for me at least).
This booklet represents a condensed version of the basic rules of play - a selection of bits and pieces culled from editions 4, 5 and 7 shuffled to taste, slightly different but still very much T&T. I call it R3 or Retro Role-playing Realms!
This text assumes that you are familiar with role-playing games in general and T&T in particular. If you aren’t consult your friendly internet.
A reminder: T&T is the creation of one Ken St. Andre who continues to actively develop the game. It is presently in print (version 7.5) and growing in popularity once more, with very good reason.

95966.name: Temple of the Ghoul

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

95966.description:
Cover blurb:

An OSRIC-Compatible Adventure Designed for a Party of 3 to 5, Levels 1–2

Something has been pillaging farms and leaving no living thing behind. Merchants have disappeared on the roads and the Tinker now refuses to make his circuit. All of this trouble started when a party of adventurers went to investigate the old temple on the hill. Five adventurers went up the hill to Lilanora’s temple and never returned. Who will follow those foolhardy five and discover what danger lies beneath the temple ruins?

95967.name: Magister (Issue 37 - Nov 1992)

rpgissuearticle.50864: Alignment: een code voor goed en kwaad

95967.description:
Magister
Nummer 37 - november 1992
Issue 37 - November 1992

Cover by Ming-Hua Kao

95968.name: The Gray Book
95968.description:
From the Introduction:

I started out by trying to compile all the rules presented in the Dungeons & Dragons® rules and supplements into one cohesive whole. Based on Bruce Mohler’s prior work, I aimed to present this book as if it were the book that Eric Holmes had written all along, before severe editing pared down the rules to the 48 pages that exist today. The largest difference between Bruce’s work, this work, and the original rules is the absence of both the rather poor Greg Bell art, and references/dependencies to Chainmail®. A major goal was to complete what Bruce had started, but as work progressed, the book was steadily becoming less a "Dungeons & Dragons compilation" and more of an "Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Light".

95969.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Isle of Ravens is the fourth Chapter Pack in the Secrets of Oldtown expansion cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! Featuring 60 never-before-seen cards (three copies each of 20 unique cards) designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame, this exciting expansion adds more to the developing Maester and Chain themes, as well as to the rest of Westeros' Great Houses.

Introducing new characters to the LCG environment like Baelor Blacktyde and Guardian Wolf, as well as some powerful new event cards like The Weasel's Way and Old Intrigues, The Isle of Ravens will add new dimensions to your A Game of Thrones experience.

This Chapter Pack also features new additions to the developing Chain theme of attachments, including Steel Link and Gold Link - more tools for your Maesters' offense. The Isle of Ravens adds more variety to each House’s arsenal, including support for House Lannister's intrigue challenges through Spidercraft, more powerful power challenges for House Baratheon through Stormlands Bastard, cheaper Armies for House Targaryen, and much more!
95969.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Isle of Ravens

39953.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game

95970.name: Dream Shift
95970.description:
Dream Shift is a solo print-and-play card game. It is designed to be quick and fun.

In Dream Shift, the player must battle his or her nightmares in a constantly shifting dream world. Each dream setting or nightmare is a manifestation of the dreamer's subconscious attempting to communicate with the conscious mind in order to resolve various issues. Maybe the dreamer needs to learn something about him- or herself. Perhaps he or she has some fear or guilt that must be overcome. The Dream deck contains both Setting and Nightmare cards. The player begins with one Setting and one Nightmare, and must resolve issues presented by these cards in order to draw a new Dream card to replace either the Setting or the Nightmare.

To do this, the player has access to Power cards. These allow the player to resolve issues on the Setting and Nightmare cards, which will shift either the Setting or the Nightmare and present new issues to resolve. The player must make careful use of his or her Power cards to strategically draw additional Power cards or to shift the dream. The game ends when the Dream deck is empty, or when the player is "stuck" with no Power cards to resolve the issues presented.

95971.name: Tőzsde
95971.description: This game is a variation of his big predecessor Broker. A Hungarian company published this, with somewhat easier rules and 10 company places. The players to have bought and sell the shares of the 10 company. The players can modifiy with a dice roll the price of a company's shares down and with another dice roll the price of a company's shares upwards. The game consist 12 days. Every day a fortune sheet represents the foreign country changes.

95972.name: Pilotwings Resort
95972.description:
Pilotwings Resort (パイロットウイングス リゾート Pairotto Uingusu Rizōto) is a flight simulation video game for the Nintendo 3DS handheld game console, developed by Monster Games and published by Nintendo. It is a sequel to the 1990 Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) game Pilotwings and the 1996 Nintendo 64 game Pilotwings 64. Similarly to its predecessors, it was confirmed as a launch title in North America and Europe. In Japan, Australia, and New Zealand it was released on April 14, 2011.

Pilotwings Resort contains two modes of play. The first, "Free Flight Mode", allows the player to freely explore Wuhu Island using any type of aircraft. Various collectible such as balloons and stunt rings can be picked up to unlock certain features in the game, but there is a time limit. The second, "Mission Flight Mode", requires the player to complete a series of objectives within certain parameters. These increasingly difficult missions span Training, Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum and Diamond classes. The player is graded between one and three stars on their performance in each mission.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pilotwings Resort," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95973.name: Full House Poker
95973.description:
Go all-in with Full House Poker! Play Texas Hold 'Em against your friends and thousands of players worldwide, and bring your personality to the table with unique tells and unlockables galore. Save your player progression and winnings between sessions as you increase the stakes and make your mark as a Full House Poker pro!

Source: The Publisher Website.

95974.name: Theodore Tugboat Rootin' Tootin' Card Game
95974.description:
"Players flip their cards over one at a time. Who sees the pair of matching cards? Quick! Toot the tooter so you can claim the pair! But be sure they are identical matches before you toot. If you make a mistake, you'll have to hand your cards over to your opponents. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!"

If you successfully toot the tooter you win all discarded piles and add them to your play stack. Once someone runs out of play cards the game ends and whoever has the most cards wins.

The game comes with an electronic bell and 54 large cards.

The game uses the characters from the Canadian based childrens television series.

Has the Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Best Toy Award Gold Seal.

95975.name: Super Turrican 2
95975.description:
Super Turrican 2 featured more action than the first part and used Dolby Pro-Logic surround sound as well as many "Mode 7" effects, but sacrificed the big levels of the original Turrican games. The major addition is a grappling arm, similar to that used in Bionic Commando, which can be used to swing between platforms and grab power-ups. The game was released on the Virtual Console in North America on September 29, 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Turrican", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95976.name: Triggerheart Exelica
95976.description:
Triggerheart Exelica​ (トリガーハート エグゼリカ Torigā Hāto Eguzerika, spelled Trigger Heart Exelica in Japan) is a shoot 'em up by Warashi, makers of the Sega Saturn shooting game Shienryu. It was released in Japanese arcades in early 2006. The game runs on Sega's Naomi hardware. It is the last Sega published release for the Dreamcast.

The game involves playing 1 of 2 anthropomorphic fighters to battle against 5 stages of enemy ships. Exelica specializes in wide area attacks, while Crueltear uses concentrated front shots. Players can fire anchors to catch enemy ships, then use the caught unit as a shield or throw it to inflict more damage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Triggerheart Exelica", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95977.name: Sonic Colors (Nintendo DS)
95977.description:
From the back cover of the US Nintendo DS edition

"Welcome to Dr. Eggman's Incredible Interstellar Amusement Park!

Can Sonic's new Color Powers stop Dr. Eggman's plans to take over the universe, and free the captured alien Wisps from his cosmic theme park?

New powers access hidden areas... and perform new moves!

Adrenaline pumping super speed!

Explore new environments!

Also race against your friends!"

"The Nintendo DS version is largely a side-scroller that takes advantage of the dual screens of the handheld, similar to the Sonic Rush DS games."

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Colors", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95978.name: Cratermaze
95978.description:
In the game, the hero Opi is traveling through time with four of his friends when they are captured by the villain Zenzombie. He travels through various eras in time (modern, samurai, future, World War II and prehistory), collecting treasure to open doors to the next era, and kills enemies by digging holes and burying the enemies. Every 15 of the game's 60 levels, Opi rescues one of his friends. Levels 30 and 60 are boss levels where an enormous enemy floats around the screen who can kill Opi with a single touch.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cratermaze", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

95979.name: Espaço 235
95979.description:
Each player or team controls a squad of 3 spaceships, the goal is to lead them to a trip since the launching base to the finishing point - 235. The route is full of difficulties and hitches that retard or blocks the headway of the ships.
On the other hand, there are a lot of favorable circumstances that accelerates the progress of the ships to the objective.
The luck factor and decision skill of the O.C. (Operational Commander) depends the success and the prizes to get.
The game finishes when a O.C. can park, in the base Espaço 235 (Space 235), the maximum of the ships that are in playing. This means that, if each O.C. has 3 ships, the winner will be the first to reach the objective with 3 ships. And so successively , by decreasing order.

95980.name: Panzer Campaigns: Tunisia '43
95980.description:
Overview

Toward the end of 1942, the German High Command saw that the tide was turning in the war. On the East Front, von Paulus was surrounded in Stalingrad. Rommel had been defeated at El Alamein in Egypt and, in October, was retreating with his battered army toward Tripoli. Now the Americans were making their presence felt by landing at various points in Morocco and Algeria, threatening the Axis position in Africa from the rear. The Germans rushed forces by air and sea to Tunisia to counter the threat. They arrived just in time, as the lead elements of the allied forces made their drive to capture Tunis by Christmas 1942. Then the tide turned with the weather, the roads turned to mud tracks and the Allied drive was stalled. Wedged between the on-coming Allied Armies of Algeria and Egypt, a scratch force of powerful Germans panzers, intermixed with available infantry replacement forces, regained the initiative through February, inflicting serious losses on green US forces facing battle against a determined enemy for the first time. But this was only to delay the inevitable loss of the Axis presence in Africa.

Scenarios

Panzer Campaigns: Tunisia '43 covers the three major offensives during the period from late November through May 1943:

-The Race to Tunis - Nov 25th to Dec 9th
-The Germans Kasserine Offensive - Feb 14th to Feb 21st
-The End in Africa - April 22nd to May 6th

All the Major Battles covered Chouigui, Sidi bou Zid, Kasserine, Operation Ochsenkopf, Flanking the Mareth Line and El Guettar to name a few. A total of 34 scenarios are included plus a map-viewer scenario so you can see the entire map at one time.

Game features include:

-Game scale is 1 hex = 1 km, 1 turn = 2 hours, with battalion and company size units.
-Full Map of Tunisia covering 144,000 sq km from the Mareth Line in the southeast and as far west as Tebessa on the west side of the West Dorsal mountain range.
-Three OOBs covering each period of the fighting in Tunisia covering changes in the organization of the units as well as equipment upgrades (and downgrades –in the case of US Sherman losses being replaced with M3 Lee tanks).
-Extensive Designer Notes.

Tunisia '43 provides multiple play options including play against the computer AI, Play by E-mail (PBEM), LAN & Internet "live" play, and two player hotseat.


Changes in the Panzer Campaign series new for Tunisia '43:

-Added new Night Move Disruption parameter data value which determines probability of night movement by non-rail and non-travel or non-road movement units causing Disruption.

-Added ability to toggle Movement Sounds off and on (in Settings Menu).

Source: The Publisher Website.

95981.name: Panzer Campaigns: Mius '43
95981.description:
User Summary:

This is a full demo game for John Tiller's Panzer Campaigns series.

It is available free fo charge from the John Tiller Software site (as well as elsewhere, as JTS has allowed for free distribution of this title). It is about 150 mb.

This title represents a relatively (by Panzer Camapaigns' stadards) section of the Russian fron along the Mius River in 1943.

95982.name: The Nameless City (Whitebox Rules)
95982.description:
Website blurb:
In the world there are ancient, degenerated remnants still living, survivals from unimaginable antiquity. What happens when the adventurers stumble across one of these deadly places? There must be treasure untold for those willing to brave the long-forgotten perils of ... The Nameless City. This module by Alphonso Warden is loosely based upon the eponymous short story by HP Lovecraft, and is designed for characters level 7-10.

The module is available for both Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox and Swords & Wizardry Complete Rules and Freestyle (Core) Rules. If you're going to use it with another old-school system, it's obviously going to be compatible, but use the Complete/Freestyle version for this: the hit dice and other information will be closer to other systems than WhiteBox.

User Summary:
The differences between the two editions of this module are statblocks, some rules and cover design.

95983.description:
This is a trick-taking game for the Decktet. The game was first published in the Decktet Book.

The player who leads a trick with a two-suited card picks one of the card's two suits, and other players must follow that suit. However, the second suit on a card might still be trump - so it's possible to follow non-trump suit and trump in at the same time.

Bidding is in broad categories, with the possible bids being none of the tricks, some of the tricks, or most of the tricks.
95983.name: Nonesuch

95984.name: Fantasy Workshop
95984.description:
From the back of the book:

I Fantasy Workshop genoplives den urgamle leg: at skabe og fortælle historier for hinanden - her i en moderne spilform som kollektiv historiefortælling! Alle kan være med, også børn. Fantasy Workshop er sjov og spændende og udvikler fantasien. Kan spilles på mange niveauer og bruges som redskab i utallige skabende processer. Verden er fuld af gode historier. De historier du selv er med til at skabe glemmer du aldrig. Vær med i legen, oplev fællesskabet i Fantasy Workshop.

In Fantasy Workshop is revived the immemorial game of creating and telling each other stories - in a modern version this time as collective story-telling! It is a game for everybody, including children. Fantasy Workshop is fun and excitement and it improves your imagination. Fantasy Workshop can be played on many levels, and can be used as a tool in countless creative processes. The world is full of good stories. You will never forget the stories you make up yourself. Join in the game and experience the community spirit of Fantasy Workshop.

95985.name: The Forgotten City of Al-Arin
95985.description:
Module introduction:
Tharizdun is breaking free of his ancient bonds! In league with Teronus, a Gargantuan Dragon, he is systematically destroying the Power Gems of Anu.
This adventure is suitable for 6-12 characters of levels 10-14. Use of 1st Edition AD&D Rules is recommended, with additional use of UNEARTHED ARCANA encouraged.

User comment:
This module is available as a free download from Dragonsfoot.org

95986.name: Red Tam's Bones
95986.description:
Website blurb:
Can you find the bones of Red Tam, the notorious Bard? An adventure for 5 to 8 characters of levels 3 - 5.

95987.name: Purgatory: Special Edition
95987.description:
from the back of the book

The beginning of the end is here, and no one is ready...

Armageddon is coming early, and no one is prepared.
Heaven is frantically trying to assemble its forces.
Hell is praying for an impossible victory over God.
The UN is desperately trying to stop a global disaster.
The world's secret societies are almost ready to take over.

At the center of it all is a group of newly reborn individuals called the Children of Purgatory. They are either the key to earth's salvation, or the heralds of it's destruction.

You have to stop Armageddon.

In Purgatory, you are a Penitent, caught up in a web of conspiracy and prophecy, rapidly hurtling towards the end of the world. You only have a short time to find the truth, defeat your enemies, and stop the end of the world...

Are you ready?

95988.name: Imperial Town of Tell Qa (Free RPG Day 2007 Edition)
95988.description:
From The Front Page

Looking for adventure? Don’t know where to start? Here’s an easy method. Flip through the booklet and pick a location at random. This is where the adventure begins, in the middle of the action. Look over the description of the location and its occupants, and consider the nature of the adventurers. Perhaps the NPCs seek to employ the adventurers — they need a treasure recovered, or an enemy silenced. Maybe the adventurers seek goods or information at the establishment. If you are still stumped, pick another establishment at random, and develop a connection between the two and the adventurers. Perhaps the Grocer (#48) has a cart of odd goods to deliver to the Bazaar (#20), and wants to hire guards… why? What is he really delivering that needs such protection? Or maybe the adventurers start out at the Town Jail (#55) — are they prisoners, visitors, guards, or perhaps they are bounty hunters? You decide. If the adventurers start in the Slave Market, they could be slaves being auctioned off, or passers–by who see a friend or ally being sold. The possibilities are endless; just pick a location and go!

Publisher Blurb

Imperial Town of Tell Qa is designed to be used with the upcoming Valley of the Dead Queens Sandbox Module Series, as well as the forthcoming Environs of Tell Qa Wilderness Series. The whole can be combined into a massive campaign that provides countless hours of adventure!

user comment
This booklet differs from the Imperial Town of Tell Qa PDF in that it does not have the 20 encounters included in the PDF.

95989.name: The Banked Swamp
95989.description:
Title page:
A 1st Edition Wilderness Adventure for Low-Level Parties

Website blurb:
A thick mist, a splash heard in the distance, the lure of treasures untold... Welcome to The Banked Swamp, an adventure for a low-level party, that can be dropped into nearly any campaign.

95990.name: Ruins of the White Watch
95990.description:
Website blurb:
Centuries ago the White Watch defended the land. Then it fell and it's location was lost... until now. Who knows what treasures could be found in its depths. An adventure for a party of 6, of levels 5 to 8.

95991.name: The Village of Rashtan
95991.description:
Front cover:
The sleepy hamlet of Rashtan has experienced a boom, and has transformed into a bustling village overnight. Come meet the people of Rashtan and their places of business.

from the Introduction:
This supplement provides information for the Village of Rashtan, which is used as a setting in the HM module series. However it can easily be used as a village in any campaign world.

95992.name: Other Hands (Issue 10/11 - Nov 1995)
95992.description:
Previous Issue

Other Hands
Issue 10/11
November, 1995

Cover art by Sophia Caramagno, Alina Nemirova, and Patrick Wynne

Next Issue

95993.name: The Hunt for Istan
95993.description:
Website blurb:
This follow-up adventure to "The Disappearance of Harold the Hedge Mage" sees the PCs return to the village of Rashtan. An AD&D adventure for 4-8 characters Level 2-4.

User comment:
This adventure and others in the series are available to download free of charge from Dragonsfoot.org

95994.name: The Chaos Halls of Belzir
95994.description:
Website blurb:
The ancient halls of the long lost wizardpriest of chaos Belzir have been rediscovered. Can the party discover its secrets and find his legendary amulet? A module for 4-6 characters of levels 4-6.

User comment:
This adventure and others in the series are available to download free of charge from Dragonsfoot.org

95995.name: Pop goes the Meazel
95995.description:
Website blurb:
A thief is loose in the town of Rashtan, can you stop them? This module is designed for four to six players of novice or intermediate skill using characters of first level.

User comment:
This adventure and others in the series are available to download free of charge from Dragonsfoot.org

95996.name: Dragons
95996.description:
User Summary
Sourcebook on the dragons of Barsaive.

It is largely written from the perspective of the great dragon Vasdenjas. It opens with general dragon lore and discussion of the common dragon types, then discusses individually the nature and goals of the great dragons of Barsaive and concludes with game information including statistics for the common dragon types and information on dragon powers and magic.

This book was in production when FASA ended their Earthdawn line. FASA made the text layout available on their website as a pdf file. Most of this book has been incorporated into later editions of Earthdawn.

95997.name: Isensan's Secret
95997.description:
Cover blurb:
The troubles in Rashtan have been caused by the mysterious Isensan, can the party discover his secrets and stop his wicked plans in time?

Website blurb:
The story of HM1 (The Disappearance of Harold the Hedge Mage) and HM2 (The Hunt for Istan) continues in this new adventure. For four to six characters of levels six to eight.

User comment:
This adventure and others in the series are available to download free of charge from Dragonsfoot.org

95998.name: The Lendore Isles Companion
95998.description:
Title Page:
Rulings, Suggestions, Information and Calendar,
Including a Suggested Party with their Introduction

95999.name: The Mad Demigod's Castle
95999.description:
Cover blurb:
The dungeon level presented here can be used as a standalone introductory level in any campaign world but was specifically designed to be compatible with the fan made Castle of the Mad Archmage material produced by Joseph Bloch. Enjoy, and may your adventures inside the dungeons of the castle be memorable ones.

User comment:
This is designed for use with Castle of the Mad Archmage™.

96000.name: The Howling Hills
96000.description:
Cover blurb:
Far to the North, in the upper reaches of the land of dread Iuz, lies one of the possible resting places of the ancient evil sorcerer, Acererak. Rumored to lie inside are deadly traps and terrific treasures, but all pales in comparison to the awesome power of the Demi-Lich.

This module is one of a series of adventures created in homage to the deadliest adventure ever created, The Tomb of Horrors! An Adventure of characters of level 10-14

User comment:
This module is available as a free download from Dragonsfoot.org.
